'' the beer was n't as fruity in taste as i expected it to be -- it has a typical wheat beer taste going down and finishes with a mild watermelon taste . this is a very drinkable summer beer .  amber color , almost red , slightly veiled . the head is decent , with some little bubbles , average compactness .  m - perfection ... everything a nitro induced beer should be ... smooth ... creamy ... lush ... light to medium bodied ... just the lightest carbonation ... could easily go down in one gulp ... d - this beer was made for a nitro-tap ... it adds so much to this otherwise slightly above average brew ... insanely quaffable ... i could drink this all night long ... the abv of just above 5 % also aids to the drinkability ...

amazing nose , properly dominated by minty , refreshing , floral coriander , which entwines itself together with the malts and hops to call to mind all sorts of things : licorice , cardamom , pine , cola , lime , and of course other coriander beers like hoegaarden and stone pa with coriander . herbal and verdant , though it tastes less interesting than it smells . fruity with berry qualities and a pleasant herbal echo of coriander and oregano . this is excellent , it 's remarkable how much more complex a beer can become with the addition of just one ingredient .  a : dark brown beer with medium tan head .  just the right level of sweetness , combined with a silky mouthfeel make this beer superbly drinkable .

it certainly does n't sound appetizing , but it smelled incredible . very complex even at this young age .  appearance : clear brown / burgandy in color with a 1 '' head that quickly falls to a spotty surface foam . no lacing develops .  m : luxurious and creamy , the carbonation is spot on .

the smell is very rich and very complex . a malt lining with chocolate mostly but roasted and coffee odors mix very nicely together . some limited alcohol smell but a very nice rich and smooth aroma .  a : pours out the classic hazy glowing orange of the best hefeweizens out there , the difference here being in the size and duration of the head which remains no more than an eighth of an inch or so above the beer for the duration of this particular review .  m - velvety smooth with just enough carbonation to give it an absolute perfect body and weight for the style .

unusual for an ipa ( which is a good thing to my nose ! ) t : citrus to the fore with grapefruit being the dominant flavour .  the color of this beer is a dark brown with a depth of crimson and a bit of haze .  this is a full bodied brew with a smooth , creamy feel to the mouth . it has a modest and enjoyable level of carbonation . very good feel about this brew and well made across the board .

original rating date : july 31 , 2008 unbelievably hoppy . strong grassy , herby smell . excellent , mouth-wetting aroma .  i love it ! a - not a very inspiring pour . the head disappears very quickly .  just has a silky smoothness that feels great going down .

amazingly sour nose , with notes of lemon zest , funky brett , and toasted biscuit malts . almost singes the nose hairs , but the sourness is delicately intoxicating .  $ 8 for bomber @ huck 's in spokane , wa poured to nb tulip a : pours an amber golden . 1/2 finger , egg white head diverts to 1/4 finger within a couple minutes . sporadic lacing along edges .  m - perfect carbonation .

exquisite . the taste follows and reminded me of the first great cup of flavored coffee i 've ever had in my life .  batch 005 poured from 375ml bottle into a new belgium globe/snifter a - deep red , dark w/ ruby highlights and a white head that quicly fades to a tight ring , no lacing .  perfect ! d : very easy drinking here .

pours a clear amber brown color with a 2 inch thick creamy tan head that took a while to go down ; smells like smoked bacon , charcoal , sweet roasted malt , chocolate and smoked hickory - a very unique odor which reminds me more of brunch than a beer . could be one of the best smelling beers i 've encountered if for nothing else it 's pleasant aroma and my association with having a nice meal at an outdoor event with a massive fire pit . a very good beer which is a nice one to sip and savor .  poured orange-amber , short creamy white head , short-lived , moderate lacing .  the mouthfeel is amazing . this beer completely coats my mouth and it 's unbeliavably creamy and smooth .

smell is big fruity , gummy hops with house flavor and scent . nice beer .  a - a burnt orange color with a nice yellow hue in the light . there is a very strong white head and a good amount of carbination/ s - a great front end of citrus , deep fruits , nuttyness and pepper that is mellowed out by a strong armoma of bourbon and vanilla smoothness .  mouthfeel is full and soft .

s - wow . great nose . chocolate , cherry , raisin , assorted fruit , floral , alcohol is in there ( but not offensive ) , plumb , and prune . very pleasant nose on this guy . quite inviting !  honey amber body with a lot of floaties/sediment topped by a rapidly decaying half finger of white level foam .  right off you notice the mouthfeel is perfect . medium bodied , well carbonated , crisp ... top notch .

i loved the smell wow you could open this brew 15ft from me and i would either believe i was at ihop or you just opened a sweetwater blue .  a : this was more coppery than amber . it poured with a thin , off-white head .  the mouthfeel is super smooth and creamy . unexpected , but could n't be better .

s : it smells like a damn donut . tons of chocolate . your mind connects the dots and you start getting glaze and powdered sugar . totally weird .  pristine orange , with a thin , white head that fades immediately , leaving some patches . little bit of lacing .  awesome mouthfeel , smooth yet still some substance that goes down easy . highly drinkable , may be my new go to beer for relaxing during the summer .
complex , hoppy nose : oily , piney , resiny .  12oz can into a weizen glass pours a slightly hazy pale orange with almost no head .  mouthfeel is silky , creamy , like a milkshake .

smells awesome- definite notes of banana and yeast ; in a word , i would describe it as inviting and delicious .  appearance : hazy light-yellow , with a light head that dissipates quickly .  mouthfeel is exceptionally smooth .

the aroma is purely intoxicating . the very pungent aroma of raspberries hits hard .  sampled on 6-9-07 pours the color of a black hole , with a fizzy head that fades to nothing .  great mouthfeel in particular .

d-the nose was awesome , the taste fell a little short of that but still extremely good pale ale .  truly intoxicating appearance : ruby brown with good clarity , a thin head of creamy coffee left no lace . rich , complex layers of taste , outrageous smell , more , give me more , more !  in fact , the mouthfeel is perfect and this is easily one of the more drinkable ipa 's i 've had in a while .

the aroma is amazing very spicy and kind of floral . the taste is drier than i would expect from the aroma but very pleasant . inhaling the aroma while sipping maximizes the effect of the sweet spiciness .  pours an opaque black color with a half finger fizzy head that disappears fairly quickly into nothing , the beer ends up looking like a cup of black coffee , no real carbonation can be seen . no lacing is left on my glass at all either .  m- amazingly smooth texture , the light carbonation yields a velvety smoothness .

even from the bottle it smells really good .  a - extremely clear golden yellow color with a large loose white head which had very little lacing and retention .  the body is really the main draw here . the oatmeal lends a silky texture that is just sublime and fits the palate perfectly . this also renders the beer very easy to drink , ensuring that a solo drinker can handle the entire large bottle .

appearance - yellowish orange clear beer with nice head and retention smell - a superb scent !  a dark ass beer with a dark ass head , not too thick , but it sticks around for a bit . not a lot in the way of lacing , though .  the mouthfeel is very nice .

hops are definitely the main event here with aromas of pineapple . citus hops follow . this is the best part of the beer .  a : a dark black body with ruby highlights and a couple of fingers of tan head . retention is poor and it quickly recedes to a quarter-inch film on top .  rich , creamy , thick , luscious mouthfeel !

definitely an excellent quaffer . quite pleasent . this beer has surpassed my expectations .  poured a golden straw into a tulip glass , with 2 fingers of billowy head that fairly quickly dissipates ( at least in my glass , there is still some on top of my wife 's ) . one of the better saisons that i 've had the opportunity to try- especially given the mediocre farmhouse ale 's i had at the clips of faith festival the day before yesterday .  m - perfect finish , pairs great with sushi .

the balance of sweet hops and buttery malt is absolutely fantastic . t : after such a splendid smell , a bit of a letdown . fruity malts dominate and buttered hops follow in force . d : perfectly lovely .  pours a very dark brown .  m - medium bodied , fantastic carbonation with a chewy feel to it that lingers .

that being said , this is a fantastic smelling beer . pineapple upside down cake all the way , with huge sweet bready notes , caramel , tart cherries , some raisin , and , implausibly , tropical fruit . the aroma really impressed me and i love bready beers .  source/serving : 12oz bottle s : bright and spicy with mint , musty clove , ginger , caramel , preserved passion fruit , a touch of sour apple white wine and bubblegum , perfect blend of spicy yeast and spicy hop flavor . one of the few beers where there are n't either too much or too little hops to balance with the yeast character . dark spices ( lots of clove ) hit the palette over a bed of dryness that starts moderate and gets dryer throughout the sip . finish is very hoppy with lingering caramel apple skin character and unyielding dry spiciness . notes : excellent beer with intense flavors that for me epitomize the ideal convergence of belgian and ipa characters through the use of spicy , herbal hops .  the mouthfeel is full for the style with a nice creamy texture .

this is an amazingly complex bouquet . t : light , sweet bready malts serve as the backbone , but in the back of the mouth there is a musty , earthy , dry , bitter/tartness of dried fruit , again coming off as a dry red wine .  above average lacing & below average head retention s : slight coffee & cocoa as this warms up t : coffee , a little chocolate & iron .  absolutely loved it .

quite lovely .  an attractive pour from a unique , 11 oz . displays a deep , ruby brown body with some copper colored highlights . the very pale beige head is somewhat thin and recedes rather quickly but is still substantial .  taste and mouthfeel absolutely amazing . this is one smooth , smooth beer that goes down great . best mouthfeel of any beer i 've ever had .

great lacing & average head retention s : medicinal notes , cinnamon & vanilla , just smells like christmas ! finishes with slight figgyness , medicinal & herbal notes along with some leafy hops mf : medium bodied & minimal carbonation drinks really easy , maybe not my favorite version of this , but very solid across the board . this one just gets better as it warms  it has a really light yellow color and lightly carbonated .  the 8 % does n't show at all , insanely smooth and creamy , very slick mouthfeel . excellent .

great smokey , coffee boozy smell that beckons you to try it . solid and full on the palate really great coffee notes overall an absolutely fantastic stout .  the nose is of american ipa and the head is quickly diminishing , though i may have poured it a bit cold .  mouthfeel is the huge winner . when the head is still around , you get the big , soft , almost downy foam you associate with a bubble bath . body has a presence but a definite silky , almost velvetiness feel to it that lightens the load at the same time .

no fooling ! smells delectable . intense maltiness that is just delicious to the nose . great stuff .  the cool bottle ( different than the one pictured here ) depicts an old civil war type bearded dude who looks like he takes beer very seriously . a very thin brown head lasts a minute or two and leaves a bubbly collar and some brown lacing on the glass .  m- this is the best part of this beer , the high carbonation and medium body seem perfect with the hop oiliness seeming to just rush past the tongue with a slight lingering in a refreshing `` drink more of me '' way d- the hops are a little strong but this is certainly enjoyable enough to go back to for a few more , just would n't make it my regular beer of choice

nice strong hop aroma . after about five minutes i really started picking up the caramel malts . incredible aroma . top notch . the aroma on this beer is rediculous . could use a little less carbonation and a some more hops in the taste .  12oz bottle into a tulip glass , some hotd after a long night of drinking . into the tulip glass , weizen comes out honey orange with some bronze highlights . a spritzy flimsy weak cap of popping bubbles comes up and then down .  the mouth feel is exceptional , but unlike the others this is n't drinkable .

the beer smells sour and woodsy , almost a smoked wood aroma . it smells so good , it 's surprising the flavors do n't follow through .  appearance : somewhat clear , with a sort of bronze-y/copper look to it when poured .  and the mouthfeel ? very , very smooth ! !

aroma : incredible ! dark as possible , whiskeyish , licorice , cherries , chocolatey , dark rum , mollasses , every sensation that ever wafted from an imperial stout is here in ample supply , more twisted and viscous and damnable as ever . rich , thick , sticky sweet , with a mouthfeel that does n't get quite as full as i like ... a bit too slick , with a finish that clings for a time , but not long enough .  on tap at toronado sf a : pours a light straw yellow with a small tight head .  m - just perfect . the carbonation dances on my tongue bringing out the flavors .

fantastic smelling brew , i ca n't keep my nose out of the glass !  a - really nice copper color .  i nice velvet that does n't coat like a barley wine but carries the carbonation on the palate . for some old and english an exceptional feel .

it was a fresh aroma , woody with vanilla in front ; roast malt in the back . i smelled this beer for awhile . taste- really nice balance between aroma hops and malt , with a hop bite at the end . not too hoppy at all .  the body was a rich golden color and clear of any sediment . the pithy two inches of white head faded with an audible sizzle .  smooth , full body with restrained carbonation , which accentuates the richness and decadence of the flavours .

first impression is the amazing floral aroma . this is what i really like about a good fresh ipa .  body is a pretty ruby-red meets tarnished bronze in color .  m : full-bodied with light carbonation . super smooth with an intensely thick and creamy texture .

insanely hoppy , fantastic aroma . mainly grassy , but some intensely bitter grapefruit rinds and a touch of peachiness and aspirin .  not much head at all in this one . considering the high abv i am a more understanding about the lack of head .  mouthfeel has a perfect sheen on it , and only at the end when the big alcohol presence is felt is there a tingling on the tongue .

the aroma is full of pine and citrus . spice , black pepper and some caramel get through , but definitely a hop bouquet bomber . crisp , creamy and smooth . overall , a great , hoppy ipa .  a : pours a cloudy yellow body , 2 '' of well-retaining off-white head .  mouthfeel- nice feel here . the beer is full bodied with nice light carbonation and feels oily and smooth . drinkability- really nice beer that is extremely easy drinking and pretty damned tasty .

smell : very flavorful and welcoming that carries warm potent notes of the flavors in the beer : chocolate , coffee , mocha , and hops . appearance : very , very dark with basically no head .  poured little or no head.the smell was strong of raspberries and cranberrries.you could smell the sweetness in the aroma , ,very inviting.the color was a ruby red and very cloudy with a swirl of sediment.looks like iced tea almost.crisp mouthfeel with a light body.i would of liked to try more but i only had one of these and the bottle cracked and chipped when i opened it.the first time that has happened to me.i was afraid glass splinters were in the beer so i didnt finish it.i hope to rate this again someday .  palate is really quite incredible- prickly at first , but subsides to become incredible smooth and unassuming .

what an amazing nose ; i 'm getting big notes of acid-sour , cherry , band-aid and even some impressions of hermes luggage . t - the taste is pretty nice , but not as dynamic as the nose . d - other than the rarity , pretty damn drinkable .  pours jet black with little carbonation . some lacing down the side of the tulip .  the rich roasted malt flavor is fantastic followed with toffee , caramel and maybe even a bit of roasted coffee ( though only a little bit ) m/d - mouthfeel is fantastic , quite rich .

smell : wonderfully balanced aroma . sweet , grainy malt backed by floral , slightly fruity hops .  dark brown , almost black color with some light shining through , no head and no lacing .  its viscous , yet has a tingly mouthfeel . nearly ideal for my tastes .

for the style , this is extreme and excellent , the arome alone hit the mark on the kona coffee and coconut .  reads limited edition 2000 , reviewed july 17 , 2005 pours a light golden color . ( not at all what i expected ) no head at all . if you are new to lambics , i feel this one can be enjoyed on quite a few levels .  mouthfeel is amazingly thick and chewy .

full of citrus fruits , yeast , spices and some good malt character . t : following the nose , there is a great mix of citrus fruits and malts . o : very pleasing brew , the flavours are great as is the aroma . the alcohol shines through a tad to much and it could lessen the bitterness .  old engine oil pours flat and almost black , with some lightening around the edges . the head quickly disappears and you are left with a very still beer .  crisp mouth feel with low carbonation . the smoothest beer i 've ever had - it was amazing .

aroma is great . roasty . i think i could just sit and smell this one all night .  appearance : pours an opaque black with a very thin mocha brown head that dissipates quickly leaving a ring around the glass and not a lot of lacing .  again , it 's very creamy making the mouthfeel outstanding , especially for the style .

aroma : blueberries ! first sniff was all fresh picked blueberries , very well done ! appearance : amber glass , with maybe a suggestion induced purple bruising , has excellent clarity and holds a thin head that manages some respectable lacing before dropping to a scant collar . no hops noted .  a : about a finger of white bubbly head dissipates rapidly into a body that is swampy and murky . it 's a very pale orangish-yellow that to me is not that appealing , though it may be appropriate for the style .  the delicate carbonation makes for a very lucious mouthfeel .

nice blast of citrus hops rushes out when you pop the top . scent , like i mentioned , is sticky hop oil .  pretty much copying my marron acidifie review here because the beers are so damn similar . dark reddish-brown topped by a thin head . carbonation is low and the body is cloudy and opaque .  m- full body with moderate carbonation and a nice wet finish .

it was not as pronounced as on the nose , but this was quite good . my brother always swore by yb & t in a can , but i never understood why until now .  poured dark brown with a thin white lacing covering the top of the beer . it was a little lighter in color then i expected and would have liked a little more head on it .  m smooth , thick and creamy with fairly low carbonation . almost like a nitro stout . amazing mouth-feel .

s : wonderful sour , wild yeast aroma . t : again , fantastic . berries emerge more in the taste than in the aroma .  pours a standard brown ale brown with a small white crown .  drinkability : incredible mouthfeel and easy to drink .

lovely ipa -- would definitely partake again .  poured into my ommegang tulip a- pours pitch black with a thin tan head that disappears pretty quickly .  mouth feel - i scored it a perfect , and it is well done .

absolutely fantastic . '' dark chocolate , some currant , and a hint of licorice sweetness all contribute wonderfully . a great aroma . t & m : gobs of coffee -- it really tastes like very dark iced coffee .  a : pours a clear , but dark brown with a bubbly off-white head that reduces to a film and leaves some decent lacing on my glass .  m : super full body from lots of carbonation that makes it really creamy and thick in the mouth d : nobody on earth could say this is `` drinkable '' !

it 's an absolutely mouth-watering smell . it 's 99 % raspberries and a touch of beer/alcohol . it 's wonderful , if not slightly one dimensional .  from the color , no one would ever suspect this one of being a kolsch ; by far the darkest i 've seen of this style , albeit it a pale amber color that 's fairly light . there 's not much head at all off the tap and no real lacing behind .  m - this is what i want in a dipa . solid medium body with spot on carbonation , creating a huge , super creamy , slick mouthfeel .

aroma as billed - full on piny spruce , with a pleasant lemon rind following up . very drinkable .  a paler than normal light red colour with a small head that leaves nice lacing as well .  m : the feel is exactly what i look for in these kinds of beers .

s- really nice , sour , brett , really nice grape skin presence , pears , lemon citrus , white grapes . t- wow really smooth as well as puckering , not too puckering though really balanced , nice grape skin taste , brett is present , some green apple , pear , lemon , barnyard funk , slight oak , really tasty and easy drinking .  being that it 's from bmc , it 's a stab at a rare style from them and it 's actually pretty good and refreshing .  the carbonation is excellent . d : i ca n't put away many of any double ipa , and it 's the same for this one - it 's clearly high quality but the sour aspects keeps me from wanting more .

aroma is a really rich and exquisite odor ... very roasty with an extremely nice bourbon aroma and abundant alcohol esters . really quite good . very good - recommended .  apperance : hazy brown . it poured with a big frothy head , but it quickly faded .  the mouthfeel was thick , rich , frothy and supple . this was unquestionably the most impressive aspect of the beer .

s - well , this is a really pleasant surprise . this is just fantastic . t - a lot going on here -- funkiness at first , less citrus than the nose , plenty of spice : clove and anise , with maybe some allspice .  this one is an orange color , mostly , but not completely transparent , with a modest , unassuming head .  m - thought this beer was very smooth and carbonated to perfection , definetely got the mouthfeel down pat .

delicious . plenty of spices . taste really follows the nose . the chocolate is a bit stronger than i had figured it would be . i really enjoyed this beer , and count is among the very best imperial pumpkins i 've tried .  poured very dark almost black with short but tight tan head .  exceptionaly smooth mouthfeel - creaminess was rare like a milkshake .

n - wonderfully aromatic notes of brown sugar , balsamic vinegar , cane sugar and bakers semi-sweet chocolate ; maybe kiwi fruit , vanilla bean and charred oakiness like burnt charcoal . it 's safe to say i have never smelled a beer like this . t/m - opens with more of the brown sugar and chocolate malts and breadiness , well rounded tartness plays well with the overall sugary , grainy nature of the beer ; sherry-like , it reminds me of a high-quality balsamic vinegar .  poured 12oz brown bottle into a small pint glass . a -- goldenrod , with a thin white head s -- cookie dough , pine like smell t -- herbal , earthy , some sticky rosemary flavor .  a smooth creamy finish . best i have ever had outside of a cask drawn stout .

fresh , clean , pure citrus . tangerine , grapefruit and orange . t-where did all that malt come from ? i mean , it looks malty but the hops are so dominant on the nose that i expected the hoppiness to be brighter in the taste . nice but not quite up to the nose . m-medium bodied and crisp , nicely bitter .  2011 bottle , poured into tulip glass . appearance : light brown , hazy , with almost no head ( just minimal bubbles forming around the edges ) .  mouthfeel- thick and rich like a good imperial stout should be . great carbonation and texture .

s - the aroma is outstanding - fresh , juicy raspberries all over the place . d - overall , a very nice fruit beer - maybe the best non-sour one i 've had .  on tap in a local bar in hilo , hawai'i . appearance was golden with nice-sized head and beaucoup lacing .  strong big bubbles , surprising considering the small shape of the head , pretty full bodied as well , i like that . sweet and easy drinking proposing a lemon slice here and there that grows into a pungent tartness reminiscent of a straight lambic .

the smell is out of this world amazing . the aroma first off reminded me of cocoa powder , then the more in depth chocolate aromas arrive . this allows me to feel that i 'm smelling brownies and god damn i love it . the taste is n't nearly as awesome as the aroma , in fact after time it gets really hard to drink .  3 french hens pours a deep garnet red color with a off white head that fades pretty fast for a bsda . no lacing to speak of .  m - perfect smoothness .

bright and unbelievably inviting . taste : citrus dominates , like drinking a beer made with lemonade instead of water .  appearance - 3.0 pours a centimetre of white foam head that quickly reduced to a thin layer over a slightly hazy body of pale gold . this is one of the better of the style , supremely drinkable yet interesting right down to the bottom of the glass . this was lovely from the bottle , i can only dream how amazing it would be as a cask conditioned real ale .  palate is very chewy , heavy and absolutely great .

very nice lacing . smell : nose of sweet juicy citrus hops , with a pine cutter . very fresh . some resiny and herbal hop aromas as well .  the beer poured into the chalice hazy and chunky pale golden amber with a white and very low head which lasted at the surface in an attempt to lace the glass .  i think that this is one of the best stouts made . great taste , great look , mouthfeel . this is one of the best imperial stouts , american or russian , ever made .

if you love vanilla , as i do , the smell is absolutely amazing . taste is very fizzy upfront , a little too much carbonation .  cloudy orange body with a small white head that fades to a cap - could look better .  m : i felt the mouthfeel was perfect on this beer for a begian strong .

very large amount of columbus type hop aroma . it has a good amount of hop bitterness also . beer is a nice light golden/amber color .  appearance- pours a golden straw like color with hints of pink and a decent half finger foamy white cap . the head disappears very quickly leaving zero cap and collar and no lacing .  perfect . o : i think this would have been an amazing beer if it contained just a bit more malt sweetness to balance out the bitterness and yeasty astringency .

definitely a very sweet aroma but pulled off fairly well so it does n't create a problem despite how rich it comes off initially . now what worked out great in the nose may become problematic in the taste depending on how much you drink . the alcohol is obviously there and is n't shy . still good though , i just would n't want quite as much at once if i had this again .  a : a crystal clear pale straw color with a very thin white head .  first sip is amazingly creamy texture with minimal gentle rolling carbonation .

very complex with changes as it warms . very drinkable and very enjoyable . i 'll try this one with some good strong cheese the next time i find it .  12 oz bottle poured into traditional pint glass a - pours a golden dark yellow color with plenty of carbonation streams . with a careful pour the head is a disappointingly tiny .  m-mild carbonation and a full creamy mouthfeel without being cloying .

that should n't take away from the dreat hop taste and smell that this beer has . nice cascade aroma to say the least . the look is good , not great , not too much lacing at all .  aroma is an immaculate citric and grapefuit hops , with some slightly sweet maltiness in the background ( pretty far back to be honest ) . the taste is a hophead 's dream ; waves and waves of resiny , lemon , piny hops balanced out by some pale/caramel malt sweetness . this is the deinitetion of a pacific dipa . my preference is usually for more malt and more east coast hops , but i can appreciate this high quality of this offering and why it is so highly regarded . there is great carbonation helps bring out the flavors , the beer feels very smooth , rich and full bodied . as i said before the aftertaste is a tad too bitter for my personal preferences ( i like more aroma and flavor that just bitter ) , but still an extremely balanced well made brew .  perfect . incredibly balanced flavor and magnificent mouthfeel , it 's actually worth every penny of the high price .

it is golden and pale , and rich in color , the head meets the top of the pint , and does not rush away the smell is perhaps the best smell on a beer i have ever had ! the hops meet the smell of freshness and make your lips stretch into a smile before you have even tasted the beer !  pours a somewhat muddy , dark brown color .  mouthfeel is dead on and perfect . d : hah , it drinks easily , but if someone pounds this they should be slapped .

wonderful sweet , fruity hop aroma with some pineapple and a little bit of pine .  poured from the bottle into a mug a-pretty typlcal looking brown lifgt head arcoss the top just kind of a film s-very roasted rich/sweet malt and alot of nuttyness t-much like the smell except sweeter with alot of nuttyness .  mouthfeel is fill bodied , heavy , and very smooth .
great wood .  a- murky , dull golden yellow w/ asoapy white head and heavy , blotchy lacing m- light and crisp with plenty of carb .  really good mouthfeel .

oh , what a nose . loaded with charred oak , roasted grain , earthy dark chocolate , boozy vanilla , ash and smoke , tobacco , wood , a bit of candied fruit , and just a fleeting hint of resinous pine-like hops . it 's almost a chore to take a sip , but what a pleasant chore . there 's an underlying current of sweet caramel that keeps the big boy flavors from being too oppressive .  it looks almost dirty .  m-very smooth and creamy , full bodied , good carbonation and a crisp grainy finish .

the smell , as others have noted , is the quite exceptional . it smells like the belgian strong dark ale of my dreams . overall a satisfactory beer and the best smelling beer ever . give it a shot !  this is not beer , it 's an evil spirit disguised as beer . so , they hand me this beer , cute , pepper in it , i like pepper . well , i have this nice cold beer , i 'll just take a drink to cool off : hot ! well , i have this nice cold beer , i 'll just take a drink to cool off : hot !  a great mouthfeel that is easily recognizable .

pretty complex right from the smell . pine , orange , grepefruit . not much malt coming through all that hop smell . tastewise ... probably the best balance i 've seen in an ipa so far . floral hop is the star feature , but the pine comes through as well & not shampooey at all as i feared it might be . i 'd highly recommend it to ipa lovers .  founders harvest pours a clouded , yellow-straw hue with hints of peach and honey . the foam shot up quickly , nearly catching me off guard , like a 4th of july charcoal snake on steroids -- and tinted a light beige color . to be honest , this looked more like a hefeweizen than a pale , and the massive foam was a distraction , as it took a full five minutes to pour .  the feel on this puppy is exceptional to say the least . full creamy and velvety smooth .

aroma is really intriguing and quite honestly , delicious . this one smells really festive . really amazing . although the ginger is the dominant flavor and at times seems to overpower everything else , i cant say that the ginger is the only aroma . quite complex actually . lots of ginger in the flavor with more juniper berries .  a - pours dark brown , with redish hints around the edges , with a dense two finger tall white head , quickly dissipating down to almost nothing in just a few short minutes , leaving no lace down the glass . within five minutes the beer was as flat as the 13th century earth ... s - smells of spicy belgian yeast , chocolate , clove , banana , candied sugar , and the ever present dark fruits ; mostly figs and dates .  with the nitro draught , the mouthfeel is exceptionally smooth and full .

2007 vintage poured into a pint glass a : very dark brown/almost black with creamy tan head s : wo , it smells as if i walked into a bourbon barrel , very bourbony and oaky . next thing i smell is vanilla , sweetness , and smokiness t : bitterness attacks the pallet followed by a malty sweetness with vanilla and carmel overtones . d : this beer is a wonderfully complex brew but one or two glasses is going to be more than enough for me notes : working my way through their big beer series and now having tried this and their hopmouth i am excited to get to the rest of their big beer line-up  it pours out very nicely into a dark brown color that has a two or three inch head with very little lacing and some retention . not much in carbonation , the smell has a very nice nutty smell with a hint of caramel and chocolate .  perfect mouthfeel in my opinion , feels silky smooth .

wonderful hoppy aroma . big west coast hop taste .  pours a clear golden , thin white head forms , settles to a thin ring , leaves some lace spots , looks pretty standard .  finishes dey , sweet & warming mf : rich & chewy with minimal carbonation .

a hint of lacing & some film on the head s : chocolate , booze & pralines . then whisky & caramel ( scorched ) t : sweet woody flavor , then chocolate , booze & then dryness up front .  hazy and kind of opaque golden brown with a small tan head .  m : has both a crisp and creamy feel , medium carbonation , goes down very smooth . this is overall a very good beer , worthy of drinking a 6-pack easily in a sitting .
smells fantastic , aged pungent .  a - clear yellow body , with a pure white thin head .  the mouthfeel is just silky .

it is heavenly smelling . i can really smell the allspice and the brown sugar . amazing . if you have a stuffy nose wait to have this beer ; i think the flavor is influenced strongly by the smell . o - this beer wants to be drinkable but the sheer amount of alcohol is n't pleasant and it really detracts from the flavor .  appearance - light yellow . cloudy .  incredible mouthfeel .

juicy , sweet , resiny citrus with a dash of chocolate just for balance ... too perfect for words ... somewhere between a honeyed grapefruit and candy . taste- luscious ... a sweet , rich palate of hop oils and firm malts , balanced with that hint of chocolate . this is really a terrific beer , and redefines what kind of quality can be delivered in canned form .  a : highly carbonated orange body with little head .  very creamy feel with medium carbonation and body .

as soon as this beer started coming out of the bottle i got these big pleasant whiffs of roasted coffee and esspresso .  a - slightly hazy and yellow with a nice creamy white head . this does n't really look all that impressive .  mouthfeel is light to medium bodied and super smooth with a solid hop character ad satisfying finish .

wonderful sour aroma with the right amount of sweetness .  it pours a dark murky brown , clearer at the edges , minimal head .  full bodied . the carbonation level and viscosity are virtually perfect . finishes intensely floral , warm and with fading notes of baker 's chocolate and anise .
amazingly strong . no hint of alcohol at all !  a : dark brown . no head , just white foam along the edge of the glass .  it definitely had clean taste and great body .

impressive ! t : intense .  drank from my duvel tulip glass a - pours a slightly hazey golden colour witha white head thad disappears real quick .  very full bodied and mouth feel complex and nice tastes all around very drinkable stout with nice hop balance

after some time , the head dies down to only a lace and then to nothing the aroma delivers on the label 's promise with fresh coffee bean aromatics . the coffee is n't overpowering , which is a good thing because it lets the rest of this fine beer shine . it 's simple and it 's simply awesome . the flavor of this beer caught me off guard at first , but towards the end i 'm loving it .  gumballhead pours a slighty hazy yellow color with a small white head .  the body is outstanding , better than any abt from belgium i 've had , decadent creaminess and perfectly mouth-filling .

the nose is pure joy - huge coffee presence . perhaps there 's some chocolate notes there , but this coffee aroma is powerful . fortunately , the taste follows up the aroma to perfection - again , massive coffee notes in the taste .  a - very dark and thick . low head and minimal visible carbonation . a murky , burnt sienna color .  mouthfeel is spectacularly smooth for a barleywine at this strength .

very malty aroma hit me as soon as i popped the top on this bad boy . the wonderful malty smell hits you fallowed by a light hops .  this classic beer poured a golden color with a somewhat off-white head that did n't stick around incredibly long .  great stuff .

espresso , chocolate , black cherry nose . it was amazingly complex . there were likely more traits than that , but i was really overwhelmed by the berry notes that came across as i breathed this in .  like a bit more in the hops and maybe a better head retention for appearance , but a very good german pils .  great feel ... smooth and creamy . loved it !

it 's exquisite . tastes : just like it smells -- complex and crazy-time good . drinks : incredibly . while i want to really wait it out and savor it , the beer goes down so easily it 's scary .  pours a light orange color , small head to it , small amount of lacing .  full and creamy in the mouth with a pleasant alcohol warmth on the way down . overall , it 's outstanding , but i would put it a notch below similar offerings from true trappist breweries .

the smell is dominated by nutmeg . it has nutmeg in the taste as well along with some pumpkin spice . it is a way better than expected beer . i would love to have this again .  strangely , the beer i poured had a turbid haze to it .  a little bitter but so much to turn me off , enough to make me want another sip to get some more ... the feel is super velvety , love it .

sheesh perfect blends . awesome ! d : goes down good . once you get past the winey booze , it goes down very easy .  the appearance of this beer is about the average for any other brown ale . a clear brown liquid with a light to moderate head .  a perfect , creamy and overall medium bodied mouthfeel .

aroma : absolutely invigorating grapefruit aroma rolled in oily lemon hops . the finish is acrid , though not intense .  very little lacing .  the body is where it really shines : smooth , full , everything great . carbonation levels are perfect , coming up shy of metallic but lightening up just enough .

stone really knows how to make a beer smell good.. jeez.. must be dry hopping . this beer was very hoppy but it also had a mellow minty herbal note in there as well to calm it down . tasted amazing and was quite quaffable , i poured twice ( 22oz ) into the snifter and it seemed as though the first one went down the hatch in no time at all.. it was just that dern good .  poured into tulip a - orange .  the mouthfeel is extremely thick and chewy .

totally different from the way it smelled on tap , and distinctly more memorable . wow . pleasant . o : this was like an entirely different beer , and was amazing in an entirely different way . while the tap version was terrifically fresh , floral , and herbal in a purely hoppy way , the cask version provides gigantically juicy fruitiness as well as a distinct cannabis overtone that was missing before . terrific stuff . cheers !  a - cloudy orangy yellow . medium head that fades away quickly . m - very clean and smooth , not much is left lingering . d - i only discount the drinkability here because i 'm not a fan of wheat beers , so my review is biased .  mouthfeel/drinkability- the mouthfeel on this brew is ace for the style , nice medium body with a good malt backbone and the perfect amount of carbonation to make the flavors really dance on your tongue .

end result is a cloudy ( milky , really ) golden , delicious looking , uncapped mess smell is really amazing . spicy and such , love it . taste , however , is one of the bigger disappointments i have had with beer ( not to the level of sa triple bock , but still disappointing ) .  presentation : it was poured from a brown 12oz , long neck bottle into a pint glass . appearance : the body has good clarity and a nice golden color . it builds up a tall white head full of big loosely packed bubbles that quickly fade out . this only makes for a very little spotty lacing .  this is exactly right .

big hops . this is a beautiful combinatio of pine and citrus . theres not much malt under all the hops , but where some beers that are heavy on the hops , but low on malt flavors come out unbalanced , this seems natural .  a : pours with a bright white bubbly head that struggles to get up to 1 finger . the body is pale golden straw , clear and very light in color . super thin sheets of lace with tattered ends . nothing particularly great about the appearance but , given the style , nothing exciting was expected .  m - the mouthfeel is second to none . phenomenal body and mouthfeel , and perfect carbonation .
really rich aroma that seems to alternate between a port and a muscat wine .  big , but quickly dissipating head .  mouthfeel is full-bodied , yet soft and creamy .

smells really nice . fruity belgian yeast . very enjoyable . mouthfeel is prickly and crisp , very refreshing .  a pours a nice brown color with some hints of red topped with a tan head .  and my favorite part about baltic porters ... the rich , creamy , velvety , smooth body . not too heavy , but just right .

probably one of the best smelling and inviting aromas in a beer i have ever smelled . the flavor pretty much followed the nose only some of the flavors were much stronger than the others .  served in a pub glass , this brew appears brown and almost amber red when held to the light . this is a very light colored porter . a white cap appears and quickly fades to a halo around the edge of the glass . a light swirl revives the cap .  carbonation is right where it needs to be , medium/low and perfect . overall : if nothing else mattered , i would have a stockpile of this beer and start every day with one or two .

magnificent . starts bittersweet with a slightly toffeeish , butterscothcy ( not diacetyl ! as good as the individual components are , it 's somehow slightly disjointed - the hops and malt never quite meld together . still impressive . mouthfeel is large , drinkability limited only by palate tolerance .  no head . no lacing .  smell : floral hops taste : combo of floral/pine hops . most excellent . drinkability : although the beer is pretty much perfect , the fact that it 's an ipa means limited drinkability . i love the beer , but the hops would limit how many i could drink .

it has a heavy hop aroma of flowers , perfume , herbs and resin . it is heavy , thick and very sweet ! thick and oily , sweet and very bitter .  this beer poured a clear golden color with a decent head that quickly fell .  great velvety smooth mouthfeel . it reminded me of a boddington 's from a nitro-can - great mouthfeel , but otherwise unremarkable .

s ; punch of juicy pineapple , citrus , touch of pine . dried mango , peach skin . t : cararmel malt baclbone is pretty distinct .  reviewed 4-24-10 a- 2008 vintage , 1st glass pours a fairly clear brownish-amber color w/ an average head that dissipates quickly leaving little lacing in my snifter , 2nd glass yielded a great amount of large particulates that rolled about in the turbulant carbonation resulting in what can only be described as `` fish food in a lava lamp '' , scary s- smell starts off w/ a vinous , sour apple/pear dominating with notes of a nutty caramel-like munich type malt , a bit of alcohol & a bretty-like phenol as it warms t- taste starts w/ a bit of fruity tartness then fades into a bready , nutty , caramelish flavor w/ a hint of bitterness , hints of lighter dried fruit , golden raison/pear perhaps , finishes nutty w/ a very faint touch of alcohol m- a very dry beer , med-full bodied w/ a good amount of co2 , had to remove .5 just 'cuz those chunks felt kinda nasty d- overall a damn drinkable beer once you get over how ugly it is , esp .  m : amazing feel .

smell is fabulous , there is so much there , it 's malty/sweet/bready/etc . mouthfeel is very heavy , very nice . i could easily down a few of these in a row and that incredible aroma and great taste would be awesome .  this beer pours a dark black/brown with a very light , cream coloured head that doesn ; t last very long leaving not too much in terms of lacing .  lies heavy on the tongue . again , thick and creamy with moderate carbonation . much better than the experience i had from the bottle , but as i mentioned i do n't think the bottled version i tasted was quite right .

an excellent bouquet . very roasty and nutty flavors on the front , with more espresso flavors on the finish .  beer arrives in the small chimay goblet as a light milk chocate hazy brown with no head for the seeing .  excellent mouthfeel .

excellent retention , from all the hops i assume . aroma : tons of floral and citrusy hops and some malt sweetness , with some alcohol .  pours a thick hazy golden brown with 1/2 '' white head but is trasparent enough to see through the glass ... sort of .  usually mouthfeel is an after thought but with this beer the mouthfeel stands out as being wonderful . it catches my attention even moreso than some of the flavors . it feels nice and coats my mouth with a very nice feeling . this beer feels exceptionally good in the mouth .

i spent some very enjoyable time smelling the beer before tasting it . the smell was sweet with a hint of bublegum and burnt sugar . appearance was that of a good , standard ipa .  poured this in a snifter and it poured a surprisingly clear , dark amber with a decent head as was the lacing .  m - full bodied and creamy texture on the palate .

the aroma is wonderful , floral and citrus hops . this aroma of the hops is top notch . i keep my nose out of it .  it 's an average looking beer .  m/d - this is probably one of the best mouthfeels i 've ever had with a growler .

the nose on this is amazing - a bounty of fruits with hop bite and some grassy notes as well . just a great all-around bouquet . overall i really liked this beer - always cool to try a single hop ale with a hop you 've never experienced before .  bottle poured into a chalice appearance : hazy gold-amber color with finger-sized head that dissipates into lacing . drinkability : a lack of head retention is this beer 's only fault .  entry is silky smooth with just a touch of carbonation showing on the back of the tongue .

grass and summer days mix with the flowery hop smell to give the perfect ipa smell . taste : less sharp than expected by the smell .  a : pours a slightly murky hazelnut color with not much head . a thin spiderweb of film sits on the top . no lacing either .  t- wonderfully light malt sweetness boasting just enough complexity to keep things interesting . m- perfect .

aroma is wonderful - like a chilled chocolate syrup .  appearance : yellowish-orange color with a natural light haze . overall very drinkable .  m - thick , full bodied and creamy mouthfeel with a slick , oily texture and super soft , almnost non-existent , carbonation . plenty of bitterness on the palate that lasts well into the finish and lingers for quite a while . this one has an exceptional mouthfeel and a complex flavor profile that makes this a truly great example of the style .

brandon : candied citrus , very good smell , the best aroma hop in this series of 10. very earthy flava flav .  a : looks a little light and adjuncty from first impressions ; goldish yellow with a pure , white fizzy head .  very smooth and lightly carbonated . leaves a nice coating in the mouth . this beer is excellent .

smells of citrusy hop/pine/diacitle tastes of hop/grapefruit.lemo zest/ and pine nuts , it 's delicious !  you can certainly hear the carbonation ! some lacing & average head retention s : sourness & horse blanket , fades as this warms t : vinegar tartness , some raspberry & dirt up front , plus green apples .  m= mmm perfection d= high . feels and tastes like an imperial ipa .

750 ml bottle , great label , a : pours a translucent goldenrod , very much witbier like . s : intoxicating nose of sage which i really cant resist . reminds me a lot of saison du buff for sure . o : this is a really good saison , the nose is great and the flavour is similarly good .  a : 1 inch solid white head . pale color , not amber .  perfect balance and the mouthfeel is amazing . i want to chug it at times .

smell : enticing aroma of coffee , chocolate , caramel , smoke ( presumably peat ) and a hint of fruit . complex and remarkable ( +1.0 ) . no odors . d : while the aroma and flavor are very enjoyable , the flat mouthfeel makes this beverage a little reminiscent of cold coffee ( -0.5 ) .  clear red-brown with no head , no lacing , nothing visual of note , really . crisp mouthfeel , which surprised me based upon the headless , carbonationless appearance .  absolutely the thickest stout i have had , makes the mouthfeel of expedition stout seem like light beer . this one is just big and chewy with an extremely mild carbonation . it is n't as sweet as i was expecting but i think it comes off as pretty sweet because of the thick mouthfeel .

the smell is of raisins and prunes . very strong aroma . the taste is of sweetened prunes and raisins with a molasses/chocolate backing .  bottle in a fluted pint glass appearance : medium head that faded to a surface coating with lacing that hangs on . color is lighter than a copper color very much like a traditional pilsner with lots of bubbles .  m : creamy , perfectly carbonated , and oily slick that is incredible . this helps this beer a lot .

smells like bacon on a campfire .  i got this on draft and it arrived with a thin film on top , not the classic head as from the bottle.i wondered why ? anyway all good from there , it even managed to lace fairly well .  outstanding beer . the texture was incredible . find some now for yourself .

the smell , again as with the ommegang abby ale , was of dried fruits ... dates and figs .  yet , i wanted a tad bit more beer in my glass that partially due to my careful pouring there was very little head development .  the taste is big caramel/biscuit malt , some sweet maple sap , and a strong , but smooth , enveloping booziness . the carbonation is quite low , the body thick , viscous , oily , and creamy - a surprising sledgehammer of pleasure to the palate .

s - deliciously crisp aromas of green apples , lemon juice , wheat , earthy brett , and tangy , funky lacto . amazing . t - pretty similar to the nose , lots of green apple , lemon juice , wheat and funky barnyard flavors . wonderfully complex , especially for a 3 % abv beer . this is a really nice example of a fairly uncommon beer style that i love to introduce non-beer drinkers to .  i really like this beer , and it begins from the moment the bottle cap comes off . mojo ipa pours an unassuming golden color , but packs a big taste of hops bitterness mixed with grapefruit that lingers on the back of the tongue for a good long time .  afterwards , it leaves a rich and creamy yet dry feeling in your mouth .

there were beautiful aromas of sweet flowers and deep complex hops . this was a very tasty beer , but the flavor was not as complex as the smell i felt . very strong and up-front hop bitterness with a light fruit sweetness on the finish .  the beer in my glass is a hazy copper , maybe not filtered ? small head that disappears , a bit odd being that hops aid in head retention , maybe my glass is dirty . very drinkable beer that one can quaff down in no time flat .  mouthfeel was superb . very prickly and slightly thin but just perfect .

d - very solid and very tasty ipa .  can : poured a clouded gold ale into the glass with only a modest cap..missing was the puffy cap one expects on a hefe .  the mouthfeel is very nice -- medium-bodied and quite chewy .

smell - bourbon nose comes through with carmel , toffee and slight roast aromas . very good finish without any lasting sugars .  pours amber/peach with a 1/2 ' white head . minmal lacing & no head retention s : fruittyness & floral hops .  the mouth is exactly what a porter should be .

note : 2010 batch review adapted from notes taken 2/5/11 appearance : very black with a tan head - looks great smell : super complex - burnt , roasted malts , chocolate , coffee , wood , alcohol , and a nose full of bourbon - epic taste : rich , burnt malts exploding with bourbon - roasted malts , chocolate , coffee , oily hops , wood , complex bitterness ... but mostly bourbon - this would get a higher score , but it is rather unbalanced - needs more malts in the body mouthfeel : moderate body and somewhat effervescent - could be a bit heavier overall : best to split this 750 with a friend i had this back in 2009 and it completely blew my mind .  looks really good , but does n't look like a dark beer of any kind .  very nice creamy full bodied moutfeel .

the smell is really intense ! huge aroma here even before letting it warm up a bit . obviously a double ipa with double hops . really hoppy but a great balance of fruitiness without overdoing it . while the smell was absolutely perfect , my first reaction to the taste is that it 's a bit one-dimensional .  served a little too cold and i forgot to ask for plenty of head , which may acount for why it had almost none . benefit of the doubt . tiny bit of lace .  mouthfeel is just amazing . although it has a nice carbonation level the mouthfeel is liquid velvet , just coats the mouth and does n't let go .

huge coffee aroma . best part of waking up ? i do n't pick-up malt or hop aroma , but that is obviously not the intent .  pours a translucent ruby color with almost no head .  m - the mouth feel is huge and rich , oily and very sticky . noticeable warming on the aftertaste .

very nice , overall , and a great combination of the belgian and ipa characteristics . still , it 's quite nice .  muddy red brown color with light white head .  a - deep golden , orange color with one finger , bubbly head ; faded to nice a covering cap with enormous amounts of lacing s - aromatic hops , then malt and bread , then pine t - bitter in front followed by brief pineapple then huge piney , bitterness at end m - velvety smooth ; medium carbonation with fine , foamy bubbles d - drinkability for me is low here ; not sure if this is from the bitterness or the lack of much fruit or anything beyond pine oil ; just not my favorite palate for a big ipa

the bottle version was better ... dark brown looks like coca cola , a light tan head that is light and whispy ... the aroma is the star of this , simply outstanding . sweet grapes , plums , peat , scotch , light char . the first whiff is sweet fruits with scotch , a really great combo ... the taste does n't represent the nose as well , too much of the scotch comes out loses most of the sweet plums that really balanced the nose . this is really good for a scotch ale , needs some tweaking on the taste but worth trying for sure .  pours an amber color . the head is big , enough to top off a 16-oz mug , and settles into a pillowy plateau within minutes .  m - smooth and extremely creamy . a great ipa to savor and swirl around in your mouth . the fairly low carbonation level works well .

amazing smell of black cherry and vanilla and some chocolate . very smooth and drinkable .  appropriately cloudy , straw yellow . disappointing head : not very thick nor very long-lasting .  m - slick , smooth and very , very refreshing .

the complex aroma involves big dark fruits , sweet malts , grain , spice and bubblegum . goes slightly rough with a ubiquitous alcohol heat , which never bothers me .  kaiser curmudgeon occupies somewhere between burnt orange and mahogany in the color spectrum . there 's a bit of bone tinted foam sitting on top of the beer , but once it fades it leaves no evidence that it was there .  overall , a great mouthfeel ; lots of action from the carbonation , a good full coat that gets scrubbed by the finish .

wow just a wonderful nose , nice and floral every thing you could want from it .  it looked gold like a miller high life but boy it aint no light lager . just so tasty and real drinkablility f @ @ # % k you bud light you couldnt taste this good unless you put a 20 in every bottle .  mouthfeel - very nice feel , smooth and creamy with the perfect amount of carbonation . the bottle conditioning really left a nice feel .

once the foam subsided , the wonderful smell of chocolate and caramel came forward .  the color was nothing special , but formed a nice head .  mouthfeel and drinkability are fantastic . at nearly 3 dollars a bottle , this is a bit pricey for `` everyday '' beer , but that is exactly what this should be - an everyday beer and a staple in every fridge .

rich soothing pine cone scented hops along with a floral bouquet definitely worth noting in this beers complex and aggressive aroma tamed by a rich malt undertow in this wave of bliss .  big downfall is appearance , which is a murky , not very attrative brown . however , it does pour with a nice head which maintains as a purplish ring throughout .  m - very wet and distributing .

d - smells better than it tastes , but probably is a good beer for the style .  a - pours a murky chestnut/copper color with very little foam , just a layer of fine bubbles that disappeared quickly s - strong lemon & orange citrus aromas , very nice indeed t - lemon and orange , light malts , very sweet tasting , slightly bitter finish m - crisp , well carbonated , smooth mouthfeel d - very tasty even at a year old , would have loved to try it fresh , still amazing though .  there 's some hints of vinegar in the background that , surprisingly , seems to fit right in with everything ealse going on in this beer.. mouthfeel/drinkabilty ; the mouthfeel on this one maybe the fullest , and mostly velvety of any beer that i 've ever had . between the raspberries , chocolate , nuts and very full mouthfeel , this is like drinking a chocolate raspberry cake with a some walnuts or pecans sprinkled on top .

simply smells great . the tase is earthy pine resin leading into a bready malt sweetness .  poured into a snifter aroma : sweet malty aroma , with underlying fruity esters , slight caramel aroma , very subtle hop aroma appearance : dark brown with a creamy tan head with some retention , a little bit cloudy flavor : highly complex malt flavor with undertones of lightly roasted malt , chocolate , slight hop flavor , slightly dry finish mouthfeel : medium bodied with some alcohol warmth , low carbonation , overall impression : very complex and well rounded beer with a great alcohol warmth very enjoyable on a cold night !  mouthfeel is , on the contrary , excellent . extremely creamy and smooth , with good carbonation .

s-pumpkin and spice , in short-pumpkin pie ( and quite pleasantly so ) . t-unsurprisingly , pumpkin is the primary flavour , although i found that the spice does not quite live up to the complex blend of tastes its smell promised ( it tastes more like alcohol with a few spices mixed in than a proper pumpkin pie spice blend ) .  there was no freshness date or any information about the beer on the skinny label , but if your spanish is any good , the web site will give you tons of information about this beer . the beer poured a crystal clear medium gold color with a -finger of white head that disappears rather quickly , leaving just a thin white rim . it leaves a surprisingly good amount of lacing on the glass with each sip .  thick , chewy and velvety smooth .

floral aroma with a tiny hint of bitter chocolate . floyd 's trademark hops distinguish this beer - quite lemony with lots of floral zest . bitter but bolsters the sweetness of the malts , much like alpha king but a bit thinner , not so robust . a step down from alpha king in my book , but still very pleasing .  some tan froth and lace .  mouthfeel was exceptional , as it is with many cask beers .

the first star here is the nose a hop soup of various hops all in wonderful balance . the taste is just as great in its hoppy goodness and drinkability but a bit thin on the body .  amber gold in color that pours a thin white head that quickly fades but leaves a ring of foam around the edge of the glass that clings . clean smooth and strong floral citrusy aroma but not overpowering .  m : thick , full mouthfeel says a lot about the prodigious malting of this beer .

very enjoyable aroma . t. it tastes much as it smell .  a - it pours a visibly oily brown-black , and is capped with a smattering of mocha bubbles . cocoa and coffee round out the nose . t - the most striking thing about the flavor is the way it hides the listed 12 % abv ; i was beffuddled to see the strength of this brew , because it really does not come across as potent or boozy . o - this is a very nice beer , especially considering it is a ba brew , available off-the-shelf .  m : velvety , soft , thick , luscious chewy mouthfeel .

smell is unusually impressive for what i expect of this kind of beer -- fruity , especially blueberry and mango notes , with hop tang and characteristically malty flavors evident in equal parts . mouthfeel is lightly carbonated , a little thick ( like a dark lager ... blech ) , and generally mediocre .  a_pours black , jet black with a smallish coffee hued head . this diminishes quickly and settles into a small brown cap . lacing is non existant . despite the lack of head there is a good carbonation which cuts through the liquid which could be construed as cloying otherwise .  very smooth , creamy texture . carbonation assists the creamy texture with tiny bubbles mixing well with the full-bodied beer .

smells real clean and crisp . d : the appearance and smell of this beer are amazing . the taste and mouthfeel are lacking .  a - clear and effervescent , golden amber in colour with a finger of foamy white head . sloppy lacing .  almost perfect . it just does n't have any edges , it 's just meant to be drunk .

inviting nose that 's exactly what i love in an ipa -- an amazing mix of citrus and tropical fruit ( grapefruit and passionfruit/pineapple ? ) i could smell this all day ! sweet maltiness shows up in the middle that creates a wonderfully balanced ipa . this is a nicely crafted ipa . the unreal nose perhaps let me down slightly in the taste department , but this is still one of my all-time favourite american ipas .  poured a decent copper color with minimal head and a bit of nice lacing .  for all the bitterness , this beer maintains a silky smooth mouthfeel .

wonderful , tropical nose , with lots of yummy island fruit .  1 1/2 inch head was a soft white that faded slowly to a thin ring and left little lacing .  light carbonation and very velvety . smooth and decadent finish . creamy and appetizing .

s - this beer smells great ! a very deep sour smell similar to the likes of consecration and the '08 la folie .  dumb ass idea* app : looks fog filled.. and old.. a brown w/ red hues type color head ran away quick quick quick . at least they got the old and fog right .  very nice wheat aroma with a hint of citrus , poured a nice golden and cloudy appearance , very nice head that was more fizzy looking than creamy , head quickly went down to a nice thin creamy cap , very little lacing , lightly sweet with a slightly fruity taste , touch of banana , slightly malty with very little bitterness , very pleasing in taste , medium body that is slightly oily , very smooth , a nice light to medium carbonation , overall a very nice brew !

the smell is awesome . its slightly sweet , floral , a bit yeasty , some grains , some grass , maybe a little citrus .  a : good russet color , signs of carbonation , minimal head that quickly vanishes into light lacing that does n't last .  the mouthfeel here is awesome . medium-full body , very chewy , even tannic almost .

this coffee-chocolate stout provides an aroma that is exceptional . mudhouse coffee & tea company also of springfield , mo .  pours a murky colored brown with not much head to it , aroma is nice and spicey though with banana notes coming thru.taste starts out spicey ( cloves ) and slides right into heavy banana flavors with some sweetness like candied sugar or caramel in the finish.a dunkel with some complexity in my mind , a pretty nice offering .  m - terrific ! smooth , velvety creaminess , mild carbonation , and tons of residual stickiness . d - high abv , and gets a little too sweet after awhile , but bonus points for the incredible texture and ridiculously low retail price ( under $ 5 !

smells great . immediate floral smell , what i assume is heather . very nice . good mouthfeel and drinkability .  -appearance 3.0 : another off-black british stout with very little head . after my experience with ridgeway export stout , this has me frightened . however , a small head does form , but i just ca n't get past a stout that is n't jet , onyx black .  big , thick , full , creamy , exquisite feel .

an aroma of deep caramel and cherries . you might as well have your nose stuck inside a cherry pie . this is ridiculous . the taste is sweet !  this six pack was quite a bit more expensive than the insanely cheap regular gansett . 'gansett summer , for example , makes an embarrassment out of sam adams 's summer offering . i 'm so glad this brewery came back from the dead .  mouthfeel : this is a perfect 5 for sure .

nose smelled like a fresh fudge brownie , direct from the oven .  poured a very dark brown , like a good coffee . but no head at all .  m : got to give perfect marks for mouthfeel on this one . perfect amount of carbonation , just enough to bring out the taste .

smell is outstanding with a heavy whiff of maltiness , akin to a certain wheat doppelbock of some notariety . no floral armoa here - this one is all malt .  not exactly a high profile beer , but it 's solid from top to bottom . does n't look stunning sitting in the glass .  mouthfeel - nice and creamy full mouthfeel .

the smell has a great aromatic sense of dark chocolate , . roasted nuts , vanilla , and dark fruit . the bold aroma fills the room in about 20 minutes .  a : not much to look at really . soapy foamy head sticks around awhile though , sort of a pale color , very still .  very bourbon heavy . this is very rich and creamy . if any beer could have `` milkshake like '' qualities , this would be the one .

strong notes of roasted malt , chocolate and a bit of sweetness to smooth things out . very inviting . the black malt and hops provide a nice bitterness , yet they do n't overwhelm . i would n't describe the flavour as chocolate or coffee , just burnt roast malt , delicious . finishes slightly nutty , as typical of most bushwakker brews ( still meaning to talk to them about how they do this ) .  appearance -- pours a pale golden orange with two fingers of sudsy white head . lacing was minimal . i always say this , but these brewer 's whim ipa 's hit all of the right spots with me when it comes to mouthfeel .  if i could give mouthfeel a 6.0 , i would . ridiculously smooth , soft , creamy , mousselike . beyond exceptional -- sublime . as others have mentioned , a bottle of oat will be the perfect beer for the snowy , house-bound nights that are sure to come .

definitely a good smelling beer , ca n't wait to sip .  a - light copper . head is fizzy and quickly recedes . slightly sweet and malty up front with a toasted character , maybe even a bit of tartness , but dry on the finish with a hoppy aftertaste . i would n't mind trying to homebrew something like this for an everyday beer .  mouthfeel is ridiculous . smooth , creamy with outstanding perfect carbonation which is very fine . pretty dry and exactly what i want in a saison .

s- wow , smells exactly like a fresh hop . i 'm not saying it is really fruity or anything , but it legitimately has the hop aroma with a nice natural woodiness and slight grassy tint to really make you think this is a glass full of real hop pellets . o- damn surly nailed this one .  2002 edition , 750ml corked and caged . pours with a head about 1/8 '' deep that reduces quickly to a thin spread of whitish film . no real viscosity to the deep , pure copper-colored liquid . '' and then , just as i 'm about to stop paying attention , `` fruit '' becomes `` dried apples , mandarin oranges , raisins ... '' fruit , and overflowing baskets of it . every flavor , from black cherry to banana , is soaked in layers of alcohol and medicine , warming to become bitter like honeyed herbal tea .  creamy and luscious mouthfeel .

the aroma is what first jumps out at me . flavorful .  another solid beer from this local brewer - it 's becoming easier to find their goods . lighter in color and feel for an ipa , but the taste does not disappoint .  m - light to medium body and fullish zingy carboination that is perfect for this style .

the smell reminded me of the times when my dad and i would bring home the christmas tree ... and having that forest-like smell engulf my living room . simply amazing ... one of the best aromas any beer has given off . t : the initial taste is exactly what i expected ... pines ... straight up tree dog !  this beer forms a loose white head when poured and dissipates quickly , leaving a thin collar of foam and a film in the center from constantly rising carbonation .  m - really thick and awesome . viscous , decadent , velvety . practically perfect .

smell : this is where the beers begins to show its true character and shine . initial hit is all chocolate , coffee , espresso . as it warmed the beer begin to show signs of dark fruits and a lingering alcohol smell .  a : jet balck and topped with a half inch , mocha colored head that faded into nothing for some reason .  m-extremely smooth and thick , full bodied , perfect level of carbonation , slightly slick on the back of the throat and coats it as it goes down d-this has a great complexity that is blended just right , nothing overpowers anything , it just messes in a great way .

that 's not too much of a detriment , as the nose is just outstanding . perfection for an irs imo , this is a great blend with an exceptional balance between chocolate , fruity oxidation and a rich fudge like character , more so than the 12th anniversary and the bb irs .  pours a hazy golden orange with a very thin white head that quickly dissipates .  the feel of this beer is ideal . silky and creamy with a soft medium body and a mild carbonation .

very clean . wonderful .  a : pours a rusty amber color with a thin , bone-white head that dissipates quickly . not much in the way of lacing .  smuttynose nails the mouthfeel - excellent carbonation tickles the tongue intensely and then settles into an impressively full and malty body , actually seeming fuller than it is ( a neat trick , really ) , some alchohol-type warmth and a nice soft malty remainder bringing up the tail .

s : smell is very strong . tons of malts and malty sweetnesses : caramel , toffee and light honey . also , there is quite a good amount of smoke going on in this as well as an oak/sherry life aftertaste . a bit of earthy hops to end it all . m : superb . the beer is quite heavy and thick , with low carbonation .  on-tap at beachwood ii , a : pours a deep red with a minimal bubbly head , some lace .  smooth and silky mouthfeel , with plenty of weight in the body . carbonation is easy going , allowing the flavor some time to sink in .

nose is so tropical and citric , just a very mouth-watering aroma . so fresh and bursting , perfect hop aroma . malts are kept light but are still noticeable , biscuity and lightly toasted with almost an earthy english graininess .  not much head , low carbonation .  flavor is exceedingly smooth , and it subtley builds to a very full yet not overwhelming coffee-ness . mouthfeel is quite smooth and viscous , like delicious motor oil .

the aroma was very unique . it had sweet fruits and yeasts , some citrus and hops , but something else in there . hard to tell , but excellent nonetheless .  dark burgandy/amber with brown tones and a small frothy topping .  m- low carbonation and amazingly creamy d - i 've always thought that drinking guiness was like drinking a loaf of bread -- a can makes a good dinner and this is still the same

fresh pine needles are the strongest smell , but there are notes of grapefruit , pineapple and just a little lemon mixed in . dissapointing taste after such a remarkable aroma . still a good tasting dipa , just not as great as i was hoping for .  a - deep mahogany with a modest khaki-colored cap and no lace .  mouthfeel - i love the shake like feel of guinness .

s. great smell , nearly perfect . extremely sweet and rich .  this beer poured a cloudy dark brown color with big chunks of clumped yeast falling into the beer ( even though i poured correctly ) .  m - incredibly creamy mouthfeel .

s. the smell is phenomenal . lots of creme brulee ( hence the title ) . smooth . o . because even a little more than a few ounces will make it unpleasant .  22oz bottle poured into a pint glass a - burgundy colored body with a thin off white head that settles quickly but whats left has good lacing .  do n't get me wrong , i love the mouthfeel and i think that it is appropriate to the style/what they were going for .

love it . sometimes i get on big stouts for being too sweet ( brewdog tokyo , i 'm looking at you ) , but this one skews to the opposite end , as it finishes rather dry and mineral-y for this big a stout .  not much head to report . yup , it 's blonde ... or at least as blonde as a doppelbock could be smells like lovely pils malts !  excellant mouthfeel once again .

s - wonderful aroma . like a belgian dubbel dessert in a glass . i also get just a touch of whatever fruit flavor is in red bull . interesting in a good way .  pours a very murky brown in color .  mouthfeel is outstanding , nice and silky , one of the best beers i 've had in this category .

thinnest white head leaving spotty lacing s - sweet bee pollen and orange citrus - lots of it t - more grapefruit and zest than orange smell indicates ; some honey sweetness in background ; pine oil finish m - fine , prickly , low-medium carbonation ; substantial body that cloudy color suggests ; bitter linger in back of mouth d - big ole citrusy ipa ; nice sweet zesty flavors ; comes strong with nice hops bill ; goes down surprisingly easy !  i did not get the sweet peach notes that i expected and the flavor was fairly bland . nice fizziness to it and a color consistent with a peach lambic , but overall this one was lacking on multiple fronts .  mouthfeel is perfect for the style .

s- the smell is indeed like a chocolate-covered cherry . the chocolate stands out , but hints of cherry and even a slight bourbon note . t- if only this tasted like it smells . chocolate malt up front with the cherry coming in the finish . however , it ends up too thin to really interest people looking for something exceptional , and too dry for those looking for a fruity summer beer .  an incredibly miniscule head that rapidly faded leaving a white halo around the glass .  taste & mouthfeel : smoothness is sublime as it rolls off the tongue , thick medium body .

s : raspberry heaven , perhaps not as overt as ng raspberry tart , but i really love the mix of the fruit with the acid , this smells great . t : raspberry for sure , but not over the top . d : this was fantastic , i 'm real glad i got to check this one out . honestly i had no idea this was 11.4 % when i tasted it , it hides it beautifully .  poured from the bottle into a bruery tulip and served with thanksgiving leftovers . the color is a somewhat-light chestnut brown that pours with a moderately-disappointing single-finger head with just a touch of lacing and not that much retention . there is a slight bubble ring around the glass throughout , however .  mouthfeel is outstanding . it 's perfectly carbonated , slightly dry , and you can actually taste the beer before you even swallow it .

aroma is simply wonderful - colombus hops galore , dark chocolate , leather , cigars , pipe tobacco , tar .  i 'm generally not a fan of light yellow beers , and thats exactly what this looked like . ( which i normally do n't notice , so it must have been a bit more than a hint ) finally after taking a sip i realised i was wrong to judge this beer by its color . overall i was impressed with this beer , dont let its smoothness fool you though , its a strong bugger .  mouthfeel is amazing , very smooth ( like keith stone ) , creamy , just enough carbonation .

smell is very nice , fruity and spicy esters accentuated by the robust noble hops . excellent . taste is great as well , big esters , some continental hop flavor and clean malts . great big saison esters on the nose , a satisfying flavor , although it could stand to be cleaned up or tightened a big .  it pours yellow orange with a quick to fizz away white head .  wonderfully smooth mouthfeel -- the best part of drinking this beer .

smell : the first most striking smell is that of raspberries and tart fruit . there is more going on in here and there is a certain bit of almost mushroom like mustiness .  my bottle ( 500ml ) was a bit colder than ideal , and did n't pour enough head to even cover the surface , though a decent lace rim remained . the color is a light to medium copper .  m : excellent . perfect balance of carbonation and of body weight .
