22oz bomber , riley's appearance : pours a hazy orange-copper , foamy beige head with lots of lacing forms immediately ... snifter is coated all around with the foamy remains smell : big and bold aromas ... pungent and juicy floral hops ... loaded with bittersweet pink grapefruit , herbal/grassy nature , fresh huge pine cone aroma , no alcohol detected in the nose ... lots of tropical fruit , apricot ... medium malt presence taste : super juicy floral hops ... bittersweet freshly squeezed grapefruit juice , intense pine resin , orange-grapefruit citrus hops ... medium sweet malt backbone . little alcohol detected in the nose but a big alcohol burn in the body . very good but very bitter mouthfeel : medium body , slick and oily , strong alcohol burn , super bitter-sweetness drinkability : inhibited slightly by the bitterness  pours out black with a thin tan head that quickly disappears . it has good carbonation , but little retention and lacing .  amazing . overall - this is a fantastic ipa .

smells like chocolate covered raspberries . mmmmm and yummy . very interesting flavor profile .  appearance : rapture stout comes out very dark with dark brown and ruby hints around the edges . head is a light tan color , and has okay lacing , but reduces down to nothing .  the mouthfeel is incredible . old dubh is supposed to mean old oil i guess , but this beer is nowhere near as thick as oil or even syrupy . it 's creamy smooth , medium in body , and has a perfect level of medium carbonation .

for smell , this was great . ca n't pinpoint the smell , but maybe fruit and pine . i was pleasantly surprised . drinkability ... you could drink these all night .  a- light straw color , lighter than i would have expected for an epa , white frothy head , little to no lacing , clean appearance .  the taste leads with a bracing bitterness into a rounder green pine hops that is cut with malt before fading into a pleasant lingering aftertaste . really an exceptional beer for those who like hops .

smells like fresh , resiny whole hops touched leather-based perfume . this is hefty but well-balanced . there is a slightly danky , earthy , perfumey undertone to the composition of this ale -- it 's quite nice . i do n't know that i 've ever experienced that note with a darker ale .  brown 500ml bottle , just in date when reviewed ( 2 oct 2009 ) . poured into a pint vase shaped glass : looks from a distance like a lager/pilsner , so light is the colouring , a true golden ale . plenty of bibbles rising through the beer , again like a lot of lagers/pilsners . on top sat an off-white foam , that soon gave way to a wisp ans collar .  mouthfeel is almost perfect - smooth but with a light , fluffy carbonation that is close to flawless .

s - rich aroma of bitter dark chocolate and roasted coffee .  poured from a 750 ml bottle into a tulip glass . a : very hazy , medium golden color with over one finger of diminishing white foam head . no lacing remains on the glass .  taste- great even keel for this beer . very good beer .

i have to say it , this beer smells fucking awesome . smooth , creamy , the ending is a little rough .  very fizzy head builds to about a finger and then , well , fizzes away . minimal lacing .  m-exceedingly smooth with a full , luxuriant body .

s : the nose is awesome . passion fruits strong and up front . exceptionally balanced and nuanced . t : the flavor does not disappoint .  the pour , a transparent and dark amber , is probably the only unremarkable aspect . there 's little head and carbonation , and it alone does nothing to prepare you for what 's to come .  mf/d : i love the mouth feel of this stout . the body has a rich fullness to it and feels slick on the tongue .

spectacular aromas of ripe aged cheese , sharp cider-like citrus , oak woodiness , grapefruit and overripe apples . somehow it has more of an `` alive '' character , wild and untamed . wild aroma meshes with the full flavors , giving it a very traditional , rustic feel .  pasturized bottled version at 4.4 % ... .poured a gold color with a small 1 finger white cap that goes to a nice lace and sticky ring .  mouth feel is awesome , just smooth creamy and dense , great weight and probably perfect carbonation , exactly what i would want in an ipa .

big bold piney hop nose . another good brew from great lakes . the hops are n't overbearing , balance is the word on this one .  buckler pours a golden amber from its 12oz brown glass bottle . head forms nicely then fades to just a wispy ring .  m- crisp and of medium viscosity . i love how crisp it is without being overly carbonated .

great aroma . clean piney , citrus , grapefruit aroma .  color is medium amber , crystal clear , with a quickly-dissipating head and some decent lace .  the mouthfeel is awesome . lots of carbonation and a crisp relatively dry finish .

this smells amazing . t-comes in with a very bitter taste of creamy hops and a touch of grapefruit along with other tropical fruits .  poured with a nice light tan head and a little lace .  m : incredibly smooth and one of the fastest pints around . smooth , crisp , with exceptional body and feel .

this is very hoppy . it has a big aroma and a sweet finish . there 's a good balance , but it 's more of a big ipa than a barleywine .  appearance has a nice golden color with little head , but good lace .  taste : smooth yet crackles with some of the finest carbonation yet to fill my mouth .

totally balls out nutmeg and a touch of cinnamon , this nose is phenomenal ... i 'm almost getting brandy too ... christian brothers or the like ... vanilla , even rum soaked cake with fruit now . perfect after more than three full years in the bottle , i could n't imagine a better aroma for a winter warmer .  picked up at de bierkoning in amsterdam from a bottle into a snifter appearance : pours with a very little off-white head that disappears right away .  i feel this beer really shines in its feel . it 's highly carbonated , but still feels rich and syrupy .

mild head forms with a hard pour that is gone befoe i could even blink and no lacing to speak of at all s : rich caramel notes upfront along with some biscuits , also a nice coconut and almost note is present and very enjoyable , maybe a little maple syrup as well . can definitely smell the wood and some vanilla and bourbon t : it starts off very vanilla tasting with hints of oak and then caramel . what is strange is some of the sips though are just straight booze which is a bit unpleasant m : some heat is present on this one and it could surely use a bit of time in the cellar , there is also a syrupy quality to it d : i look forward to trying this one again in a year .  the color looks great but the head left something to be desired .  m - thick , full bodied with medium to low carbonation which lends to a very smooth beer .

fruity ( tropical fruits ) with notes of mango and brown sugar . the taste was not nearly as impressive as the aroma . lots of hop bitterness in this one , without much actual hop flavor . the hops were very spicy and aggressive . grapefruit rind was most noticeable . while the aroma was punchy yet inviting , the taste was harsh , bitter and unbalanced .  very pale , not clear , a slightly hazey body with a thin white head . barley and wheat used in the brew , hence the almost negligible cloudy appearance .  caramel , ripe fruit , alcohol , brown sugar create an amazing complexity on the palate . long , balanced finish . an outstanding brew .

smell : this is good . the first thing i pick up on is a nice , juicy citrus hop punch . about as good a wild ale as i 've smelled . taste : great juicy citrus notes up front , followed by funk and moderate sourness .  poured into tulip . batch 243 bottled 7/5/09 a : rusty reddish body , minimal head barely covers the surface then dissipates .  by the smallest margin , i prefer the flavor bottled version , as there 's a more assertive resiny pine presence , but this is damned tasty , and the mouthfeel is simply incredible . long lingering embrace of hops in the finish , as the tangy citrus kicks up the bitterness a notch .

aroma of fresh tropical-fruit-like hops , and a touch of bread and fresh cookie ... .very interesting but very excellent . taste of smooth bitter hops , but without a large lingering bitterness on the palate .  poured a very light copper , but almost no head .  mouthfeel is spot on : wonderful carbonation combined with a luscious consistency .

poured a slight hazed lighter golden with a big fluffy , sticky white head that stuck like glue to the glass as it settled ever so slowly , man was i taken back by the nose of this bad boy highly hopped to say the least there is ammarillos in this puppy piney and very fruity over top of wheat malt its just sublime.very nicely balanced between the big hop attack big pine and grapefruit melding into a lightly toasted grainy wheat flavor in the finish.although the flavor doesnt have the punch the nose has its still very flavorfull , if you like hopped up american wheat ales this is a great choice , its ballsy and pretty refreshing to boot .  marked as bottle # 21 a- poured from the bottle with a thin tan head , which quickly evaporated to reveal a completely opaque still black body . moderately high astringency and a soft etoh heat .  great flavors , good complexity , an intriguing depth and an outstanding mouthfeel .

the scent is off the charts with the hops and awesome . the taste is pretty darn good , but not as great as i expected from the scent .  appearance - pours a brilliant gold with a thin head that fades almost immediately .  t/m : the taste is a citrus , grapefruit hop dominance , but the mouthfeel is as creamy as a glass of milk . a very interesting brew that works out very well .

s - freakin ' massive nose of various fruits . colder , it was a ripe strawberry . just a huge nose . t - in the bottle , i could n't really put my finger on it , and i ca n't on tap either . d - a beguiling , complicated beer that is difficult to pinpoint .  while watching the o state vs. michigan game , i decided to crack open what has become one of my favorite `` everyday '' beers . this is a light , refreshing beer that is everybit as appropriate in the middle of summer or the dead of winter.or anytime in between .  very thick in the mouth . has pretty good carbonation but the thickness is awesome . really believe this to be one of the best o-fest beers because of the mouthfeel .

smell was outstanding . rich and chocolatey , sweet and creamy with strong notes of vanilla and alcohol soaked raisins .  seeing as how this beer is called nosferatu , i expected it to be one of two colors . dark as night , or blood red . despite the color being not what i expected , this beer certainly has `` bite '' .  perfect mouth for a good sipping beer .

batch # 3 ( bottled feb. 2009 ) very pleasing aroma , smells creamy and rich . medium brown coloring with a ton of particles floating in it .  this beer is one of the latest tuborg lagers . this is a much hoppier beer than the green or red .  body is very good and carbonation perfect .

finally i got the gift set of the 3 bottles of chimay and the goblet . s - the smell hits you as soon as you open the bottle . sweetness balanced with malty bready goodness . it smells juicy . t - sweet and carmelly balanced well with maltyness .  ba 4th dementia looks very similar to its base beer ( deep fig flesh colored ) but noticeably cloudier with no head . while there was no head , the carbonation is just right ; the body is no thinner or heavier than it should be .  m : very silky and smooth . carbonation almost unnoticeable . great texture .

smell : awesome and powerful . wow . mouthfeel : creamy , boozy , smooth , but also very herbal and intriguing . it certainly has me engaged . certainly a winner here that deserves lots of contemplation . a complex brew that dignifies old world brewing , upcoming craft breweries , and the inventive attitude that brings us there .  12oz bottle pours a murky orange brown color with a medium sized peach tinged head .  t : malts , booze , citrus , and hop bitterness m : perfect , just the right carbonation overall , this is just darn brilliant !

s- dark roasted coffee and cream , bakers chocolate , brown sugar . beautiful interplay of roast and sweet . malts are rich and deep . some dark fruits buried in there . lively active carb that lightens things up even more .  poured into a nonic glass from a 12oz long neck brown bottle with a crimped cap notched jun no year would assume it 's winter 06 ' . clear , ruby red , creamy , very light tan 2 '' head dissapated a bit quick to a creamy thin layer of foam . not a lot of carbination with little lacing .  mouthfeel was excellent . medium to thick bodied with a perfect amount of carbonation and creaminess .

had a dark red hue that i could just barely see through s : smell was ridiculously awesome ! exactly what i think of as a peanut butter and jelly . she absolutely loved it and is begging for more already .  a - pours a murky deep amber with a rocky white head leaving plenty of lace s - mellow smoke and toffee notes with caramel sweetness in the scent .  taste follows well , it 's bitter in a way as if there is some significant hopping which is odd as legend 's ipa is not well hopped.. mouthfeel is awesome . smooth and silky without being syrupy or thick .

s- it smells exactly like fresh cherries . overall : make sure to share because one bottle is a lot for one person , but a very good beer with a really fresh flavor and smell .  appearance : the label reads `` batch # 11/2009/bottle # 437 ; i am a sucker for stuff like that . it pours a dark , somewhat reddish amber . a moderately rough pour produces only a smallish off-white head , but man ... smell : ... the tartness nevertheless explodes out of the bottle as if it 's been waiting for you to knock .  it felt perfect . one of the few beers that i enjoy holding above my tongue just for the feeling .

on tap at the brew pub ... pours a medium gold orange , light tan head good retention and lacing ... the aroma is phenomenal , by far the best smelling citra beer i 've had . a great mix of really fresh and sweet oranges and grapefruits .  poured into a snifter , it shows a very dark brown with minimal head .  rich and creamy . thick to the point where im expecting lumps , but no lumps appear . huge , as a good ris should be .

smells amazing - citrusy and sweet , with a hint of malt .  large head fades to zip pretty quick , lacing is minimal .  d : such a balanced beer and the mouthfeel is really exceptional and was possibly the favorite part of the beer .

absolutely fantastic . t : exactly as above with some freshly shaved lemon/orange zest .  golden to amber with slight haze , slight head retention with stark-white , clinging , lacy bubbles .  given the above par flavors and great mouthfeel i have to say this beer was one of the most sessionable beers i tried in the country .

22oz bottle poured into my half acre pint glass ... pours an incredibly thick and hazy pale orange with just a one finger light tan head that leaves a bit of lacing behind ... smells wonderfully of sweet and juicy tropical fruit , pineapple and mango come to mind . juicy , i know juicy is not a smell , but it just smells , well , juicy ... tastes as the smell led on , juicy and fruity , tropical and sweet up front . sticky and resinous finish , very good ... would love if this one was canned along side the regular daisy cutter ...  a great alternative to your standard light beers !  consumed in a hotel room in amsterdam appearance : served in a small water glass at slightly cooler than room temperature , dark as night with a light creamy tan head ... looks much like an espresso , something ive been more or less living off of for the last 2.5 weeks on the road smell : peat malts , dark belgian chocolate , light notes of the scotch barrels taste : rich dark malts , peat , earthy , dark chocolate , char , scotch , dark fruit , very smooth but forceful mouthfeel : silky smooth , medium-full chocolatey body drinkability : sipper , but nice

s- i smell a lot of citrusy hops . it smells fresh , crisp , and clean . t- it tastes similar to how it smells .  utterly fantastic . some of them get a bit sweet but malone either got this sufficiently dry or the ibus balance it out to keep it from being cloying . only ding is that the appearance is cloudy . not sure if that 's some yeast or traces of hops from dry hopping or protein haze or what .  thick chewy mouthfeel with fine carbonation .

a- a gentle pour yields a pale golden body with a sunset tint and a violent ivory fluff of the finest foam , which hangs around for the whole drink s- all hops all the time . a menagerie of citrus including grapefruit , lemon zest , orange , and a kiwi thrown in for good measure . i would almost be happy just to sit and smell this , even if i could n't drink it ... almost .  one-finger head dissipates easily . s- most points are earned by the aroma- very rich citrus smells , including grapefruit , orange , lemon , and , of course , tangerine . t- the citrus seemed out of balance , overpowering the wheat .  thereis also a carmelized sugary feel along with what i percieve to be some molasses notes . the body of this brew is super dense , but at the same time has almost an airy , creamy feeling to it which i can only describe as magnificient . no barleywine that i have ever tasted has such as mouthfeel as this one .

smell is wonderfully balanced . big heavy malts invade the nose gently giving way to crisp citrus hops with a resiny finish .  pours a nice dark brown/black with two fingers of white head that disappears very quickly and leaves no lacing .  the finish on this beer was so exceptionally smooth .
s : outstanding . freshly baked banana bread .  pours brown with a small , short-lived , tanned head .  the verdict : truly luscious body with a coy palate . fantastic beer .

a great spicy citrus nose with a sweet boozy kick . if you dig the hoppy explosion , buy a case !  this is the beer that saved smoke beer for me . instead of smelling just like a lit fireworks punk like the first sample in this case the smoke balances with other smells and flavors .  mouthfeel was amazingly smoothe going down .

big smoke up front with a strong whisky backbone . if this is n't a manly beer , i do n't know what is . think of drinking a campfire and throw some scotch whisky in there , that 's what it taste like .  starts with a decent off white head and instantly dissipates into nothing .  the mouthfeel is nice , very creamy and lucious , substanial but light at the same time . exceptional indeed .

nice rich and malty nose ! smells big and robust . smells smoky and dry with chocolate malts and sweet toffee . fantastic nose on this one !  a : pours a deep brown body , with a 1/2 '' tan head that fades to a thin film quickly . only a few small dots of lacing are left on the glass .  -- awesome mouthfeel- a smooth milk-like creaminess . so light and fluffy and full . there is barely any carbonation to disturb the whole experience . thank goodness , my tongue is so happy .

this is an amazing aroma ! not a very complex flavor , disappointing compared to the wonderfully complex smell . as it warms , it stays the same .  hazy golden yellow . one finger fizzy head . i 'm not sure why new belgium chose this style as their autumn seasonal , but it 's good .  silky in the mouth .

smells great . sweet , very small amount of hops and slightly alcoholic . the alcohol smell is very good , almost like a fine liquor as it warms .  opaque , black poured with a quick mocha head quickly turning into a foam ring with a slight coat of foam . some tiny bubbles stringing to the surface with some spotty lacing .  the mouthfeel is one if the best i 've ever had .

has a wonderful , rich hoppy aroma , with plenty of pine , spice , heather and peat . i 've brewed rye pa 's that do n't smell as good , but taste better .  appearance-a very very dark amber with a 3 finger tan head . leaves little to no lacing and dissipates fairly quickly .  mouthfeel is exceptional . thich but very smooth with a crisp , semi-dry , bitter finish .

i love that smell . taste is like smoke sausage .  a - a nice straw colored brew thats got some nice carbonation and a super white head that quickly recedes and sticks at a thin layer . outside of the head nothing all that special going on here .  mouthfeel is coating but not syrupy . outstanding in this area .

smells of bourbon and chocolate right off the bat . vanilla , licorice and molasses are mixed with hints of burnt sugar . some harsher alcohol comes out as she warms up , but i could smell this thing all night if you let me . i really enjoyed this one , although it is certainly a sipper and maybe a touch too sweet . i 'm glad i got to try this but at north of 20 dollars for the 750 this is one and done for me .  a very average looking ipa , the selling point is the flavor and aroma , fresh citrus and pine engulf the senses with much pleasure .  m- creamy and smooth .
the aroma is great , the aftertaste is not .  this beer pours a very dark brown . it boasts a nice looking brown head .  mouthfeel is full and round .

yow , this one is pungent ! bourbon up front with lots of dark chocolate and espresso and booze , complex and in your face the aroma is outstanding . taste is bold , strong chocolate with a bourbon backbone and at the end there is a clean bittering of hops , not as sensational as the smell , but darn good with a nice alcohol warming .  kinda looks like apricots .  the mouth feel of this beer is really incredible .

4.5 the smell is the best thing about this beer it very floral kind of bready and a little sweet and you really cant smell the alcohol at all . 5 a little citric to start fallowed by kind of coffee like taste then ending with a bit of belgian sweetness that i am very fond of .  purchased single bottle from martignetti's appearance = clear , crisp brown with fairly weak head and lacing .  full , super creamy body .

the nose is very appealing on this one . 1st sip is slightly lighter than i expected with very fine carbonation as well .  pours a dull hazy straw color with a bright white morang like head . it 's visual appeal is the weakest facet .  full bodied , slightly thick , flavorful , and all around a very enjoyable beer that i wish i could get more readily ... just what i hoped it 'd be , and easily one of my favorites .

chocolate dominates with notes of coffee and dark fruits to back it up . minimal hop presence in the smell , but it 's there . hops are a pleasant earthy backbone , still quite fruity , too .  dull golden color with significant haze , slight crown of foam with small white bubbles .  medium-ish body .

smell is a lot of chocolate , roasted nuts , beautifully rounded with an espresso aroma . complex . taste is similar , but more faint than indicated by the aroma .  a - motor oil black , with a 1/2 finger of dark , dark chocolate head , and dissipates immediately . no lacing left behind and low carbonation .  mouth is also as good as it gets for heavy stouts . also with very crisp carbonation . its quite amazing in flavor and mouthfeel , but as far as `` drinkability '' is concerned , its very boozey and powerful .

s : once the pour started , i caught extreme amounts of hops and a great yeasty smell . t : the taste was nearly exceptional , i loved the taste immediately of the hops and the malt that just kind of lingered on your tongue .  appearance is a little thin for the style .  very smooth body and almost creamy carbonation .

smells of creamed coffee and chocolate with faint hints of figs and raisins . one of the best smelling beers ever ! taste is lovely chocolate and coffee and dried fruits with mild to moderate sweetness and faint tail of resinous hops .  unfortunately i had to drink this straight from the bottle due to extenuating circumstances so i cant comment on the appearence . s- the beer gave off a fairly strong roasted malt smell with hints of roasted coffee . mf & d- the stout was medium bodied with a creamy mouth coating that actually finishes quite dry . a worthy addition to my preferred stout list . definitely deserving of three or four follow up servings .  huge full mouthfeel .

my favorite smelling stout so far , i ca n't put my finger on the smell , but it was such a refreshing and fresh smell i 've never smelled in a beer before . the taste followed up to copy the brilliant smell . what ever smelled so great also tasted as good as it smelled . mouthfeel and drinkability i would say are slightly above average . i did n't really expect much out of this brew , but i was pleasantly suprised , i would definately check this out again .  a : pours a clear pale lemon with massive carbonation producing an overly large head . about 2 inches of beer and 4+ inches of bubbly , billowy white head .  m- this gets a 5 because it had a perfect level of carbonation and a really nice mouthfeel .

the smell is exceptional though . strong burnt caramel , pumpkin , malt aromas waft up .  this pours a red-tinged mahogany colour with a very short lasted milk chocolate coloured head . no lacing .  extremely creamy mouthfeel !

s : it 's like smelling pure coffee beans . absolutely the best coffee smell i 've had from a brew .  appearance : poured with 2 fingers of bubbly tan head that dissipated to a rim around the top of the glass leaving no lacing . the beer is dark brown and does n't let any light thtough .  m : perfection here , this is a great beer for chewing .

smell : the malt and yeasts combine to give it an initial scent almost like pie crust . it finishes with a great blend of spices ranging from cinnamon to nutmeg and all spice .  a : pours a mostly clear golden-amber body . 1-1/4 '' lightly creme colored head fades slowly . carbonation bubbles are almost non existent , only one or two tiny ones rise slowly now and then in the glass . d : another great offering from oskar blues in a can . very crisp , very drinkable .  very nice m-medium body and oh so smooth !

s : ipa fruitiness , really beautiful . not particularly bitter , fruity citrusy hops , which is very very different from citrusy yeast .  poured with very little head .  m : slightly sticky and slick mf but overall a super creamy light bodied brew that is just so delicate on the palate . i imagine this brew is amazing off of a cask .

this smells amazing and looks delightful -- but the taste ... well , i 've had better .  the moment : a good day with the boys ( will , michael , joey ) done ... glassware : ayinger willibecker ... appearance : reasonably light , straw yellow body with a head that flattens quickly but remains consistent throughout drinking ... aroma : fresh lemon zest with an underpining of hops that suggests a complexity uncommon to wheats ... .  mouthfeel : terrific . full bodied , smooth , and creamy .

really quite floral . aroma is really quite unique . dried flowers and potpourri .  at first glance the beer looks like it might be a let down . it is light in color and there was n't much head on it and its a bit hazy . i still gave the appearance a 3 because it had a nice color to it , even though its not what i would expect from a dipa at all .  hops hit you right off then the different fruit flavors mixing with that pine resin and the smooth thick mouthfeel lets you know that your drinking a nice beer here .

nose is quite organic , with a lot of herbal characters , green grape skin , hint of honey , very finely balanced though . phenomenally well balance , tart and sweet and bitter are all there , very natural , funky herbal smell . hang is there , a bit tart , but otherwise very nicely balanced . mouthfeel is full , thick and sticky - very nice , and there is not a hint of the 8 % alc/vol . a shit-fucked good beer in fact . i like this so much i love it .  pours a one finger tan head over a cloudy and particulated amber-rust liquid . smells minty duringthe pour . creamed corn to the nose . chocolate covered plum and raisin with a touch of cherry sour .  nice , full mouthfeel .

still very good . lively carbonation .  pours a murky golden . starts off with asmall thick head then dissapates to nothing . sell me a growler fff !  m : smooth and syrupy - exceptionally smooth in imo d : strong sweet flavors and alcohol , but still smooth and delicious .

it has a knock-your-socks-off ipa nose . my expectations were set high for a strong hoppy presence given the aroma , but was disappointed . not a bad ipa , some good hops in there , but nothing outstanding .  12oz bottle app : cloudy straw with a small cap .  m : full bodied , silky , slick and oily but has a surprisingly clean finish .

a-nice cloudy gold with a thick cream colored head s-this smells great . it smells of banana and some funk . good strength t-comes in with a malty and faint taste of banana and some funk . m-light creamy carbonation with a watery finish o-the appearance and smell got me so excited but i was let down by the taste .  thin soapy head on an amber to light copper beer . rich caramel and toasted nuts , with a slight hop aroma in the smell . caramel and slight roasted character in the malt , slight hop grassiness , very clean yeast character , with a pleasant bitterness at the end . slightly undercarbonated , but very smooth , for the style , this was slightly heavy ... a very clean and malty apa , that dose n't revolve around hop aroma and bitterness .  very thick feeling , creamy , velvety .

this is a wonderfully complex aroma that lends itself more towards a sour than a saison . nonetheless , it 's fantastic . t : the under-ripe tones of the fruit are prevalent moreso in the flavor than in the nose and man is it full of it .  a- semi aggressive pour produces a 1 finger khaki/light brown head that recedes somewhat quick leaving little in the way of lacing . beer is brown in color with hints of ruby .  it 's smooth taste is characterized by a perfect blend of hops and a great mouthfeel .

s : huge malty nose : chocolate , dark bread ; sour cherry , molasses , wood , alcohol .  appearance this one poured a deep brown in color with lots of carbonation and a nice head that went down rather quickly .  slightly thick and a bit syrupy going down but not cloying in flavor . the carbonation is on the soft side making it rich and smooth .

smells smoky , roasted , chocolate , pungent of thick darkness .  pours with ever the slightest little smidgen of beautifully tan head that practically evaporates into the air , leaving what appears to be a clear puddle of mud in my glass . absolutely no lacing .  mouth is a caress of carbonation , perfectly so .

smell : gorgeous citrus and cider aromas .  i 've been on an amber style kick for a few months now , and this beer is fairly local , paired with my boss giving his recommendation , i decided to give it a spin . it 's really one of the best beers i 've tried in a while , and when we have it in , i recommend it to any of my customers looking to try a new , easy drinking brew with a good amount of character .  m- super creamy and lush but not so chewy as to be a stout .

it 's a complex aroma that has a lot of things going on but they meld together pretty well .  poured brown with a nice head . this is one of the rare occasions where i actually notice the smell of a beer without trying to look like i 'm snorting suds .  m : full bodied and silky . have n't had a beer with a mouthfeel this good in a really long time .

south shores cream is definitely not for everyone but i think that it is pretty darn neat . its aroma smacks you upside the head with lavender , boat loads of lavender . the taste is as bold and unique as the nose . my overall impression is of sun dried tomatoes and basal .  smaller dark tan head fading quickly to a few light traces of foam and some minor lacings around the glass .  m- very creamy and smooth with a bit of a carbonated bite at the finish . d- a very enjoyable take on the style .
great stuff .  appearance - hazy orangish very light head with no lacing .  feels amazing . wet and quenching .

s- smells fantastic , with a very appealing milk chocolate scent followed up with beautiful dark fruit and coffee hints . truly excellent .  on tap on 11.12.11 at flying saucer in cordova tn poured with barely any head , might have been the way the taps were set up , other then the nitro brews i did n't see any beers with a head on them leaving the bar .  beautiful . d : great in so many ways , but just a little too hot on the finish to be truly drinkable .

the best smelling witbier i 've ever experienced - coconut , pia colada , pineapple , orange marmalade , ripe almost green banana , candy orange slices with raw sugar , lemon zest , and a bit of spice from the cardamon .  just the right amount of rye to make it unique and interesting , but not too much of anything . not much of a head - makes me worry about age .  quite a full and velvety body . it had excellent body too , and the alcohol was fairly well hidden .

smells like hershey 's chocolate syrup and willy wonka 's chocolate factory . as with most beers from this series it 's best split with a friend as it 's so incredibly tastey that one is just enough .  looks : like molten gold . so hazy my fingers on the other side of the glass are mere fuzzy shadows . the pour results in no head ; just the lightest mention of off-white fizz along the sides .  with the perfect amount of carbonation .

big smoke , with a big coffee/dark chocolate finish . outstanding . taste is huge malt , tons of chocolate and coffee , with a big bitter finish and hops aftertaste .  poured into an e & j cask & cream glass on 5/30/11 rustic , faded brown with copper hues and some amber at the stem . basically no lace until the end of the glass .  love the feel to this brew .

incredible aroma - fruity , hoppy , with a heavy toffee/coffee malt base . it may in fact be just a bit too thick , but it 's still excellent . a truly fine imperial stout .  pours golden into my dogfish signature glass . it 's like i 'm at a good pizzeria drinking beer .  full-bodied for the style with a super creamy , rich and fluffy mouthfeel .

wonderul aroma composing of dark chocolate , herbal spice , coffee , roasted grain , and vanilla . roasted grain , sweet malt , and coffee great the tounge . some dark chocolate , a hint of butter , and more coffee come through .  looks kinda lifeless , but there is some carbonation bubbles popping up along the edges .  the flavors and mouthfeel are amazingly well-integrated , and it feels like drinking velvet .

this stuff smells absolutely amazing . honey and bananas moved to the nose quickly by the very active carbonation .  a : pours a relatively clear copper , with small head that leaves little lacing .  m : perfection . this is the smoothest ipa i 've had to date .

a very nice , well balanced ipa .  hazy and cloudy look to this one i have to admit , as i was waiting to find some sediment , but none came forward . nice three inches of white then topped out over the glass and settled down lightly into a nice little pillow of white , which was reinforced but lots of carbonation . the flavor was very crisp , very clean with a well rounded profile that was very pleasing .  m - the feel is full and rich like an amazing glass of red wine . this has such a rich velvety texture ; amazing .

i think i just sat here and took in all the aromas for 20-25 minutes before i had a drink . this is probably the best smelling barley wine i know of with a citrus grapefruit , pine and floral odors .  this one initially poured all head ( off white ) . took a while and settled to a medium and slightly hazy amberish-orange color .  m : incredibly thick , i love a stout as thick as this .

the smell is all hops ... in fact , i would say it is an outstanding smell . very clean , sharp citrus -- not unlike grapefruit .  aroma- earthy , deep carab , chocolate , a hint of acridity gives it an edge , deep and layered , but tight and not jumping out of the glass appearance- thin , dark espresso head leaves no lace . if you are the kind of person who spends 8 bucks on designer chocolate at the healthfood store , you 'll probably love this .  m - it was very soft and velvety .

s- very sweet dark fruit , molasses , brown sugar , alcohol , vanilla , cinnamon , and a touch of anise . very strong and appealing . t- dark roasted malts along with a very sweet molasses aspect .  said to be older , sour version . pours a nice hazy apricot ale with three finger of white foam . the beer was initially a little hi in carb , but fell to appropriate .  m : exceedingly velvety smooth and easy to drink , which is amazing given the 11 % abv .

a-deep amber with low head and decent lace . s-exceptional very rich and malty , carmel notes with sweet cinnamon also some nutty undertones t-again very high marks everything in the nose is very boldly revaled again in the flavor .  a : dark reddish brown with a tine white head . small amount of lacing .  great creamy smooth mouthfeel , perfect carbonation .

the nose on this beer is a delight , and i 'm completely surprised by the 5.9 % abv , since i would have pegged this quite a bit higher given is medium bodied thickness . the aroma is peach , apricot , some hoppy grapefruit , and a peculiar candied smell . this is really interesting and sweet and malty . this is a complex beer and well worth seeking out .  it was a little disappointing to see this beer comes from the tap and have no head on it considering it 's a belgian but that did n't really seem to detract from the flavors of the beer . it was quite a darker color than i thought it would be as well .  mouthfeel is unbelievable ! ultra thick and creamy with a perfect amount of carbonation .

a- pours mahogany in color with two fingers worth of impressive thick head which leaves heavy off beige lacing around the glass s- strong citrus hops abound also slight hint of apricots gorgeous assertive nose . it has a wonderful nose and sold hop character .  a- pitch black color , non-transparent , very thin tan ring around the glass s- dark chocolate , coffee beans , dark malts , hint of dark fruit t- freshly brewed coffee , milk chocolate , creamy , vanilla , roasted malts , slightly sweet m- medium/heavy body , low/medium carbonation , rich , smooth , silky d- great session stout good full flavors but not too overpowering .  m : the carbonation is perfect for a barleywine .

the aroma surges out of the bottle - bitter orange hops , mostly .  pours with very little head but for a filmy ring of foam at edge of beer that does n't cling . beer itself looks like dirty apple cider , and wow is this murky ! beer is a dirty , rosewood color with slightly reddish highlights .  matching taste and awesome creamy mouthfeel .

aroma is very spicy and lemony with some green fresh herb notes . very aromatic . flavor is very perfumy with white peppercorns and intense lemon .  murky body with little to no head or lacing .  excellent mouthfeel from this bottle-conditioned brew .

overall there is definitely a lot going on with this beer in the taste and smell department . it 's up there with one of the best smelling beers i 've had so far . very fresh and aromatic . i was surprised at how tart the flavour was at first , but it really grew on me as i progressed through the bottle . it 's a fantastic beer that is a must try .  a hard pour rouses some big bubbles , and leaves a partial collar of tiny bubbles and a few tiny spots of lace . looks like wine , but a murky raisin-brown color .  solid mouthfeel , but there is a charming lightness to it , despite the style and the barrel aging .

'' it 's a fitting name for this turbo-charged ipa with its explosive floral-spice aroma , scintillating hop flavor , and roundhouse kick of bittering . this is a fine ale to sacrifice on the alter to the hop gods and another contender for the crown .  pours a hazy deep orange-copper with a monstrous beige head ... i must have poured this one too quickly ... be aware when you pour this - i had to wait for more than 5 minutes to be able to taste this one .  it 's amazing . smooth , light , and a billion tiny bubbles that appear on your tongue .

smell : chocolate , roasted grains , some notes of barley , a sprinkling of vanilla , and peek or two of coffee . this is a yummy smelling brown ale .  appearance : a very dark / almost black ale without head . very light carbonation . it looks like a stout .  a little light for a german style but still tastes distinctly german . creamy mouthfeel and very , very smooth . medium bodied well carbonated making it quite drinkable .

the nose is very powerful , very impressive . the taste is very piney , not a whole lot of citrus there . overall , this is a very enjoyable ipa .  a - very strong soapy head . brew is nice ruby red , also with lots of browns . clarity is weak as is lacing .  alcohol was very very well hidden and the warming effect in the mouth led to an excellent mouthfeel .

s : the cherry really comes out in the smell , slightly sour . very complex . t : taste starts with a bready malt/yeast and plenty of spices as well .  not much head retention/lacing . the color in this lighting is a dark amber , almost brown .  very full feeling in your mouth , thick and heavy but smooth .

smell - heavenly . strong hops mixed with chocolate with hints of coffee and caramel . mouthfeel - rich creamy goodness . drinkability - great beer , highly drinkable .  brooklyn keller helles pours a golden straw-yellow color , some cloudy white head in the courtesy cups they give you at the brewery .  rich and chewy body , very full and creamy , and without the sharp slice of razor hops i was expecting . taste is initially slightly piquant , with pine needle freshness at the fore , but the body mellows and the palate is wonderfully long , balancing through some light fruit characters before the chewy , sweet and full finish , which is like caramelised sugar on the tongue . mouthfeel is as heavy , slick and glutinous as anything i 've yet had .

the bouquet is big on this one , very complex , with aromas of musty cheese , earthy fermented grapes , and some sort of floral soapy nose . ( i only suppose manure tastes like it smells ... alright ? ) nice consistency , the brew feels like mulled cider as it rolls across my tounge , tart and zesty .  drunk at transport , melbourne . poor head , but that was barmaid 's fault , not the beer . nice soft gold .  a sweetness lingers in the back , but just enough to give the brew the right body the mouthfeel is one of the most unique ones out there . i have heard others mention an oily mouthfeel and this one is a perfect example of that oily hop mouthfeel ... one of the coolest things about beer that i have ever experienced !

tasted june 2nd 2011 ( from notes ) poured into a la chouffe tulip a - deep thick oil black , super dark tan half finger head and a little lacing s - anise up front , molasses , toffee , coffee , bittersweet chocolate , slight hops , very pungently sweet yeast , oak , toasted goodness , dark fruits and very earthy . slight vanilla and leather notes t - anise , chocolate , coffee , very sweet ( definitely the belgian yeast ) , alcohol , herbal outside of anise , slight hops . this thing is a huge but awesome stout final thought - great beer , 10.5 % and only $ 5 , this beer is awesome . thank you stone !  tasted at caesar 's palace in vegas , could n't see the appearance because i drink from the bottle , but the logo had some hops and a landscape ; smell : perfumed with hops and some apple , honey and toffee ; tasted : floral and pine hops together with pineapple and peach scents ; mouthfeel : dry , bittersweet with a bitter finish , medium body and low carbonation ; drinkability : very good , i drank while playing slots .  the malts are incredibly thick and rich , the mouthfeel is just luscious .

the smell is really big and out of this world . taste : the taste is fruity like the smell .  a- pours a light yellow , straw color . not much of a head even after an aggresive pour . m- what a great feel for a pilsner , extremly smooth , light body , med-high carbonation .  the mouthfeel was perfect for a dark lager .

appearance is a solidly dense orange-amber hue , one finger of soapy white bubbles sustains , moderate lacing smell is big caramel/sweet bread malts battling with equally large citrus hops , hints of pine resin and light fruit , delicious ! taste is mostly pine and citrus ( orange/lemon ) hops initially , nice balance of sweetbread and caramel malts soon after , tones of toffee , brown sugar , floral , and grapefruit , finishes more sweet than bitter mouthfeel is medium-bodied , thick resiny texture , moderate to high carbonation level drinkability is moderate , this is a solid single ipa with a very admirable malt/hop balance , the flavor tends to slip away a bit too quickly , but at 6 % you can make sure your drinking of it is more constant , very sessionable  poured into stone irs tulip . a : very hazy , ruddy caramel color .  clean and soft on the palette , so amazing to earn a 5 . drinkable to have a few more .

smell : a bit of toasty malts , but the aroma is dominated by a wonderful citrusy and grapefruity hop aroma . taste : toasty upfront with some light citric sweetness and tartness , followed by a bit of peppery spice .  pours brown with a small tan had .  mouthfeel is thick and chewy . very impressed , much more so than other trappistes and clones i 've had the privelege to try .

s : great sweet smell that you can really `` eat '' . d : great ale for drinking in a camping setting , outside , etc ... i would never turn down this if offered !  2009 bottle . pours nearly black with almost no head , or at least none that lasts more than a fleeting few seconds . the beer is a very pretty color though , in a snifter a reddish brown color shows through but all together it 's a pretty dark beer .  aside from the exceptional mouthfeel , nothing remarkable going on here .

the color is exactly where i would want it for a chocolate stout . just enough brown to give the impression of chocolate . the aroma on this brew is beyond words . the best i can come is tootsie rolls . the chocolate is certainly the dominant smell .  bronze amber , approaching crystal clarity . no head but that 's more a matter of dispense than anything .  mouthfeel - medium-full bodied and extremely creamy . this beer feels like velvet in the mouth .

on the hoppy/bitter side but has a wonderful citrus smell and graoefruit taste .  a-deep ruby copper with a thin , light tan ring that left zero lace .  the body was medium light with a high carbonation and a super creamy mouthfeel .

i kid you not . good finish . m - good carbonation and coating .  pours a transparent orange-red-brown ... color of a pumpkin i guess you might say . tiny head which settles to a ring . no lacing .  feels very smooth and clean , not overly bitter .

nose is standard witbier smell , but at the same time is an exemplary witbier aroma . a very complex nose blended to perfection , and as good as a witbier nose will get . the flavours are alright for the style and hey , it 's very drinkable but after that explosively blossoming sweet nose this taste is very disappointing . i just wanted more , to be honest . mouthfeel is velvety and smooth but overall , there is a lack of character once i pour this into my mouth .  poured from a bomber into a rr snifter ... a - pours a deep brown with ruby hues and a one finger khaki head that dissipates almost immediately . there is no lace to be had ... s - caramel , toffee , dark fruits , a good amount of alcohol , and some tart notes ... t - caramel , toffee , chocolate , and a hint of figs .  wonderful mouthfeel with a good thickness and carbonation to keep it from feeling syrupy .

aroma , wow . pine needles and grapefruit galore . decadent with each whiff . a tremendous smelling beer . sweet malt with heavy pine accented hops .  appearance : cloudy , hazy & pale yellow body with lots of bubbles but a very thin ring that quickly dissipates .  mouthfeel : the feel is my favorite part about this beer . a bit over medium bodied , with very fine , light carbonation . incredibly creamy going down .

the aroma is floral , definite pineapple , nice peppery phenolics . nice spicy flavour . firm bitterness and copious english hop flavour keep it very crisp , while the belgian yeast notes ( pineapple , pepper ) carry over strongly from the aroma .  poured into a goblet , it was very hazy with a dark brown center ; i got a thick tan head that quickly thinned out into a thin ring with no lacing ; there is a lot of carbonation .  m - this is where the beer really excels .

s : the best part of the stout it smells of chocolate with a bit of a woody smell as if you could smell the bourbon barrel . the smell it a bit more complex than their to be named later stout which is now know as sodbuster stout . t : more neutral than their normal stout but there are hints of coffee chocolate and due to the aging process the bourbon barrel . the stout really takes on the taste of the bourbon barrel and really intermingles with the chocolate taste of the stout . this cost me about $ 4.25 which is $ 0.25 more than a refill of the their sodbuster stout in a growler , i personally would prefer the growler over a pint of the bourbon stout , but it is definitely worth a try .  came with a neat glass . i was sceptical when a almost colorless beer was put in front of me , with a minimal head , but the smell of lemon was inviting .  full-bodied , rich , and creamy mouthfeel . almost chewey . very good beer , but not nearly as interesting as barleywine should be .

s : mmmm , so good . chocolate , caramel , bourbon , brown sugar , coffee bean . utterly delicious . t : a little disappointing . overall quite nice , but less wonderful than the smell had led me to believe .  a : very murky and cloudy . the head is high , little teeny bubbles that last for 5+ minutes .  mouthfeel is wonderfully chewy .

smells amazing , it really smells like pumpkin pie which i guess is expected but it is really nice . feels nice but would be a little better with more carb . overall this is a very good beer , low carbonation makes it a little weird , but maybe it was just this bottle .  a dark amber fills the glass with a small white head of tiny bubbles that melts to a fine ring very quickly .  quite hoppy , but also with a fairly sweet maltiness , and a great , full mouthfeel .

very nice . t : a good mix of grapefruit and orange on the tongue .  a : pours a light amber with a slight haze and 1 inch of off white head that drops to a thin film .  slippery and smooth . outstanding mouthfeel ! ! !

body and carbonation are perfect for style . finish is like flavor , clean , balanced , and of good length .  a : amber-brown with yeasty chunks , light tan head , no retention , slight lace .  nice creamy soft mouthfeel in this hop bomb .

s : phenomenal aroma . there is an incredible wild yeast sourness in the nose . every time i smell the beer , searching for additional scents , i become completely distracted by the incredible sour aroma . t : unique for sure . the beer lacks the complexity i expected from the intriguing scents .  singletrack copper ale pours a dark copper from a 12oz twist off cap bottle . head was up and down , not much to speak of .  m - perfect medium mouth feel .

the sent of hops rushes out at you at the crack of the cap . this is one of the best smelling ipa 's ever .  poured from a 12-ounce bottle into my shaker pint ; pours a dark black with slight highlights of crimson on the edges , topped with a two-finger tan head that slowly recedes to a thin glaze ( decent lacing ) , and it does not appear to be very carbonated .  m : oatmeal stouts always have a creamy , full mouthfeel , and this one is no different .

the last pour is opaque , and the fruit flavors are denser and come more to the front ... incredible aromatics - positively bursting with sour earthy raspberry , in no way artificial , frozen , or commercial , just wild and pure fruit . delightful . bracing sourness on the palate - a puckering unripe acidity that overwhelms the specic fruit utilized .  expiry date of feb 2009 i 'm generally not a fan of magic hat -- too sweet and bland . well done magic hat .  the beer had a great mouthfeel , with a very hard water like texture and smooth carbonation .

smells amazing , i was n't expecting this but it was big on grapefruit.. very very fruity and i love it .  this kriek pours with an amber body topped by a thin head with little lacing .  mouthfeel is full and round .

i get some pumpkin pie spice on the aroma . the beer is a bit hazy , but the aroma and taste are wonderful .  pours a slightly transparent dark ruby-brown with . the head is somewhat off-white and just shy of two fingers thick .  super thick mouthfeel , absolutely velvety and palate-coating .

big time hop aroma , as was expected , grapefruit is the main player here followed up by subtle pineyness . overall a great imperial ipa , the great balance between the malts and the hops make it enjoyable for all , even if your not a `` hop-head '' .  i was told at the time of ordering that this was a lambic , but the description on this site of it as an oud bruin makes a lot more sense . it poured a red brown opaqueness with very little head .  excellent mouthfeel .
strong fruity scent of bananas , very nice . initial tastes of light banana and general fruitiness .  the beer pours a very pale gold color with a thin white lace head .  terrific mouthfeel .

awesome . additional milk chocolate , floral fox glove , burnt caramel and coffee aromas are present . perfectly balanced and strong as all heck , this puppy is 5 worthy .  leaves no lace .  m - fantastic , crisp with a perfect level of carbonation overall , port city has made a delightful fall seasonal .

as the pint is lifted , the aroma grabs your nose and twists it into a question mark as it tries to sort out what lurks below . the smoke is subdued , though , about a third of the intensity of a traditional deutsch rauchbier , allowing the rich malty aroma to come through on its own merits . hop aromas are minimal .  a - alright , looks like a cider . afterwards i get a burst of apricot .  smooth , luscious mouthfeel ; satiny . full bodied and soft .

mmmmm , exceptional nose here . dark fruits , sour cherries , cheap cola and funky farmhouse scents .  poured this one into a chimay chalice . poured with very little head , and what was there dissipated in seconds . it was a dark khanki color .  now the mouth feel is fantastic , swished it around and it was almost as if i was chewing on a piece of bubble gum .

s : wonderful aroma ! !  these guys rarely disappoint , though , so here we go ... pours a deep amber with a slight haze throughout . well carbonated and reveals a nice , foamy head that quickly retires into a short crown . some spotty lacing .  the mouthfeel is very thick .

very briefly , this was excellent . fruity with raisins , port , honey bourbon and vanilla , the balance between the base beer and the barrels is exceptionally done here . fantastic . 4.5/4.5/4.5/5/4.5  dull brown , sparse head aroma is a nice mix of malt and fresh hops .  mouthfeel : remarkably smooth . full body , velvety texture , low carbonation .

smell & gt ; hoppy and sweet .  served in a large pewter mug ( i felt like paul revere ) so i have no idea what it looked like . big hops , great initially , though they became too much after a while .  black cherries take on a sweet and sour lemon , with balsamic edge , which is both mouth-puckering and refreshing . carbonation comes out as creamy in the forefront , with a medium blast in the throat , all at the same moment . then returns to being creamy and rolls down the throat . pleasing .

smell : very good . as always i could be completely wrong but i smell banana , orange and maybe some lemon .  above average lacing & okay head retention s : lemony notes , slight breadyness t : grapefruit , breadyness , lemons up front .  m/d : perfectly carbonated , smooth , and incredibly easy to drink . champagne-esque mouthfeel and drinkability .

unfortunately , the beautiful aroma is the best thing about this beer .  the beer pours an orange-ish brown color with a small but well retained head . the aroma has that great dirty laundry character right up front with some lingering horseblanket and loads of cherry aroma .  m : another incredible aspect .

s : pungent , spicy , and herbal hops fill nostrils . smell is strong and inviting for the hophead . t : hop flavor is prevalent and reminiscent of citrus ( grapefuit ) .  average appearance.i expected more from the appearance from this beer.poured a small head that reduced to almost nothing.the color is a dark amber to red.aroma is excellent with a well-balanced blend of hops and malt.first sip delivers an immediate warming feeling to the stomach due to the abv.alcohol is noticed but not overpowering.a very creamy malt thickness with a real bitter finish.full bodied with a ton of malt.this is long trail 's best brew.well balanced malt , hops , bitterness , and alcohol all in high amounts.i would certainly buy this again , but drinking alot of these would be out of the question.sweet malt taste with trace amounts of lacing.hail the double bag !  milky smoothness about it , this beer is delicious ... fill my pint again and again . super thick mouthfeel sticks .

it has a fuity nose to me that matches its crisp medium bodied crisp taste which is real dank reseny .  poured a reddish brown with a very minimal light tan head .  what i like most : the wonderful mouthfeel .

t - very nice . smooth . very nice balance m - high carbonation . d - excellent . glad i got a 6 pack of it !  decent ring of retention , though . a few skinny , tall trails of lace ( one looks like a deformed , fallout giraffe ) .  body : pitch black ; practically no head , even with a straight hard pour from about a foot above ; sludgy thick - this stuff literally coats the side of your glass with a molasses-like look ; full bodied . - i was surprised , however , to find out that this is aged in oak , not bourbon , barrels -- i 've never tasted so much bourbon on a beer that did n't see some time in used bourbon barrels ; decent chocolate bitterness ; some cement-like minerality .

huge vanilla & caramel nose . some coffee too . the first sip is very sweet & intense .  initial release on tap at brewery and served in a chalice : a - just transferred so it is still very cloudy and is topped by a small ring of foam .  thick and creamy in the mouth , but rugged and challenging .

dark , deep amber reflections coming off of it with little head and lace and the smell was very complex . i want to say a hint of hamburger , like when i worked at mcdonalds , we cooked those patties , and there was no other scent like that . taste was a bit of let down , thinking this would be bigger , but is still damn good .  appearance was good , light golden with a cloudy haze and with a small white head .  almsot has a thick taste of xmas . almost . great warming alcoholic palate with the just right sweetness mnake this a great after dinner drink or nightcap ; ) .

wow . this was one complex smelling brew . the taste was not nearly as smooth or as interesting as the aroma , but still notable .  a - cloudy light orange/amber color with a small head . strange to see a beer so dark coming from a can . i love it . just an average looking apa once it 's in the glass though .  m - full bodied , rich and smooth . silky body works well with the smoke and spice .

classy and worth the $ $ .  a- copper in color , no head produced but a white ring of foams constantly crowns the brew s- toasted malts , citrus , and toffee t- brown sugar , toffee , caramel , and toasted malts make up the overall sweetness , while citrus from the hops and subtle alcohol level it off .  an ideal body for the style imo .

this beer has a wonderful hoppy aroma that was very welcome here in europe where the ipa breed is thin .  a : pours a translucent pale yellow , with hints of orange . the foamy white head is fairly large and reasonably thick , with so-so retention and a bit of weblike lacing .  m : soft , delicate , moderately carbonated medium body . so , so supple .

excellent nose of char , anise , chocolate , resinous hops , highly kilned malt , vanilla and slight oak . great roasted malt character on the palate along with black licorice , bitter pacnw hops and dark , bitter chocolate . but this is pretty damn good nonetheless .  jack black with almost no `` pop '' nose is dominated by light coffee notes & vague maltish sweetness .  mouthfeel : excellent for this style .

smell : super strong ; deep dark roastiness and even burnt espresso/coffee beans ; nice hints of a syrupy bitter-sweet chocolate as well . my mouth is watering just smelling this brew . taste : much like the smell , tons of a roasty malty espresso ; a bitter chocolate combines with it ; a very slight hoppy/earthy presence adds to the bitterness as well ; very solid overall , a fine bitter stout ; slight presence of alcohol as it continues to warm . mouthfeel : pretty smooth and creamy -- some stouts seem to have a grittiness to them but this one feels pretty clean , actually ; mouth is left with a bit of a coating on the roof and the belly is left pretty warm .  a-yellow straw color , nothing special . two finger white head and slight lacing .  m : full acid , this one packs a punch . like the lactic version of la folie , i loved it .

the nose is where it really impresses . an awesome pine and citrus hop cloud with underlying malt pinning .  appearance : gold-ish yellow , light in color . small head that faded quickly . very easy drinking .  t : tastes strongly of malt , mild citrus , strong creamy oak/woody flavor m : so smooth with a perfectly carbonated body .

nice floral and apricot odor , followed by a very hoppy taste with a citrus finish . the smell almost overpowers the flavor , but the floral hops dominate the taste , almost too much yet this beer still has a very good flavor and balance .  dark and muddy , like a pint of flat coke .  it is amazingly comfortable to drink and has the perfect balance of carbonation .

s : great smell for a gueuze . cider apples , wet wool , funk in droves , definite farmhouse quality , i love the mustiness .  grain belt premium has a lot of history in the twin cities , too bad it is not made here anymore . schell 's took over but they still do a good job . the old premium had one of the most distinctive tastes ever , very very sweet . it was great out of a bottle but when out of a can it tasted like the can . i 've only had the new premium out of a bottle and it is much more watered down .  mouthfeel is full bodied with low carbonation , super super smooth . this beer has one of the most fantastic bodies i 've ever had .

good head retention , and lacing on this one ... s - dark chocolate assaults the nose with a full on attack . this one smells of dessert .  pours very dark brown with a small thin head .  it has medium thickness , with a full body that invigorates your mouth and leaves it very dry .

smell- i absolutely love the smell of this ... grapefruit rind , pine , and floral characteristics with a sweet malty undertone taste- as expected nice and bitter with the pine and grapefruit rind really dominating the profile with a good balance with the sweeter malts and a great dry finish . good taste but i definitely prefer the smell . mouthfeel- crisp dry and refreshing with a medium body and a slick mouthfeel due to the hop resins drinkability- i drank the whole bomber without any problem .  pours a light brown with a little lace that fades to nothing .  m - extraordinarily smooth , medium-full body .

powerful and fresh scents of fudge brownies , roasted walnuts , malted milk balls and dark fruits . the flavors come-off very subtle compared to the previous onslaught of glorious scents ( above ) . overall an outstanding porter . very elegant and stylistic , but still an ale for the common man/woman .  i had this beer poured from a can into a pint glass ... a : the beer pours a darker golden , very clear , large white head an no lacing ... s : alcohol , some adjunct grain ... t : bleh !  mouthfeel : smooth , creamy , buttery , spicy , this beer has an incredible mouthfeel .

strong malt sweetness bursts from the glass . big , bold and complex . taste : densely malted and plenty of flavor .  below a bone head that diminishes to a filmy white foam .  m/d- full bodied and chewy , smooth , easy drinking for 8+ % abv .

this is billed as a spearmint infused ipa and that is exactly what you get ! like fresh mulled , whole leaf , spearmint iced tea . you better like spearmint or this one is not for you . d-well , my first mint bomb for sure !  small , fine offwhite head with low retention .  thick mouth feel , chewy with almost zero carbonation .

the scent is heavenly , with mild roast coffee with a strong nuttiness and caramel accent .  i tried this beer in lake tao , nevada i bought in a grocery store cold.i like the good carbonation , the nose had a nice herbal quality , the mouth feel was heavy almost creamy . copared to newcastle this beer was way more three dimensional.the more the glass became empty the more the pleasant bitternes came thru to balance the sweetnest .  this is definitely an intense beer , but it is well balanced for its stature mf : thick , creamy , chewy , velvety , low carb , perfect d : too boozy to have more than one but the flavor is exquisite and this sets the curve for bba stouts imo .

very attractive bomber . i can not believe how amazing this beer smells . it 's like straight chocolate bar . with southern tier 's , it 's absolutely about that chocolate . it 's like a hershey 's bar melted down .  pours a dark brown/black with a thin single finger of a head .  m : excellent . very light and thirst quenching !

just a barrage of hop scents from across the spectrum . wonderful . certainly not a hop overdose , the malt backbone is so evenly balanced that it serves to accentuate the hop taste ( somewhere between grapefruit and pine resin ) .  this is a very dark , almost completely black beer . it pours with a shallow , thin head that quickly dissapears .  velvety smooth texture has a good tingle to it .

this is a delightful belgian strong ale and not one i have heard too much about before i tried it . the aroma was just fantastic . there was an extremely strong berry aroma , with a mixture of both sweet ( such as rasberry and strawberry ) and dark , strong ( such as blackberry ) .  dark copper color with a thin off-white/ cream colored head . the head dipped out quickly , but even several minutes after the pour there is an interesting little geyser of carbonation bubbling up in the middle of my goblet that actually disturbs the surface as in a swift flowing river .  wonderfully thick and viscous in mouthfeel , slick with a subtly prickly carbonation teasing the tongue .

has a intense but pleasant hop aroma . as with the smell , the taste is extremely hoppy with a tad of maltiness .  pours a deep brown . two inches of lumpy head forms and quickly dissipates .  mouthfeel is wonderfully smooth and viscous with some carbonation keeping it from appearing syrupy .

appearance : golden color with good head retention smell : nice strong piney aromas taste : lopsided to the hops side .  a - pours a deep gold bordering on copper . got about a one half inch head that disappeared immediately . lacing was only slightly better than average .  exceptionally smooth and silky with a terrific feeling on the tounge .

aroma is pungent , with grapefruit , pine , peaches and marihuana . very drinkable . a highly entertaining beer to drink .  pours a medium amber color , with a thin , 1/2 finger head that dissolves immediately . no ring , and no lacing .  m : the mouthful is excellent . the beer is so smooth and rich .

s- you have everything in the nose , dark chocolate , alcohol , dark fruits , spices.. t/m-nice taste with all that ingredients like in the smell , plus some coffee and hops .  poured a strongly reddish-orange color that was fairly transparent . not much head on pour settles into no head and no lace .  piney and bitter up front . smooth as silk .

smell : oh , sweet mother of god -- this is what the panties of angels must smell like . damn . taste/mouthfeel : strong hop presence right off the bat . the taste is very bold , but oddly , no particular flavor really stands out . it 's not novel or extreme , but it 's really , really good . drinkability : well , i mean , come on , it 's almost 10 % and so thick it gets into your pores ; you can only drink so much of this stuff .  pours a light copper with slight haze . i was expecting this one to be much darker , so it 's a surprise right off the bat . a small off-white head forms and fizzles out quickly leaving a film on the surface . carbonation appears minimal .  highly carbonated medium bodied . perfect for a cali-belgian ipa . very drinkable ipa .

poured into a new belgium snifter a - a beautiful clear dusk sunset color , 2 finger head that lingered and lacing through and through and awesome tiny bubbles for days s - pine , citrus , malt , floral , cotton , sweet , grains and maybe a bit toasty t - very nice bitter sweet , pine , orange , melon , pineapple , very hoppy and yet super bitter sweet malty m - coats the mouth a bit with some super bitter sweet lingering . nice and lightly carbonated d - really nice and easy to drink . just a nice under $ 5 ipa final thought - lagunitas and ibu 's make so much sense  33cl bottle poured into grimbergen chalice best before date 04 december 2010 a- dark mahogany body with a lot of sediment . 2 finger creamy head with average retention and minimal lacing .  mouthfeel is thick , chewy and oily .

again the smell is just amazing ! very hoppy and floral . its not as hoppy as i remember but its smell is great ! mmmm . 2007 batch alright , first off this brew is amazing . its like putting your face into a vat of hops and smelling . it 's a beautiful blend of smell and taste .  very good , very easy to drink ; great on a hot day ... but ordinary . it poured too light in color -- pale straw , with a nice two-finger head and moderate amounts of lace .  the best part of the beer is it 's amazing , thick chewy mouthfeel .

the smell greats you as soon as you open the bottle . it is more akin to smoked salmon or meats than sitting next to a bonfire . if you keep your face planted in the beer the whole time you 'll loose the scent , but step away for a minute or two and it greets you all over again . be it indian , buffalo wings , thai or bbq , the combo of spice and smoke is only natural . i would caution you to not eat something too spicy , you 'll lose the flavor of the beer .  dark reddish brown , fairly clear ( yet still rather dark ) . very faint head , no retention whatsoever .  mouthfeel is unbelievable on this !

s : very , very nice . the first thing i notice is quite a bit of oak alongside some vanilla and bits of char .  billed as `` australian pale ale '' at map room 's 19th anniversary . super murky orange , opaque and looking like carrot juice from a blender .  mouthfeel & drinkability - mouthfeel is great due to the roundness complimented by the mouth pucking acidity .

s-really aromatic citrus hops ( orange , and tangerine ) with the slightest hint of caramel malt .  appearance : dark dark brown , held up to the light dark amber . white head dissipates completely and leaves zero lacing .  the mouthfeel is full bodied with a frothy , creamy carbonation and incredibly smooth .

the smell is intoxicating . chocolate , pecans , sugar , brandy , alcohol , caramel , toffee , vanilla , oh my oh my . i hate seeing beers that have such potential being destroyed by bad bottle conditioning .  pours dark brown . looks fairly thin off the pour but very nice head .  the mouthfeel is thick as a sumo wrestler 's thigh , and covers the tongue thoroughly .

appearance : very dark chocolate in color , looks almost like root beer with a minimal creamy tan head aroma : it smells amazing , like desert but in beer form . delicious . taste : malty and choclately , but not heavily or overpoweringly chocolately at all ... . just like a hint of chocolate mixed with the delicious malts and surprisingly - but refreshingly - bitter ( in my opinion ) hit of hops .  a : dark as a stout duh with a thin quickly diminishing and some thin lacing .  the mouthfeel is exceptional and velvety smooth .

just an awesome mixture that make for one heck of an air freshener .  the beer pours clear amber with a modest bright white creamy head and after its decomposition the lace forms a thin veil upon the glass .  a thick , chewy body rounds out the mouthfeel , and the full malt profile hides the alcohol while accentuating the flavors making this beer strong , but very drinkable .

330ml bottle bought from sainsburys ... poured a dark golden / rusty orange colour ... slightly off white head pours quite big and foamy and fades to a nice layer.. aroma - oaky , woody , quite sweet , definite whiskey notes , raisins , over ripe bananas ... taste quite sweet , nutty , strong alcohol notes , spicy , vanilla , raisins , nice biscuit maltiness , buttery ... feel - quite smooth . medium body ... . pretty drinkable ... overall - an excellent beer ... highly recommended ...  i bought this bottle at the drinkstore in dublin , poured from a bottle into a pint glass ... a : a nice golden color , maybe a little darker than expected , and a spotty head , pretty bad lacing though ... s : this smells pretty good .  full bodied , very creamy/chewy mouth feel .

aroma is intense with lots of fresh , fruity green oily citric and resinous hops all backed by a huge malt bill with touches of golden raisins , dates , and rotting peaches . mike was drinking a red rye and this looked and tasted exactly like it but with a much bigger malt bill and a distinct syrupy alcohol burn towards the end . this is a rich brew ... almost too rich . i took home a growler of the red rye instead of this as the alcohol was a bit much and the red rye was more drinkable .  a : pours very little head with a single ring of big bubbles that hugs the edge of the glass .  mouthfeel is exceptional , the carbonation just completely envelopes my mouth and throat .

s : stinging bourbon attacks the nose , followed by an onslaught of sweet malts .  a - pale golden in color with just a little haze in it . slightly foamy white head but does n't last too terribly long . s/t - pretty much confirms why i love citra hops . very easy to drink .  the mouthfeel is full creamy and smooth , a pleasure to drink .

no lacing ... the aroma is fantastic , instantly reminds me of a cross between duchesse & rodenbach grand cru , wonder if this is labeled wrongly , i think this is a flanders red . this is still great , just not as good as the nose ... the feel is a little light , not much of a finish ... crushable at 8 % .  pours deep cooper with thin tan head .  the mouthfeel is perfect with a medium body and a rich , smooth texture .

s : this stuff smells so good ! lots going on ; spice , lemon zest , ginger , grass , and a bit of a sour dried tangerine quality .  appearance- pours a clear , medium gold with a barely centimeter-thick white head .  incredibly smooth body , very soft carbonation , full bodied .

s- a sweet flowery adventure . i note some orange/lemon citrus .  bottle , into a petrus glass , a : pours a pale goldenrod , mild white head , fair retention , no lace .  incredibly smooth , perfectly carbonated , and just the right slick residue left behind . exceptional .

just an all around excellent smelling beer . t - just straight forward sweet cherries with a touch of sourness underneath .  it pours a great yellow color .  insanely big body and texture , with a creamy and sticky texture .

it smells simply incredible . 3.5 t : pleasant herbal hop flavor and a good amount of bitterness , but the taste is lacking something .  pours inky black with a minimal head , common ( but not necessarily typical ) for the style .  it 's quite smooth and creamy in the mouth with a full body and a very fine-bubbled , natural carbonation from bottle-conditioning .

the aroma is flat-out amazing . piney hops collide with tons of sweet fruity notes : pear , pineapple , mango , grapefruit , and banana . a nice malty balance is present , too .  i have never been a fan of the light yellow beers , i 'm a fan of darker beers , pale yellow always reminds me of coors light and the like .  m- thick full body with some carbonation .

smell : in all honesty , this is one of the best smelling beers i 've ever had.. 5 points in this category . cinnamon , allspice , and pumpkin proudly announce the arrival of the fall season .  this beer pours a copper ton with not much of a head .  m - dry . great . you can play with this beer in your mouth , it 's amazing : take it on the tongue tip for a little and then throw down ... eh ?

the nose on this one was outstanding . figs , chocolates , banana , apples , smoke .  served on tap at redbones in beantown ... do n't expect hoegaarden . the only real points i took were for appearance ( not really the typical wit cloudiness ) .  mouthfeel is excellent , very crisp and medium carbonation perfectly matched to the malt 's feel .

after the great smell i found the flavor to be a bit on the harsh side with a huge juniper hop bitterness almost imediatly overpowering all the other nuances making it very one dimensional .  appearance is dark red with very little head .  the mouthfeel on this beer though is truly exceptional , it is extremely pillow and fluffy like in the mouth it feels great .

incredible . minimal malt background . really great pale ale but is n't nearly as fruity as the aroma . perfect for the style . o - wish i had more of this beer .  pours dark murky brown with a red tint .  simply outstanding . nice , full bodied beer that is n't too slick or syrupy , supported by a smooth and velvety carbonation that complements the body . drinks very well indeed .

still very good , though . excellent beer all around . definitely glad that i got a chance to try this one .  this beer came out with a thin head and clear gold body but what really grabbed my interest was the smell ; very floral and alluring .  feel : low carbonation , rich full body , ridiculously smooth and creamy , somewhat dry finish . drinkability : fantastic english-style stout .

very nice . flavour was , as you might expect , a bit woody , with a nice velvety sweet maltiness and a nice licorice hint .  a- totally opaque orange pour . highly carbonated . has the feel of there being pulp in the beer .  absolutely perfect . d : thanks to jdv for this one .

the aroma on this is fantastic . roasted malts , dark fruits , and a touch of chocolate dance around my nose . it seriously smells so good . taste-wise , the dark fruits ( cherries and figs ) hit the tongue first , and they sure are great !  a : a dark amber , about the color of grade `` a '' maple syrup . a creamy white quarter inch head forms but quickly degrades into a spattering of larger bubbles that tend to stick to the side of the glass .  mouthfeel was thick and creamy like it should be .
