s : awesome . broan sugar , vanilla , belgian yeast , ( very slight ) alcohol spice , esters . t : opens up tasting a little bit like a tripel , but with the addition of vanilla and brown sugar . this beer was fairly weak from the mid-late palate through the finish , although it did have an awesom bourbon aftertaste . d : yes , as a tripel should be .  on cask at the bruery , a blend of cuvee jeune and a pinot noir beer , a : pours a magenta red mix with a very light head , no lacing , nice colour though .  mouthfeel is amazing . super smooth . the mouthfeel is really the highlight of this one .

a really nice spruce/pine aroma also which is very pleasant .  it 's an nice golden color with a tiny head that quickly drops to wisps .  the feel is fantastic and is the first time in awhile that i 've been totally taken aback by a beer 's hop level .

very full , huge smell . t - the alcohol pushes through the robust malty sweetness with some force .  dark honey colored , light beige head that dissipates quickly into a film and leaves a few bubbles along the way .  m - full-bodied , smooth , thick , creamy , yummy d - so well-balanced and so tasty without ever being too much on the taste buds even though there is a lot going on .

the hop aroma in this beer is just amazing . floral , citrusy and fruity sweet and strong . it 's not overly bitter , so it 's very drinkable .  the pour was a very murky copper red/brown with a very short head that quickly dissapated to a fine white lace on top of the beer .  not overly bitter for the style , very impressed m - smoother than any brew i 've had in quite some time ... perfect subtle carbonation .

that smell hits ya . right away , im reminded of my summer quests involving over smoked venison meat . oddly appealing to me .  the beer has a rich , ruby-clear color . no head or lace in this sample .  mouthfeel : very smooth and pleasant , not aggressive or passive .

pure luxury ! t : a somewhat sweet taste with hints of cocoa and coffee .  it poured a clear copper hue with medium-lite carbination and a two finger frothy head .  m : a great after-taste , long and in almost perfect balance between sweet and bitter . the body is full and the carbonation is moderate with only really small bubbles .

has an extremely unique aroma kind of earthy and fruity almost like real homemade apple cider you know the dark brown stuff .  i 'm really excited to try it ! ! a - dark bloody crimson with light oranges on the edges . no head - just a few bubbles that line the glass .  smooth , creamy mouthfeel , and the first taste that hits you is that of a dark coffee .

the nose seems to have layers and layers of every desirable aroma . i loved the aromas of this brew .  pours a nice dark redish amber color but unfortunately has a lot of yeast floaties .  mouthfeel is superb , soft bubbles over the tongue , and drinkability is good as well .

crisp , clean , and pungent . lots more caramel malt and dim sweetness . clean , mild , and very well balanced . mellow and crisp with moderate carbonation and a clean finish .  a cross between copper and yellow , this beer offers a small fading head .  mouthfeel was damn near perfect , being right in the middle .

the nose is an absolutely intoxicating blend of caramel , cotton candy sweetness and citrusy , resinous hops . caramel leads off on my palate , before being joined by that same candy sweet flavor from the yeast , except now a medicinal phenol taste fades in as well .  a- pale golden color with thin , soapy head that has weak retention and almost no lacing .  the mouthfeel on this beer is amazingly silky .

beautiful floral candied orange rind and subtle pine resin aromas rise from the glass . floral , but bitey , hops attack the tongue before being met with a firm malt body . the mouth is coated with pleasing hop oils .  a- very cloudy light golden color , a finger of head that settles to a single layer too quickly , and no lacing .  smooth and full bodied , creamy as anything i 've ever had .

golden amber color and a good head forms and stays the aroma is perfect sweet citrus aroma and hint of alcohol to let you know to slow down but never to much the taste starts malt with an earthy bitter .  pours a cloudy burnt oranish brown color ; big hop nose on this beer , lots of cascade hops .  m : full bodied . love it .

this might be out of order , but wow , great aroma . maybe not to style , but a wonderful vanilla oak aroma . it 's not best of style to me , but it 's still good .  a - pitch black color with almost no head . very little creamy tan head , that disappears almost instantly with almost no lacing .  lol mouthfeel is soft and oh-so smooth , and drinkability is superb . plan on bringing in the 1/4 keg for a fill asap .

aroma : sweet and dark chocolate , very inviting . taste : not quite as good as the smell . chocolate and coffee flavors dominate throughout .  rusty golden nectar pours into clean glassware , a quickly expanding snow colored head forms nicely at the top , pleasant variation in bubble size , head fades in a hurry leaving a very thin layer of white on top , lacing is poor to mediocre , i 've stumbled into the cellar of some british cider brewer from the turn of the century , the lovely nostalgia inducing scent of apples consumes my nostrils .  brown with hints of read s- ambiguous fruits turning to alcohol as it warms up t- dried fruits ( raisins , apricot ) , some warming alcohol , pleasing amount of bitterness m- so smooth , carbonation is just right , very nice d- a pleasant warming sensation . mouthfeel and flavor keeps you coming back .

appearance : light amber to golden , good clarity , low head development ( a thin creamy cap on top of a bed of larger bubbles ) , some lacing on glass aroma : lush woodsy citrusy hop nose , very enticing , a touch of biscuity caramel underneath , strawberry fruitiness , honey and a touch of diacetyl flavor : a mellow hoppiness similar to that in the aroma , followed by a subdued maltiness , also an herbal quality to it , a very `` soothing '' flavor mouthfeel : light body , fine carbonation , slightly minerally texture overall impression : a great limited release , something to look forward to as much as alaskan summer ale .  a- a gentle pour from the growler yielded a thin white head , which quickly dissipated . the body was a medium amber color with no visible carbonation .  big abv but not hot , well carbonated , the amazing mouthfeel , fantastic complexity and drinkability .

smell : toasty malts with a powerful aroma of chocolate . smells delicious . taste : a blend of toasted and roasted malts and some alcohol phenols arise quickly , but ca n't stand up to the malts and fade out just as quick .  a : hazy copper body topped with a loose two-finger head that quickly dissipates without a trace of lacing and only a thin creamy cover .  mouthfeel - it 's too bad about the flavor , because the mouthfeel here is superb imo .

a very fresh and exceptional smell . tangy and tart taste !  pours with a magnifico head , lacing is supreme ... smell of sweet maple syrup malt ... damn smooth . . .  the mouthfeel was full and creamy , even kind of silky on the swallow . these factors , coupled with its low abv make it a session candidate , especially when you include its fairly common availability .

an excellant beer with strong chocolate aroma that hits you even before you drink it . the color of the beer is a very dense blackness that seems like a black hole where no light will penetrate .  pretty darn good tasting beer . the look was just ok , i saw some yeast floating around in it which i do n't like . the abv is just too high to drink more than 4 .  as it comes up to room temp it really starts to get interesting , the hops appear a bit more at the front , the bitterness is nice , deep rich chocolate is rich and full . m- very mild carbonation , delivers nicely , smooth , good creaminess .
amazing fresh tropical aroma . as good as any .  this beer also has no lacing . even without head this beer still looks alright .  incredibly easy to drink . m- outstanding . perfect carbonation .

aroma is delicious , a mix of light , creamy coffee , chocolate malts and bananas coated in fudge . expertly crafted like most ng 's .  served into tulip glass from a brown 1qt . very hazy golden color , mirky looking.the head was a bit flat do n't know why ?  the mouthfeel is simply fantastic . chewy and thick , with carbonation that feels perfectly natural .

probably the best ipa i 've ever smelled . intense floral hops , citrus and pine needles . well balanced . hops are prevelant but not bitter . probably my new favorite ipa .  date : 30 april 2011 glass : standard snifter type : 750ml corked and caged , vintage 2010 beer flight , taken from notes : appearance : dark , thin film , no lacing smell : heavy oak , some chocolate , touch of heat , very little bourbon , touch of dark malts taste : begins with chocolate , into oak , then dark malt , and finally some bourbon mouthfeel : bitter chocolate is brief , slightly hot , great sipper with friends overall : great age-able brew , would be great with some dust on the bottle , share this with friends !  perfect amount of alc , spice and carbonation , and an easy to drink body .

s- awesome . tons of overall citrus notes , specifically mango and grapefruit . also getting some pine aroma . t- a nicely hop forward beer . good stuff , glad i came across some in my area after thinking it was long gone .  a - little hints of dark mahogany shows through the bottom of a totally black glass . a tall yet quiet pour gives off no more than a thin film of bubbles . no retention or lace .  extremely creamy mouthfeel that is silky as can be on the tongue and going down , despite the big hop presence which does give it a slight bittering dryness in the finish , also keeping the brew from being too full .

the aroma is full of citrus and piney hops .  hard to get head ( huh ? ) on this one ( may have been somewhat old ) . but the dry , almost powdery chocolate/coffee quaff with some bourbon undertones made up for it . excellent medium body with a carb tingle smooth and savory all the way down the glass . could have drunk many more than 1 pint of these babies .  mouth feel is perfect , not cloying like other stouts of this variety . lingering taste of coffee . highly recommended .

it smells delicious . after one whiff , i had high expectations for my palate .  bottle into a pint glass a - tan head made it to a half finger and dissipated quickly to a thin covering , deep brown almost black 3.0 s - toasted & sweet malts and coffee with a slight smokiness 4 t - roasted malts dominate with coffee notes , nicely balanced bitterness with dark chocolate notes on finish 4 m - full bodied but a light feeling beer , smooth , mild carbonation 4 d - good flavor and drinkability , want and will have another 4 a solid beer all the way around which i will be drinking again .  the mouthfeel was incredible , very chewy and delicious .

s : a wonderful smelling beer . ton 's of dark fruit : plumbs , raisins and sweet roasted malt . this is one delicious smelling beer . very good dinkability .  appearance is a dirty gold color and clear .  super awesome feel .

smell is curiously delightful . cocoa , wheat , minor zip of bitter clove , a rounded melon scent in the background , with some perfume-y coffee creamer & alcohol on the outskirts .  i poured it into a cup to try and get a good look at it about halfway through drinking it . i can ' ttell you much about the head , but the body was a nice golden color .  wonderfully velvetty mouthfeel .

i am getting an education in ipa 's and i love it ! aroma : mmm ... does this beer smell good ! pineapple is the first thing to hit your nose , along with a lot of citrusy , fruity hops . in a good way . taste/mouthfeel : lemon and coriander with just a tiny bit of bitterness in the back .  poured on tap a pale golden color with 1 inch head that held an aroma of sweet grass and pale hops .  mouthfeel ; very smoothe and velvety .

smell : glorious ! chocolate , chocolate , chocolate ! malty , too , but not as out in front as the chocolate .  sadly , i was n't able to pour this out , which is why i 'm just going with an average appearance rating . there was a bit of leakage around the top though , and it looked to be a nice mocha head just waiting to get out .  m : very smooth -- the beer goes down so easy , yet it 's very full flavored .

strikingly good scent . the taste is weaker than that .  nice big head but it tapers down to virtually nothing .  the body was quite full , and the feel was excellent , mouth-coating and smooth . a bit of a cottony/fluffy character and crisp carbonation kept a full body feeling light and almost weightless .

tons of yeast in the nose ; some sweet candy ; a bit of wheat ; alcohol ; cardamom .  2009 22oz into tulip . a- dark dark dark brown beer , almost black , with a thin cookie-batter color head . the rich roasty malts come through after the initial bourbon blast fades .  m - smooth and crisp .

smell is very strong chocolate . taste of chocolate is a kick in the face on the first drink .  pours an opaque black , with one finger of tan head that quickly fades to a haze .  feeling very blah about that palate . not a bad texture actually ; quite full , lively without feeling overcarbonated .

s - roasty caramel malt .  this is a very tasty beer , but its appearance is nothing special in my opinion . it has a very nice white head , but is very light and its not once you get to the 90 and 120 minute ipa 's where you see the darker color .  m - thick . oh god , is it thick ! carbonation is surprisingly high . it is a little bit refreshing , but it also leaves a residue in your mouth .

good crisp smell , with plenty of hops , but a hint of elmer 's glue . organics often have quirky characteristics though , and this one is n't off-putting .  below average lacing & average head retention s : boozey bourbon , rum & raisins & booze once warm t : boozey chocolate , raisins , & dryness up front .  there are alot of polish lagers showing up around here in the buffalo area an its kinda cool to see.this beer poured from the can ( a trashy looking can at that ) a deep clear bronze/russet with a large tight one finger head that settled into a creamy top.pretty clean lager aromas slightly toasted with light caramel and honey notes , wow pretty sweet on the palate almost sugary in the finish overtop mild toastiness with a faint drying earthy note underneath the big sweet finish.pretty creamy mouthfeel but the sugary sweetness is a bit much for me to drink maybe even a whole can .

yeah , the more i think about it , the aroma really reminds me of that .  a- poured a slightly hazy golden with 2 finger head on an easy pour . minus the great head , this beer does n't look that great .  it has a nice medium thick body , which was pleasant and unexpected given the semi-blandness .

it smells quite good , and surprisingly hoppy for a 6.8 % . i really dislike the mouthfeel .  appearance : i thought it was a little dark for a marzen . it was brown with a nice off white head and lace .  the mouthfeel is pleasant , and probably this beer 's best attribute .

s : chocolate , orange , rind & bread with a hint of mint . t : chocolate liqueur , orange-rind , caramel & pale malt . d : easily approachable , but not overly enticing & the chocolate does n't seem very authentic .  pale straw color topped by a two finger eggshell white head . it 's pretty much completely transparent making me believe that maybe they overfiltered it .  mouthfeel is light-medium , sticky with low carbonation .

a pleasant citrus aroma , some fresh hay . lemon taste , a bit of malt , then the beer just flattened out .  bath ales is a micro brewery which at least i have never heard of . but i know one thing know , they make a lovely porter ! smells nicely of coffee , chocolate ( not dark ) , some rum and some vanilla .  mouthfeel - medium body ( for the style ) . nice level of carbonation . it really gets to dancing over the toungue .

the smell was very fruity as well . i found that the fruit smell was a lot stronger than the fruit taste .  a : pours a hazy straw yellow into an american shaker pint with a little white head that dissipates rather quickly and leaves some lacing .  m : a vibrant carbonation on a sweet body .

nose expresses dark malts , molasses , burnt sugar , ethanol , brewer 's licorice and anise - very much style consistent .  a- pours a soapy 1.5 finger white head . as the head recedes , it leaves small amounts of sparse lacing . d- i had pretty low expectations for this brew but i was pleasantly surprised .  mouthfeel - slight crispness . sweet body with a strange finish . sweetness on the lips , and a dry astringency on the tongue .
smell - 4.0 sweet , malty aroma of chocolate , caramel , a little plum and citric hops .  looks pretty average .  mouthfeel is solid . a little resiny .

s : strong citrus ( mostly lemon ) , some yeast and faint nugget hops . t : strong wheat malts and citrus upfront decay into a thin , barley malt-like body with a somewhat sour biscuit flavor and lagery yeasts . d : nothing really makes this hefe stand out above the rest ; appearance and smell were much more enticing than the taste , which resembled more a run-of-the-mill lager than a characteristic bavarian ale .  yummy . clear golden body with a white head that too quickly disappears .  the medicinal character vanishes at higher temperatures and all that remains is a faint coffee bitterness m - carbonation is a bit high , thick , and pretty refreshing .

smell is neat , quite pumpkiny , caramel , cloves , cinnamon , bit of vanilla , sour fruit , bready , some toast , more spice , yeast , not bad . taste is not so good , very bitter and spicy .  appearance- a brown bottle . the silver bullet baby . smell- very musty , but is n't a turn off to this beer .  sweet tasting , but has a great solid malty mouthfeel . nice beer , but a little too sweet for me .

aroma was very nice : reminded me of walking by our local regional brewery - of cooking malt and a little hops . fresh . flavor 's the same plus some extra sweetness , heavy grain flavor with a little bread dough .  appearance : hazy pale amber , darker than a lot of tripels i have had and the lace is just ok as it leave only a ring .  m : fine .

aroma is the best aspect though , with a vinous quality ... also dark raisins , brown sugar , some doughy yeast coming through . underwhelming flavor , but certainly not awful . soft banana comes through , but it 's subtle .  pours out slightly hazy amber/ bronze color with a fizzy off white head that disappeared almost instantly leaving no lace or retention .  unbalanced . mouthfeel is thick and syrupy , matches the taste well , appropriate carbonation .

as far as fruit beers go , this is better than some , because you can still taste the beer . the raspberry is mild and less artificial tasting than many i have tried .  bottle # 147 of 228 a- pours a ridiculously cloudy apricot color with 1 finger white head that was reduced to slight patches not leaving much lacing .  the beer is fairly thick with a good carbonation .

smell : raw pumpkin pulp , cinnamon , very spicy smelling taste : raw pumpkin , very bold , some sweetness in there , spicy , and some alcohol towards the end . notes : a good brew but not something i would choose over another pumpkin ale .  rather flat in appearance .  the mouthfeel is on the lighter side of medium bodied with lively carbonation . it is nice to see leinie 's not going overboard with the carbonation like they usually do .

not overly complex or powerful , but good . flavours on the palate are light and unimpressive .  a : black with a tan head , very little retention ( especially considering it 's a stout ) , but it initially leaves a light lacing .  nice and creamy on the palate . very soft and pleasing brew : notes of dough , bread , oatmeal cookies and just a hint of toffee sweetness .

s - very aromatic . had a very big earthy smell of grains/hops .  first of all , just wanted to say thanks to gabe for putting together this phenomenal lineup of ballast point beers at his restaurant ( beachwood bbq ) . a : just like any good old stout ... black , with some translucent properties when held up to light . not sure whether it was the glass or not , but the head was on the weaker side as was the lacing .  mouthfeel is good as the carbonation isnt to strong .

12 oz . aromas consist of citrus , pine , brown sugar , tropical fruit , and malt . the tasting experience is not as exciting as the aroma would lead you to believe .  a fairly thin looking golden brew with a thin head and a solid white lace .  mouthfeel was very smooth and slippery , with a decent amount of carbonation .

s- big coffee and chocolate notes . sweet and roasty . t- bitter and bitter . the aroma leaves much to be desired , taste does n't follow the nose .  appearance : pours a very cloudy orange color with a small , 1/4 '' white head that shows decent retention . the bubbles pop slowly and the beer looks lifeless otherwise ( not a bad thing ) .  mouthfeel is smooth and surprisingly not grainy .

it smells like fresh cherries with a slight spicy wheat aroma . t- nothing special at all and not nearly as appealing as the smell . it has that `` cheap lager '' taste and i feel it tried to cover it with cherries .  completely average appearance .  taste & mouthfeel : the upfront crispness holds a refreshing quality in the palate .

s smell of hops and almost herbal like t to much spicy hops to my taste .  this one pours out to a hazy caramel amber with little flecks of sediment , trying hard to eek out a modest head with a vigorous pour ... .soapy in nature with poor retention and minimal lacing .  the brew is full bodied and seems more like a milkshake , rather than a beer .

the smell is probably the best part of this beer , with a subtle aroma of strawberries .  appearance-wise , the beer has the usual clean , refined look of high falls ' other beers , with a nice amber-gold color . the beer pours with a decent-sized head which lasts for quite some time .  mouthfeel is not bad light crisp nice carbonation lightly tingles the throat .

smell is really nice : lots of floral hops , fresh cereal grains , nutty/bread aromas , and some alcohol .  a - poured out a clear , golden orange color with almost no head .  m - perfectly fine , like drinking naturally carbonated spring water .

really , really hated the mouthfeel- the level of carbonation made the sweetness sit on my tongue longer than i would 've liked .  a- pours a dark brown . started out with a faint off white-tan head .  m -- mf is fine , carbonated and smooth .

smell : scent of more-spice-than pumpkin , slight note of sweet hops .  dark black with minimal white head , but i forgot to rinse the glass properly so detergent may have interfered .  mouthfeel/overall : light bodied with quite a bit of fine , abundant carbonation . pretty smooth going down .

smell though is quite decent , chocolate malt , banana off pour , but gives way to faint grass and malt . i really think the nose on this is good , but there are so many things that dissapoint me about this beer that i really do not want it ever again even though you could drink it easily .  pours out to a sparkingly clear straw golden , barely eeking out a tiny white head with poor retention and no lacing .  in the mouth it 's full bodied and dextrinous with a gently caress of the tongue due to its fine-bubbled , moderate carbonation .

aroma is cherry . somewhat artifical . after the aroma , i really wanted to like this , but just ca n't .  this beer pours a dark brown with no head or lacing .  light to medium bodied with creamy carbonation , off-dry .

smells smoky .  pours sort of muddy-brown , with scant head that quickly fades . enjoyed this out of one of my thistle glasses ... just kidding - it was from a tulip .  good body for a lager ; high carbonation .

aromas of cinnamon and clove spiciness , orange and lemon citrus , thick with light and medium colored malts . in a blind smell test i would call this distinctly belgian .  a 1 finger head that disappears too quickly ( only lasted about 20 seconds or so . ) carbonation bubbles gently climbing up the glass from the bottom . smells like a fresh baked pumpkin pie at thanksgiving .  m : mouthfeel is crisp and carbonated ; refreshing .

the aroma of the beer was full of sweet and tart cherries and some malty sweetness in the background . no hops or alcohol on the nose .  tannish brown and cloudy . thin sheets of fine lacing .  goes down very easily -- very enjoyable . d : it 's very smooth and goes down easy .

the aroma has a mild sweet citrus aroma with a hint of peppercorns .  the beer is a golden copper in color , with an unimpressive head . well , i guess i can understand that a 9 % abv , but i do like a little head with my beer .  goes beyond anything recognized as beer , anywhere ... no , it 's closer to port , and should be consumed as such . thick on the tongue at first , then mild , still with a sweet , treacly coating that trickles down the throat .

reviewed cold from a bottle to a glass a - hazy yellow color , thin foam , decent lacing ring , llots of carbonation s - malty , citrusy , not a lot of hops here t - has a sweetness ( almost citrus sweetness ) that does not agree with me .  it 's only an average looking ipa . almost looks blonde . it 's a dark straw color , pale-ish like you 'd expect .  the flavor again is pure butter . where 's the saison yeast or spice ? this reminds me of pechish woods . this is a complete miss for me . it was very solid and had plenty of funk and brett .

s - well it certainly smells nice . very much like sweet pastry , chocolate , a little whiff of licorice .  750 ml bottle pours a chill hazed caramel with minimal sand colored head into my bush tulip glass . average head retention & lacing s : rich oaky , boozey , plumy notes t : jammy fruit , raisins , boozeyness & a bit of smokeyness up front .  m - crisp , without feeling over carbonated , with a nice light body that seems to fit what they are going for .

malted wheat smell , a roasted , toasted malted wheat that is . as the beer warmed the bananas and caramel from the smell came into play , as did a vanilla sweetness .  some nice head on the pour ... .  i am not impressed mouthfeel is good . carbonation is just right .

s - lots of spices , ginger , cinnamon , cloves , and numeg . t - mimics the aroma nicely . good spice notes as well as nice solid malts . the pumpkins there , but you really have to search for it on the backend .  i poured this very aggressively , but it yielded almost no head and lacing .  finishes with some booze hotness , a bit juicy , with herbal & metallic hops mf : medium bodied , moderate carbonation & some juicyness drinks easy enough , this is a little too weird for me .

s : smelled like a winter festive smell with cinnamon and nutmeg spices with dried raisin and citrus aromas working in the mix . after airing out for a while it had an alcoholic bread pudding taste which went well with the festive winter smells . m/d : alcoholic feel all the down the throat but kinda bland on the tongue .  22 oz bottle poured into a wine glass appearance : hazy brownish red with a 1 '' head . the head is off white and lasts a short bit , with some lacing on the sides of the glass .  m : nice & light texture for a summer beer .

s - perhaps the best quality of the beer is the aroma : floral and sweet with hints of malty sweetness , wheat , lemony citrus . not too complex and rather thin but not too bad at all . much better beers out there .  pours a murky deep oak , with a finger of tan head that quickly drops to a collar . only a few sticky fingers of laces touch the edge of the glass , and the ho-hum appearance belies the fact that this is an extremely impressive beer . only a slightly mediocre appearance lets things down , but that aside this is a phenomenal brew , and one of the best from an excellent brewery .  a definite crispness initiates the mouthfeel but soft , relatively low-level carbonation provides for a slick finish .
slight roast on the nose with very sweet vanilla . sounded tasty when i ordered it .  bottle : poured a light brown ale with medium head with very little retention .  m : extremely thick and malty .

the aroma is pretty nice but the yeast character in the flavor is out of control and the alcohol is really hot and unpleasant .  appearance - pours a dark copper color with a small head that vanishes quickly .  mouthfeel - fairly light with a good dose of carbonation .
the beer smelled reall good if you like pumpkin pie smell , very spicey .  a- a bright copper with very little head and lace for a dipa .  m : moderate body with medium to hi carbonation .

it had a rich smell and appearance but it was much sweeter than i like .  this beer pours a cloudy orange color with a thin head but it 's retention was great .  taste was much of the same ... kind of porter-ish with chocolate and roasted malt flavors but then the vanilla hits you and that 's all you 're left with . maybe im just not in favor of vanilla in beers but thats how i feel .

actually quite nice , not too pronounced but quite pleasant . unfortunately , it smells better than it tastes .  is a dark brown-red when poured . head was thin and dissipated rather quickly .  body is the high point probably , some malt thickness is evident , but it makes its way around the mouth nicely with good medium carbonation to match .

i 'll just cut to the chase - i normally do n't read other reviews before i personally review a beer , but i did n't know quite how to describe the taste . if there is any one thing the taste reminds me of , it 's the lysol disinfectant that used to come in the brown bottle here in the states .  pours translucent dark red , not much of a head forms and it 's quickly a ring and slight cap , a bit of lace left . maybe a bit too much like a yeti lite but that 's hardly a complaint .  mouthfeel is actually pretty good on this one.finishes on the sweet side .

strong aroma of smoke and little else.as for taste , this is my first try of a smoked beer . the smell reminds me of a campfire that has been doused with water , and the smell of the hot steaming coals .  hunahpu 's pours the typical solid stout black , with at most a finger and a half of *dark* caramel foam topping it . retention is decent , but lacing is barely there .  i 'd say the best thing about this the feel , it 's real silky and full bodied .

the smell is nice .  a - poors a somewhat cloudy dim gold . finger of head subsides to lacing .  nothing special to be honest m : rich , refreshing . has a good mix of carbonation d : easy to drink but not something i will pick up again .

the smell is of clove , wheat , and pomegranate the smell is of good quality .  a : it pours a clear and almost glowing orange color with no head .  i am not sure what this beer is supposed to be , an artisanal brown ale or a dubbel ? flavor is not what expected , no sourness of a oud bruin and no rich caramel maltiness of a dubbel . quite bitter for a belgian beer with a metallic aftertaste . this beer is either mislabeled or does n't travel well or both .

if i was able to rate euphoric qualities , it would get a 5. is this absinthe ? hmmm ... must be absinthe , i 'm losing my mind ! when i poured this beer , took a look , took a sniff , and took a drink ; i came to one conclusion-too much of everything .  a : pours a very hazy copper color with almost no head resulting from a very aggressive pour .  the auroma seemed to disapate as the drink warmed in my glass and left a thin head . i 've had this beer in previous years and really liked the smoothness and drinkability . i was a little surprised at the level of hop bitterness that met my mouth , as i have had the impression , in the past , that this beer leaned more towards a english esb .
the smell is strong . fruity malts , some bitter-dry notes and a slight spicy ( black pepper ?  pours a cloudy straw color with a rather thin head .  m : somewhat thick with low carbonation .

this was a nice red color , as i expected from an irish ale , especially one from harpoon . the problem with this beer is that while it had the bitter foretaste the aroma promised , it mellowed out much too quickly . this was a good average drinking beer , but overall i ws n't impressed .  c & g followed by a huge head of ecru head that stood up like morning wood . very woody and completely unexpected . color was a hazy orangish-amber . best amber ever ( except for amber lynn , who i met in 1987 ) ! make way/room for newport storm hurricane amer ale !  mouthfeel is thick , creamy , and smooth .

looked good , smelt good , and the taste hits your palette and just is n't what you expect . the look and the smell are just fine , but overall , the taste just did n't cut it for me  pours a golden straw color with an inch of whitish head . a little light for a helles .  mouthfeel : thick , medium-high viscosity . medium carbonation .

drinkability : it 's a very smooth drinkable beer accompanied with decent flavors and aromas .  very little lacing .  mouthfeel is medium to light bodied , low to medium carbonation , very drinkable but no spicing really hurts this .

aroma of cherries , dark chocolate , and coffee . i like chocolate cover cherries ( not the liquid center ones ) . without the cherry , this is a great stout .  had on tap previous , now for the bottle : a : golden amber color . m : looked flat , but has nice level of carbonation .  mouthfeel is medium bodied with plenty of carbonation leaving a nice tingle . it 's probably the best aspect of this beer .
winey aroma . strange flavor .  clear dark copper appearance , head is gone as fast as the road runner , just a rim with spider tracks on top .  m : very light bodied and crisp .

smell- smell is fine . bready and mild caramel booze soaked malts .  12 ounce bottle to a pilsner glass a : bronze , good head , lace s : lots of sweet bready malts , a bit of hops . this is highly drinkable .  m - it has a full mouthfeel .

smell : i really like this aroma , very fruity , raisins and apples . quite yeasty aroma , very belgian . nutty and cheesy as well .  lots of floaties in the beer , however , with some slight haze .  this one has a nice 'edgy ' carbonation with light-medium body for mouthfeel .
was looking forward to tying this brew appearance was great smell even better .  a - cloudy burnt orange , small tan head leaves immediately , some spotty lace .  nice thick mouthfeel , though .

smells pleasant enough and you can vaguely see the potential of what it could be if it were properly carbonated , but it 's not .  pours a purple tinged chestnut with 2+ fingers of brown-flecked tan . average lacing & head retention s : coffee & a bit of chocolate , grows stronger as this warms t : coffee grounds , black patent malt , a bit of mocha & herbal hops up front .  medium bodied creamy mouthfeel .

malt monster , sweet notes , caramel with maybe a touch of smoke a hint of booze as well . sweet notes , a lot more smoke in the taste and some caramel and biscuity malts , not much flavor in the finish , some fruity notes .  a- hazy pale orange in color with small white head that falls to a minimal ring around the rim of the glass . decent lacing when spun around in the pint glass .  the mouthfeel is very decent , and a high point to the beer .

fresh , spicy hops immediately on the nose followed by a rush of sweetness suggesting syrup or honey .  the off-white lacing disappeared almost entirely very quickly . however there are a lot of carbonation bubbles clinging to the sides of the glass below the meniscus . the beer is a nice , soft orange/amber color with a slight haze .  slightly heavy body , bubbly , good mouthfeel .

aroma has that classic pungent fresh grain character with zesty citrus from the hops . quite lemony .  poured into my snifter a deep coal black with very little tan head on top .  somewhat thick and sweet on the mouth , with lingering cherry flavors . i 've had a lot of lambics but not a lot of krieks , but i can tell you doubtlessly that this is a very sweet beer that lacks many lambic characteristics .

you could really only smell berries .  black body with a small light tan head that drops quickly . no remnants of that head are left on the glass .  smell : sweet cherries ... .sour berries , red wine and oddly ( to me ) vinegar taste : ( only took 4-5 sips ) short and simply put ... .very sour and nasty tasting . a few sips and i knew i would not be able to finish this brew . this is the first flemish sour i ever had and it will most likely be my last . kicked : perhaps a desired then aquired taste for certain sour ale drinkers ... .and this is probably very good brew in it 's category/style but it 's just not my style ... .take this review w/ a grain of salt .

the aroma was smoky with hints of bittersweet chocolate .  sampled from a brown bomber obtained at bottleworks in seattle upon royalt 's recommendation . label has a skull and crossbones , but little info , other than the odd warning : `` refrigerate your beer or it will die . '' ok. maybe i did n't chill it fast enough . pours a hazy orangish brown under a very , very thin beig head that faded to film very quickling leaving just a slight trace of lace . a good , smooth , enjoyable brew , but the lack of head puts me off .  m : this is where it 's most reminiscent of its style : sticky hop resin , lingering alcohol heat , bitterness hanging on the tongue .

s - a light horseblanket funk hides behind a mildly spice pale malt and wheat nose . the most interesting thing about this beer is the hint of salsa .  pours out jet black with little to no head seems very thick from the pour .  mouthfeel is crisp and very dry .
beer looks good , has the right appearance and smell , but it goes downhill from there .  brown edged black without any retention or lace .  mouthfeel is medium with good carbonation .

s : nice pumpkin profile in the nose . smells promising .  pours a dark brown , almost black color .  smell is mostly sweet cherry pit and a woody pine tree brett type funk . sweetness is strong in the nose . straightforward dry brett is also dominant . i 'm still getting this pine tree or bark flavor following through from the nose . it 's just an odd woody flavor . lots of other off flavors in this one too .

definitely a good , characteristic nose .  beer is copper in color , primarily transparent , white head of fairly dense bubbles of 2cm . head dissipates quickly , leaving no noticeable lacing .  m - medium bodied ale that goes down smooth and finishes surprisingly wet .

has a nice colour and good aroma when you waft it , but overall just too fruity for me . an overrated and pretty expensive beer .  12 oz bottle poured into a snifter fridge temp 2008 appearance : pours a dark , opaque brown color with a 1/2 '' tan head . it is short-lived and leaves barely and lace behind .  nevertheless , i really enjoyed how the body seems to evolve from rather watery at first into a creamier blend as it warms .

smell is good .  i got the last pour out of the keg , and it was pretty full of sediment . a - pours hazy orange with a strong three finger tall head , made up mostly of foam and sediment that i had to use a spoon to remove to get to the beer , leaving thick sticky lacing down the glass .  i thought this was supposed to be an ipa ? mouthfeel is smooth , not much to say there .

a : poured a light golden color with some yellow/orange hues s : plenty of citrus , hint at big tropical fruit , light booze t : what the heck happened here ? m : sweet , medium body , overly fruity o : unimpressed  a : a deep mahogany with a thin dirty white head that thins slowly and only leaves spotted lacing .  medium bodied brew , has a nice rich malty backbone . just a tad to tart & sour to make this one a real session drinker not to mention the 7.5 % abv saludos to bross242 for the sample .

good inital notes of chocolate and coffee that mingle well with the hoppy green aromas . palate is also dominated by chocolate and toffee with hints of roasted malt .  this porter had next to no head with a dark black/brown body .  the mouthfeel is rich ( typical of surly brews ) .

s : orange , corriander , spice and wheat on the nose .  a - reddish brown color with no trace of carbonation at all .  the feel is creamy and fizzy , actually the best part of the beer . sits on the tongue ; solid .

the nose is a burnt chocolate , a nice fragrance . the mouthfeel is creamy and soft with a mellow coffee flavor .  dark brown color is attractive but not classic stout black . dark brown head , coursely bubbled , and fairly quick to disappear . almost no lacing .  medium body , well carbonated . crisp and very refreshing .

consumed this evening off a nitro pour at stub & herbs for their annual darkness eve bash . very delicious smelling brew mouthfeel is creamy as hell smooth amazeingness !  this beer poured a red brown color . kind of like tea .  mouthfeel : medium bodied with moderate carbonation . it dries a bit in the finish .

interesting , pleasing aroma . sweet fruity taste with booziness , syrupy carmellness , some mid taste tangyness , finishes with a boozy citrus rind bitterness .  pours impenetrable black , with almost no visible carbonation , just a thin soapy head .  m : nice feel . feels good .

the aroma is very true to german oktoberfests . sweet bready malts overlapped by spicy yeasty aromas .  the beer is clear and poured very effervescent . the noisy , low tan head disappeared instantly to nothing at all .  body is decent , light but not too thin .

its the most tragically hopped up pale ale ever , its to piney and bitter , might as well be a dipa . at least for once i can say i 've had an over hoppy beer in europe .  pours a chill-hazed rust color ( copperish brown ) with a thin head that becomes a disappearing patch .  mouthfeel is on the good side of medium and has a slightly creamy consistency . i expect much better from ommegang .

pretty good overall aroma buts that where the positives end with this one .  poured into chalice lightly chilled with a soft , shallow head that faded to just a hint for most of the drink . color was golden haze..much more cloudiness than expected .  light-bodied , highly effervescent .

smell is nice . bitter at first with the ridiculous level of carbonation and head but once it settled there was a nice charcoal roasty type character .  a - pours a clear gold with a spritzy head which disappears immediately and does n't want to be refreshed .  mouthfeel : thin to medium bodied , with a nice mouth tingle .

the fact that this is my 7th different jp beer causes me to expect something other than foursquare `` american stout . '' maybe it will be zesty and peppery , like hercule or de dolle , or rather , maybe it will go even farther down that path ... black roasted barley aromas mix with sensations of moist hop-infused wood . i consider the quite hushed , almost silent aroma profile to be a sign of `` correctness .  offwhite head with no stick and decent to low retention .  creamy , soft medium body and very light , prickly carbonation .

s : smells pretty close to the guiness/bass black and tan . roasty and toasty .  a : pours a hazy amber . head is a dull white . there is some decent lacing .  bottle into nonic a : cola brown , fairly thin looking body , good carbonation but low retention s : crisp cracker with a hint of carob , maybe a bit of green apple , heaving co2 t : almost pear-like quality , a bit of toastiness but not much , somewhat chalky/malted milk-like in the finish m : very bright , effervescent , final finish is quite dry but clean , good . i did enjoy the mouthfeel and clean finish .

situation : working on some poetic lines , however elusive they prove to be ... glassware : hoegaarden tumbler ... appearance : light copper body with bubbles clinging to every edge in the tumbler ; white , fizzy , foamy head thins quickly -- definitely filtered ... aroma : bright , sprightly cloveed and citric -- nothing subtle here -- and the orange zest ( whether legit or additive ) is alluring ... palate : a fizzy , zesty busy medium-bodied ale -- a bit thin at the finish but present enough as the sip begins ; set for `` refreshing '' ... taste : the lemony/orange citric zip refreshes ; can this be an ale with zero hop presence ?  very black without much head , some thin , spotty lacing .  pretty good feel actually .
strong hoppy smell with some slight fruit notes .  a : pours a deep and dark plum color with a very small , thin head . zero lacing and poor retention .  m : crisp , light body and medium head .

light malty aroma with licorice and dark fruits .  appearance : medium translucent brown . thin tan head that doesnt last long at all . being a chocolate fiend , this is just fine with me . this beer is a great example of a darker brew that doesnt have to hit you over the head to be impressive .  mouthful : creamy smooth feel that improves when the beer warms the alcohol is more noticeable in this beer than in most dogfish head beers , nice and dry at the end .

smell : strong aroma of roasted barley with distinct acidity/acrid overtones .  2 finger off-white foam head settles down to almost nothing and no lacing . slightly hazy gold color looks nice .  mouthfeel is spot on , not complaints .

i love hefe weizen in general and this one was pretty average . it had a nice blend of citris almost apricot like .  a - pours copper-gold with 1 finger of off-white head . dissipates moderately fast and leaves no lacing .  m- medium in body and fairly light in carbonation .

dense aroma of burned ropes and hemp , raw mushrooms and vinyl . the aroma was the best part of this one ; the taste did n't stand a chance .  pours from cask as a very murky light yellow-orange with a fairly substantial off-white head .  m/d : slick , creamy , decent mouthfeel .

it had a strong green apple aroma but was too candy sweet for my tastes . if your are a lambic fan , it might be for you .  color is a light brown on the bottom of the glass and it has a really neat fade into a dark brown with a hint of dark plum . the head is thin , but leaves good lacing . there is some kind of sediment floating around in this beer .  this cream ale is quite creamy , with low carbonation and a medium body .
the nose is nice- clove and bananna yeast esters .  pours a hazy and cloudy orange with a small foam that has a decent retention .  mouthfeel : medium body with tingly carbonation and a dry finish .

s - smell is very full ofroasted malt , some chocolate and a nice hint of rum which adds nicely to the aroma . i am definitely getting some dark fruits in there as well .  pours a hazy golden orange color with a thick tan head .  alcohol present in the smell , along with butter , raisin and a hop finish . lots of flavors on this , but a little out of control for me . an initial grassy flavor of butter that does n't blend well with the raisin , pineapple , alcohol , brown sugar and hops . some seemed to like it , so chalk it up to personal taste i guess , but i did n't feel like the flavors in this one were in order . too much alcohol and too much buttery sweetness .

i liked the aroma , but was ultimately disappointed with the beer .  a - black with a red hue . not much head .  flavors of whole wheat bread , slight must and some hops in the finish . warming , decent body and mildy creamy .
pretty unique smelling brew , not bad at all .  this beer pours a dark amber with no head .  mouth is bright and light as the style suggests .

the aroma was fruity with chocolate and dark fruits and an alcohol bite .  all four were nearly identical in pour and appearance . this gave the beers a somewhat ( but not too ) cloudy nut brown color .  m- quite smooth nicely carbonated .

smells , hmm . spicy . there 's a nice smell like a kitchen where sugar cookies are finished baking . that 's nifty .  a : red , and very hazy . like , much , much too hazy .  m & d : very creamy and smooth making it rather palatable in spite of the the varnish remover notes . the carbonation is light but tenacious and adds to the texture . honestly , if the alcohol was n't quite so noticeable in this it would really kick ass .

very clean and dry tasting somewhat dissapointing the aroma leads to expect so much more from this beer . very drinkable but if it tasted as good as it smells fresh than i 'd give it a 5. it 's ok to try once but nothing i get regularly unless i was at the source .  pours a clear medium gold , with little carbonation and lacing .  this is the fifth hefeweizen i 've tried . of the five this ranks fifth best . something about these dundee beers that initially offers a metallic taste when cold . perhaps i 'd call this a beer that is better than dull but in need of some more flavor . at this moment , my hefe-universe is franzikaner and weihenstapher taking the lead , with sierra nevada a distant third , followed by paulaner . dundee sits behind paulaner .

nose is harsh . prickly , near-metallic hop intensity .  2006 trumpeter stout one of the first beers i added to my cellar last november , a 22 oz served in a stone irs tulip . black in appearance with a thin toffy-brown head ; chunky particulates swirled in the bottom of the glass .  too heavy on the black licorice flavor , unfortunately , because the medium body is nicely carbonated with a crisp , drying finish .

the aroma is nicely balanced and fairly strong . while the aroma was fairly pleasant , the taste took a turn for the weird .  pours a fizzy light oranged-tan head over a murky copper liquid .  m - smooth , creamy , medium-full body with perhaps a touch of grain to it . pleasant carbonation , and well-hidden alcohol .

smells of ginger , apricot , sugar cookies and some other things i ca n't identify . tastes exactly how it smells . overall not a very good saison .  thanks to whoever gave me the ample pour at dld . not much head was seen .  mouthfeel is full bodied , pretty smooth , and slightly carbonated .

the only thing that really impressed me about this beer is the aroma of pumpkin . some people do n't like pumpkin beers , but i try to not be so objective since they are around only a small part of the year , normally .  pours a transparent amber with a small , bright white head that fades to a nice lace .  smell suggested some yeast , alcohol , some raisin or malt scent . tasted malty , with a stong presence or molases or brown sugar ( i suspect this came from the belgian candi sugar ) , followed by either raisins , prunes , or fig newton filling . slightest bitter edge on the end ( hops perhaps ? ) . overall , a good beer , especially for the novelty of it . however , i could n't drink more than one , especially as the 8 % abv .

aroma : very nice aroma . for me it was the highpoint of te deum . overall : i had a very good first impression and loved the smell , but after the actual tasting it was a bit disappointed .  bottle , a : pours a dark , murky red/brown into a pint glass , without much of a head , fair retention .  good mouthfeel .

smell : enticing . the inviting spicy lemonade smell turned to overwatered crystal light on the palate .  the beer is totally black , or maybe so dark brown that i ca n't tell the difference . it has nice carbonation , but the weak and quickly dissapearing head is dissapointing .  mouthfeel : nicely crisp and refreshing .

with some work this small brewery will likely be able to turn this into a great ale . drink it i did though ... and it 's a decent ipa . the label and wax sealing on the bottle are very impressive ... but i think i 'll try it on tap and hopefully then i can come back and edit this rating higher .  the beer poured hazy golden . the head was white and fell back quickly , but laced the glass .  mouthfeel is slick with modest carbonation .

a : poured a orange gold color with good carbonation and a nice white head caps it off s : all over the place , pine , citrus mainly t : harsh .  enjoyed @ la cave a bulles ; simon & the head brewer of brasserie de vines hosted a tasting on 11/5 . medium body , frothy mouth-feel , nice carbonation .  m : smooth and creamy with a semi-dry finish .

almost definitely a wit beer , the spices are quite apparent in the aroma , and the color matches in a hazy greenish pale yellow manner . aroma is fairly spicey , bits of orange and candied ginger , suggestions of sandalwood . and there is the best part of this beer , the aroma . the flavor is dish rag cottony with fading senses of chalkiness and a little amount of citrus tang , albeit pretty dang sweet and fading to non-descript .  jet black , opaque and flat as lubbock , texas . sorry but it ai n't pretty .  medium bodied and tingly from the carbonation , yet relatively smooth .

s : nice grapefruit . the malt also comes through nicely .  ovila pours a very deep violet color , with faint raspberry spots tracing the outline of the glass . lacing is nonexistent , so overall the appearance is a bit of a letdown .  m - oily and dry ; medium body with moderate carbonation o - this is my first encounter with a belgian ipa .

the aroma was of fruit ( but not estery ) and wine , in my opinion like a reisling . nice malt / hops balance with a slightly bready finish with some lingering bitterness .  had a brownish color with ruby tints . there was a half inch of off white , foamy head . below average lacing .  this brew poured a large head of fie to large sized off white bubbles that soon disappeared . it had a nice transparent amber color with no carbonation evident . now the real interesting part of this review is the brew 's flavor . it is smooth with a complex flavor of many interesting notes . there 's nut , malt , spice , caramel , and butter in the flavor .

there is a pleasant nose of hops and basil , with piney undertones .  a dark red colored body that reminds me of a particularly dark ruby . very nice coloring , with lots of very small carbonation bubbles moving throughout . very little head that disappeared about as fast as i could blink . does n't leave any lacing behind . thin bodied , and despite its lack of head , very well carbonated .  light body and light zesty carbonation .

s : sweet caramel aromas up front followed by some tart apple aromas . slight pumpkin spice aromas follow along with vanilla , oak , and rum . the tart fruit aromas permeate throughout . t : lots of caramel up front with vanilla and oak .  the beer pours a dark rose color with no head retention or lacing .  m : seemed very nice , smooth and creamy .

it smells nice though .  a : orange marmalade with a slight haze . small off white dissipated almost immediately to a thin ring and was gone by a third of the glass .  the mouthfeel is good . it is a low bodied beer with good carbonation .

s - the scent is potent enough that i can smell it a couple feet away . it has a nice malty woodiness with a hint of hops .  pours a clear straw color with almost no head and no lacing .  t & m- creamy mouthfeel , mild carbonation .

s - smell was of cereal .  color was dark brown , virtually no head wth minimal lacing .  the body does have a medium thickness as the bottle suggests and that is nice . the carbonation is a bit heavy but has a pleasantly sharp bite without being fizzy .

s - nice pronounced malt smell unusual for a mexican .  a - tan head kind of rocky . good carbonation . unfiltered and murky . d - if your in the mood for a hoppy beer that fits between a pale ale and an ipa with the color of an american amber you could knock a few of these back .  very nice mellow carbonation and drying mouthfeel .

the first thing that stood out is the strong smell of coffee .  the brew is a foggy fig color . head pours slightly , color is tan foam .  mouthfeel - about right for the style ... the style being a flavored american wheat beer and not a witbier , as listed of course .

smell : picking up a good dose of yeasty white bread , and then the sweetness pounds you .  pours a hazy light brown with a tiny head that is quick to fade .  body and texture are good for the style , but beyond that i really dont have anything nice to say about this beer .

pine on the nose . this is kind of weird . based on the smell you 'd think it was a winner .  i mean i love beer . instead of one of those live water births , id have it in a tub of beer , but i think my wife draws the line there . what it all boils down to is does this taste good , would you drink it in public , and would you recommend it to others . for huckleberry ale , i say yes , no , and yes . but much like great tasting wine coolers , i wouldnt drink them in front of the guys .  m : smooth and slightly creamy . carbonation was subdued .

a : dark brown with nice head and lacing s : smell was lactose , coffee , and some malt t : honestly , i wonder if something went wrong with the keg we had as it was a bit on the sour side .  spicy with sage , cardamom , light fruits , chamomile , ham , juniper , cinnamon , karo syrup , fizz , paper , edible flowers and leaves .  alcohol is too hot as well m : pretty good for a big barleywine . moderate carbonation d : this was almost drinkable .

sweet , malted chocolate balls .  cloudy amber , low foam with big bubbles once settled .  so this year i was happy to find that they were binging together several things that i particularly like : rye malts , saison yeasts and dry hopping . the funky yeasts , hop bitterness , and spicy sweetness compete rather than contribute to a balanced whole . then there is the metallic aftertaste that sometimes accompanies a higher-alcohol beer .
s- spices and cloves are dominate . fruity qualities .  pours a deep , cloudy amber with a slightly tan head that dissipates rather quickly .  mouthfeel is medium bodied and lightly carbonated .

the aroma is very nice - reminds me of orange or orange peel . it looks and smells much better than it tastes .  nice and dark brown with almost no head .  mouthfeel is medium bodied with a nice carbonation tingle .

aroma switched between bitter chocolate , malt , and lactose sugar . as it rested it shifted to a hershey 's chocolate bar aroma . flavor was interesting .  a- average american macro , maybe even a little lighter looking then most s- sweet malts hint of fruit t- tastes great , sweet , followed by a touch dark fruit , not sickly sweet like bl just right for the style , grains balance flavor nicely m- doesnt linger long on the mouth as it 's a thin beer par for the style this is a great example of aal , it is skightly different since miller bought out but probably the best macro for the money !  mouthfeel : thick for the style . almost seems chewy or nutty in the mouth .

smell- sweet and malty , the aroma is appetizing enough to make me want to rush into the first sip . aside from the pleasant nose and initial flavor right at the outset , there was n't much to enjoy going forward .  the color of the ale was pale yellow , almost straw-like in color and there was only a slight amount of haze for this style of beer .  mouthfeel : pretty well spot-on for a wheat beer - full and a tad creamy , without being heavy . medium carbonation is refreshing .

smells of tangy fruit that 's been soaking in alcohol overnight .  not the prettiest beer in the world ; neverless , it has its attractive points . head is only about a finger thick , but is extremely dense and a very attractive orangey off-white colour . beer is very hazy , with large chunks of sediment rolling about in the aggressive carbonation . a moderately large layer of foam remains and leaves some spotted lace .  mouthfeel : high carbonation level . body is good .

i actually liked the smell . this tasted sort of like an alcohol soaked pumpkin pie .  on tap at mondo in sonoma . a-when i was presented the pint glass the only description i could use was turkey gravy with a thin off white film . apparently a lot of their kegs result in heavily unfiltered pours . i will be fair and give it a 3 until i try this he way the brewers ' intended . s-while it does n't look the prettiest , it has a great nose . m-medium bodied and nicely carbonated . i also would like to try this beer there and see what it is supposed to look like .  medium mouthfeel .

smell : fruity but not overtly so , theres even some zest in there thats welcomed but does n't hint at whats to come .  a little bubbly , but light head retention and thin-looking . considering this is an adjunct lager , it looks like it should . o - for what it is , natty boh is one of my favorite cheap adjuncts .  md thick mouthfeel and strong carbonation .

smell - orange . overall drinkability - the bitter sourness ruins this beer .  12 oz bottle - 2007 vintage - best before july 2007 - poured into a cantillon bar glass appearance : poured quickly into the glass followed by ample head that is quickly disappearing .  mouthfeel is quite light with high carbonation .

s : mellow roasted notes , earthy undertones , negligible bitter chocoalte . good smell , but just far too thin with a specific gravity resembling hard water .  appearance : pours out a standard-issue black body with an inch of light beige foam , though this eventually dissipates entirely .  m : smooth with just the right amount of bitterness .

hardly any carbonation at all , no head surfaces except for a few sparse bubbles on the side of the glass ... the aroma is super malty tons of caramel and bread , a little pineapple , no hops , a bit of alcohol .  appearance - there was n't much to look at , thus the 3.0 on the appearance score . completely black , very little head to speak of , largely due to the lack of carbonation . in retrospect ... this beer was almost impressively black .  the mouthfeel is medium to full with good carbonation .

aroma - roasted malts and a coffee bitterness appearance - brown head that quickly fades .  a - it looks a lot like a cola or root beer ; very short-lived fizzy head , quite thin , and i see soda bubbles clinging to the side of the tulip .  very smooth mouthfeel , surprisingly , and its complete lack of off nodes make it quite drinkable .

s- smell was pretty good floral and sweet .  a : pours a near opaque black color . a small tan head forms that recedes to nothing . not much lace either .  honey . malt . sugar . and some hop bite . it really helps clean the palate . a good brew for a hot day and a barbecue .

s : malt , piney hops , maybe a little bit of citrus , followed by boozy smell of bourbon .  a : pours a light golden-straw color ; small head that dissipates quickly , not much lacing s : sweet sticky tropical fruits and belgian yeast .  tastes like mocha syrup , very very sweet , then finishes with some alcohol burn . slick , low carbonation .

a bit of burnt malt aroma too . this is the sort of beer that i take one sip , and then i do n't want another sip until about two minutes later when the awesome smell makes me think , `` come on , it must be good if it smells like this .  thanks to my girlfriend for picking this up cause she knew i wanted it ! a-very typical small head small lace s-more than i thought going on here can smell the hops , grain and some degree of sweetness as well like a fig or grape t-bready and grainy but also a supriingly sweet taste followed by a alcohol and hop kick no real lingering finish just kinda goes down with a slight burn .  md thick mouthfeel and moderate carbonation .

750ml into chimay glass . nice seasonal aromas of roasted spices , light fruity sweetness , and herbal esters . somewhat smokey , as many cc beers are .  pours just about the loosest aggregate of bubbles i have ever seen , no foam , just large bubbles a poppin ' , no lacing and soon enough no head . heavy film to the orange rust , brown dirt color , some clarity around the rims .  mouthfeel : medium bodied and smooth , with a surprisingly smooth finish topped off with warming alcohol .

d & n : really good smells , not much in the way of flavor and depth .  this beer pours a slightly hazy gold with thick head that rapidly disappears .  feel is a bit beefy though comparetively speaking with whats offered in taste ; the full crisp feel more then makes up for some of the faultering taste .

this beer also has a wonderful aroma , bright grains are present , and some cut grass . unfortunately , this beer is all looks and no brains .  a : pours a thick bubbly head with visible carbonation . color is a dark yellowish-gold . slowly dissipating head that leaves little lacing .  m : light body with a surprisingly good amount of carbonation .

aroma of chocolate coffee and something burnt .  on tap in tolland ct. a - amber color , with a cloudy haze in the pint glass it was served in .  m : somewhere between light and medium bodied with a moderate amount of carbonation .

the nose is what you would expect citrusy , piney , good . taste where the true measure of any beer is found is woefully lacking for a beer that grades out so high and costs so much .  appearance : ever-so-slightly hazed , light copper-brown . chunky , dull , pale yellow head comes and goes rather quickly .  m - light to medium body with medium carbonation .

smell : citrus and floral , something i do n't get in english bitters . confused a bit , but smells nice ; floral , citrus , some sweet malt .  pours a hazy amber/copper with a finger of head that drops quick . much darker than expected , probably not the most attractive beer .  mouthfeel : fine .

a - brown - reddish body with an off white head resting on top s - sweet malts , caramel notes , toasty malted notes , brown sugar t - some caramel , malty sweetness that then gives way to a light sourness .  appears a muddy brown with some orange highlights and a small white film . not the best looking genre bender ever .  medium mouthfeel .

aroma is equally enticing with toasty malt and nutty notes .  a : deep garnet color borders on black . small and fizzy tan head has poor retention , but leaves bits of lace .  m - medium bodied ale that goes down smooth and finishes nice and wet .

smells of raisins , plums , turbinado sugar , and a typical belgian yeast aroma . ok , now the taste is something else .  it looks nothing like a saison . there is also only a one finger head that dissipates as quickly as it weakly perks up .  m. smooth with appropriate carbonation .

s : yeast phenols , banana , candy sweetness almost like pineapple , clove .  tannic nose , fairly dry with a fruity grapefruit style but still very quiet . the palate follows from this perspective tannic acid , which gives the smell with vinegar and the smell of gastric juices . good gueuze in the traditional style .  it is a quality brew from the perspective that it carries a nice light bodied quality with lovely crisp carbonation .

good start ... the taste just does n't translate , this is borderline horrible .  750ml bottle poured into a wine tulip - fridge - not sure what datem probably 2009 appearance : pours a murky brown with a raspberry hue on the edges . it is off white in color . no lacing is left behind on the glass .  creamy texture medium plus bodied with lowish carbonation .

s : the typical aggressive hoppy smell of a barleywine , with some dulce de leche and a hint of cedar to back it up . t : little subtlety in the front of the mouth , with some rather pronounced hops and a chestnut richness .  i also got the pilsener . just barely over the top and exceedingly drinkable . very appropriate for the style . like the pils , this has a bit of a creamy mouth feel , which seems like wabash water to me ( that 's neither good nor bad ) .  mouthfeel juicey and full and pleasant .

aroma was probably it 's strength which was nice . notes of brown sugar , black walnut , toasted grain and some caramel were present .  poured from a bottle into a pint a-very light yellow no real head to speak of and doesnt lace s-very floral lots of diffrent floral smells , small hop notes and alchol undertones t-much like the nose its extremly complex and light .  t & m : smooth at first but the hops hit the tongue and are definitely noted on the after-taste . nice mouthful , beer really stays with you after sip .

smells very sweet , maple syrup , a touch of citrus , and a bit of hop bite .  i had this beer poured from a bottle into a pint glass ... a : the beer pours a deep brown color , maybe medium brown , not dark , and has a small off-white colored head , but the head quickly recedes and turns to nothing ... s : the smell is malty , definitely some caramel type malting , and a good hint of cocoa , with a slight noble hopping in the back ... t : pretty much the standard dunkel fare .  medium body and moderate carbonation .

smells really nice with strong cocoa scents .  poured deep , deep brown color.aroma is slightly nutty with malty .  m-smooth and creamy with a medium body . it is slightly syrupy with just enough carbonation to hold a firm finish with just a touch of crispness d-this is actually easy drinking , the flavors are pretty light but everything works together and it has a soft smooth texture on the palate making it quite inviting . solid drink , nothing great but definitely a solid drink if it is there .

this is a very attractive beer , both to the nose and to the eye , but in the mouth , not so much .  chewy black lookin , very nice , but carbonation was on the low side , leaving no head , no lace , nuthin . have a 2010 & 11 in the cellar , hopefully the carbonation is just a nudge upward , and this can break into the upper echelon of beers , that 's really the major factor holding it back , but very good nonetheless .  v=un-g035xuny appearance : transparent light amber , minimal head , minimal lacing smell : bready malts , caramel malts , lemon rind , hint of pumpernickel + fig taste : medium/thin body , toffee , caramel , doughy bread , cranberry , stainless steel sweetness , english breakfast tea , orange + lemon citrus layering , grassiness on finish , baked turkey residual , crisp + slightly metallic mouthfeel , mild carbonation pairings : bratwurst brew + pairing : brew lets the flavors of food shine , keeps palate crisp

smell - cofee , raisins , and alcohol .  purchased six pack from hanover st. liquors appearance = fairly average looking light golden amber . not much head or lacing .  the carbonation and mouthfeel is pretty good .

the smell is chocolate and sugar and its like ireland drifted over & ran into belgium .  a - bright mandarin orange . almost no head .  well-balanced mouthfeel , as you might expect at the taphouse . good amount of carbonation and , since not on nitro , pretty good overall .

sweet caramel nose , dark honey , spice and molasses .  it 's like a superwonderfulbeer , if you like to drink for the flavor this is good ! i 've had all my friends try this beer when we watch the cleveland sports teams lose , and they all like it . my new favorite beer ! : }  it is light bodied and very smooth . it 's lightly bitter and fresh tasting .

its a very fresh smell . it feels good , it smells good , i just wish the taste were a little more refined .  a- pours a deep amber color , with a 1-finger head that disipates moderately quickly leaving no lacing .  the body is nice but i 'm still not crazy about this beer .

the aroma is a little piney with some hard mineral dry malts .  poured into a snifter , a deep opaque brown body with practically no head , and fast dissipating at that .  m. medium to full bodied with decent carbonation . coats the mouth decent , definitely all that sweet malt .

nose is inviting with floral and citric notes . malt is noticed with some faintly carmel/bready aromas .  pours ebony with a pinky of mocha colored head . average head retention & lacing s : dark fruit & dark chcolate in copious amounts t : dark fruit & dark chcolate , plus some charred grain ( not a lot ) up front .  mouthfeel is fuller and creamier than anything i 've had before .

very malty with plenty of sweet notes to accompany the distinct raisin smell .  absolutely zero lacing on this one .  i give it points for appearance and mouthfeel , and on a hot summer day i suppose i could put down a couple around the barbecue .

s - lots of piney/earthy hops with citrus in the background . slightly sweet malt aroma . t - a quick burst of citrus hops loaded with floral components start the taste off , but it dies suddenly into a mouth-numbing bitterness .  a - pours a rich copper color , one finger of head that dissipates imediately and completely , no lacing .  the foam does not hold nor does it leave behind much lacing . very interesting , but way too powerful as opposed to subtle , which in my opinion leads to greater exploration of the beer . my throat was very dry after just a few sips which probably has to do with the alcohol content of this beer .

the nitro widget creates the creamy head associated with the style s : a toasted malt aroma , with a soft milk chocolate scent - heavy on the milkiness , with a lactose aroma quite apparent .  i had their taster tray of seven beers . all of them were so badly infected with lacto that i could n't drink more than a sip of any of them .  very smooth with a medium amount of carbonation .

a malt sweetness , at first scent , then it blends to a dried fruit aroma , mostly of raisons and currants . this beer started out very promising , with a nice look and solid aroma . then it crashes and burns from there , which makes this avery undrinkable beer .  wait , wait for it to subside enough to taste.meanwhile , nice aroma . still plenty of head , but lacing looks weird .  m : light and crisp . what i 'd expect from the style .

very good smelling beer . taste is quite a letdown .  pours a muddy amber brown with a fizzy but thick white head that recedes to lace on the outside of the glass .  medium body , drier than the initial aroma leads me to expect .

smell is neat , sweet and malty , caramel , brown sugar , floral hops , light bit of citrus , almost a bit of oxidized/soy sauce , chocolate milk , light roast , a lot of sweetness , but pretty interesting . smells good but huge flaws in the flavour .  had on tap at anam cara . clear golden yellow color , no head . i like this flavor the most out of all the pumpkins ive tried , the lack of spice really appeals to my pallet .  mouthfeel is very smooth , good .

s- smelled like the outside of my favorite bakery around 6am . yeasty ... bread ... my sniffer is a bit clogged this evening ... so i 'm not catching the fruit/citrus aromas others indicated ( this may influence the taste as well ) . t- pretty much went with the smell . kind of tasted like drinking a slice of light wheat bread .  the beer showed up with no head whatsoever , so i got no aroma at all . the chocolate profile was so small or nonexistant as i could not pick it up .  very nice for a wit .

as would be expected the nose is rich with citrusy hops and freshly cut grass .  i can not say there were anything really as far as head just a few bubbles . there was no lace to speak of either just a ring . the body is a golden orange color with some bubbles .  m- nicely carbonated and smooth to boot !

there are some nice things going on with the malt here , some graham ( again , in the nose ) . tastes sweet and ... makes my face twitch .  pours a clear yellow with only slight head and no retention . got this at trader joe 's and the price was very cheap .  the mouthfeel was good , above average for the style .

aroma malt , fruity and alcohol.mouth feel was slick .had a vanilla alcohol taste .  the beer pours a yellow color and smells of lemons . if i had never had a good shandy before this one this beer would have completely turned me off to the style forever .  took a little swig at first , assessing the carbonation . very bubbly , which i like . felt really smooth in my mouth .

looks nice ... deep black , almost oily ... smell is great ... sweet sugar and alcohol , some mily aromas as well .  appearance is light golden , foamy white head which quickly disspates , almost no lacing . i did not like this one , maybe it is slightly better on tap , but this one is below average .  it was slightly thick with some carbonation , and had a bitter aftertaste . it had good body , but it had strong alcohol flavor that made it tough to drink .

the nose is pretty boozy , but at the same time it works with the brown sugar and dark rum character in addition to plenty of pumpkin spicing . just really , really heavy on the alcohol here .  i was unimpressed by this beer . i drunk the bottle exported to australia ( 5.5 % alc ) .  mouthfeel is medium bodied , crisp with just the right about of carbonation .

s : roasted coffee , maybe some dark chocolate and molasses . t : oh.. oh god.. whoa !  huge head ! the beer itself is a clear orangish yellow . smells like , well ... with the huge head on top i caught hints of sewage , sweet kimchi , really dark yellow urine and sweet pear juice .  the mouthfeel is nice and thick and is the highlight .

great smell and look but low marks on everything else .  on-tab at a bar in detroit : the beer appeared to be clear , slightly darker amber than expected with a finger of white , foamy head that faded in a matter of seconds . no lacing to mention , but some noticeable carbonation floating to the top of the glass .  on the nose , this was about 50 % skunked -- i 've had worse , but i 've only had it once from the bottle without at least some funk . as for the taste , i 'm not old enough to be a grumpy nostalgic , but i distinctly remembering this beer having way more hop flavor . in prague it 's sublime , 3 years ago here it was damn good , now it 's nothing to write home about . for 60 cents more a 12 pack than bud ( i hate cambridge ) , i 'll drink it , but it 's a pity to remember what this beer once was .

the nose is doughy , slathered with oregano , basil , tomato paste , and garlic ... and pretty much exactly as promised . bizarre , but it is not offensive . the garlic is low key , and i appreciate that , as i was worried that it might be obnoxiously garlicky .  in all fairness to the appearance to the beer it was served in a mug that was pulled out of a glacier so i really never saw the actual beer . needless to say i think we can all agree that it has a fairly average appearance . taste was obviously really watery because of the melting glacier , that being said it was n't to far off the mark of what it normally tastes like .  nicely carbonated , at least .

a simple balanced bock which does very littly for me . sure there is a good balance between the hoppy and the malty , but it just does n't yell bock to me .  poured a very pale yellow / hay and perfectly see through .  a full , creamy mouthfeel with moderate carbonation is the highlight of this beer .

the aroma of this beer is off the charts . i guess i get some lemon zest , but the beer is so tart smelling , and the barnyard funk so pronounced , i 'm just amazed by what i smell . as odd as this beer smells , the flavors are just over the top . he was quite grateful , noting the beatification was much better then his gueuze .  the fact that this beer is so much better than corona is undoubtedly going to skew this review . anyway here we go.. a : thin , watery yellow . the brewers of this beer do a good job of covering up any adjuncts , although as it warmed i could taste a little corn .  m- thick with low carbonation .
