thanks to tprokop7 for this brew : a - pours a totally opaque black that formed an awesome two finger head after an agressive pour that disipated quickly leaving a spotty lace . s - dark chocolate , coffee , dark fruits , cab grapes , and spices . t - dark grape , plum , coriander , apricot , and slight notes of chocolate and light coffee .  ( if that 's where you want to go ) the color is a straw color . i would suggest branching out to a different macro lager . there are plenty of macro lagers out there better than bud ice .  the feel is actually nice , with a moderate thickness and a moderate carbonation .

nose is dominated by the aroma of maple syrup and caramel malts . it barely smells like beer at all to be honest . dark malt with caramel and chocolate tones is what rushes out of the gate but it is overwhelmed quickly . this is one of the sweetest beers i can remember ever drinking , and not in the good sweet equals awesome way but in the sweet equals sugar way .  i was n't very impressed with its appearance as it came out . pale , slightly cloudy , yellow-orange with a small head that rapidly disappeared .  the beer is smooth and clean . chewy malts and a lot of spice with an aftertaste i 'm not to fond of .

s : that nutty malt that phillips is famous for as well as some citrus hops .  a : pours a clear and dark copper and topped with a rather fizzy , none too substatial off white head , that fades into nothing , no lacing either .  it has a rich , creamy mouthfeel , but not a lot of taste .

i ca n't pick out any hop aroma . in short it smells like a big , roasty stout . where is the roast i smell ? there is a hint of smooth oatmeal stout in the background . fat dog looks and smells great ( when cold anyway ) .  pours a slightly hazy medium gold with a thin fizzy head typical of these types of beers .  very soft bottle-conditioned carbonation gives a sliky mouthfeel .

aroma was intensely roasty and definitely predicted the sweetness that i described above in the flavor .  poured a very bright pale golden yellow with a light fizzy head that quickly faded to nothing .  fairly thick in your mouth , but again does n't get to a level where it is a bad thing .

smell of pilsnerhops grassy , smell of bubblegum . i 've had several high % abv beers that were very enjoyable with flavour and aroma , but this not one of them .  but what 's with the persistent protein haze ?  medium-full body with a smooth low-mid carbonation .

the smell is quite pleasant and distinctive . taste : the taste was unfamiliar as far as beer goes , it took a few sips to be able to pick out the different flavors .  t : no real taste it is very watery - i might as well have bought a bud light .  mouthfeel is thin to medium bodied with a gentle carbonation tingle .

aroma is perfumy and of bubble gum , very sweet and pleasant . initial taste is of bitter cranberry and maybe a tinge of apple peel .  milwaukee 's best premium pours a crystal clear light yellow , with a fizzy head that faded before i finished pouring .  mouthfeel : clean and refreshing . just barely medium body .

molasses and raisins and roast make for a sweet , dark aroma . the flavors follow from the nose with all that molasses and some astringent burnt malt .  appearance - pours an orangish-amber color with a low head that dissapears quite fast . not a remarkably appetizing beer ... smell - difficult to get a strong scent , but vigorous swishing reveals malty caramel with a distinct alcoholic kick .  medium carbonation feel .

poured into nonic pint glass a - brown-black in color , no head whatsoever s - big roasty flavor . coffee notes , a little vanilla t - malt , no hops as expected .  light straw yellow color with short lived white head .  pretty creamy mouthfeel with low carbonation the drinkability is below average in my opinion .

s - simple but pleasing . mostly malt , white bread .  this sn is a straw color and had a head that dissipated very quickly ; the beer leaves no lacing as i sip it out of my pint glass .  good mouthfeel , almost sticky for the style .

the smell is pleasant like many fruits with a refreshing undertone .  a : pours a half finger head which is quite thin , has only slight cream , and is of bad retention .  mouthfeel was good , with a lighter body and decent carbonation .

its smell was powerful , like sugary caramel malt and honey wheat , with citrus hops and alcohol . it tasted so sickeningly sweet it hurt my teeth .  a : for a light beer , this looks really watery .  medium body and carb .

the nose was very pleasant , heaps of coffee beans , chocolate , and roasted malts . inviting . the bouquet has promise but the palate doesnt deliver .  a : a fast pour into a pilsner glass shows clear gold beer body with a white head that vanishes right away . it 's nice and light with some bubbles to keep it company .  medium-high carbonation .

no carbanation at all ... the aroma is ok , light wood , vinous , sweet , just not much funk , hard to think of this as a wild ... the taste is terrible , no funk , woody , harsh , stale .  deep copper in colour , like an old penny . off-white head disappears in under two minutes . no lacing .  m : medium body , smooth carbonation , dry finish but off a bit .

s : sweet with notes of honey and oranges ... who would have thought ? t & m : has a `` sunkist '' feel to it .  this beer pours a bright straw like yellow color , with very little head .  m : great carbonation that rolls and pops along the tongue , light bodied for an ipa but still finds a nice balance between smooth and textured .

the aroma is of english noble hops and sweet caramel malts , with raisins too .  color is a hazy brown with just a hint of orange . carbonation is good but seems a bit fizzy with a loose head that dissipates quickly .  nice mouthfeel though !

s : nice clove , banana , and mild sweet caramel malt aroma .  not impressed with it at all . what littel there was of the head died quickly . it drank nearly flat , with little carbonation , and what little there was of flavor died quickly , and did n't linger .  there 's a hop mouthfeel , like a ghost of hops , but no real bitterness or flavor .
smells very fruity . peaches ; apricots .  no lacing . a rather shabby looking beer overall .  healthy carbonation lends a slightly acidity to the mouthfeel .

the aroma however is quite exciting , if you like whiskey , which you should if you bought this beer .  a : pours a clear ruby body in the glass . it 's flat , no carbonation .  mouthfeel was smooth , of medium body and carbonation .

s : raspberry vinegar . tart , sour , and a little bit of wild funk in there , as well .  when this beer was poured , it formed a medium sized white creamy head with fine-medium sized bubbles.the body of this beer was clear and the hue was light orange.this beer left very little lacing on the sides of my glass.the nose was sweet and somewhat fruity and the flavor was sweet , slightly hoppy and somewhat sour.the mouthfeel was tingly , smooth , flat , watery and it was a light-medium bodied beer.this beer definitely lacks character as nothing stood out about it .  good carbonation and `` easy to drink '' .

pretty nice . t : starts out hoppy , but quickly transitions into over-sweet malt before a potently alcoholic finish .  because of this , no lacing and no retention . really ? the color is nice but that is the only quality here to speak of .  mouthfeel is good and full with a coated feel , which in this case only spreads the unpleasant taste .

good typical big malty dubbel aromas , raisin/spice bread .  my wife who really likes wheat beers ordered this beer and it came a clear pale yellow with a fizzy looking head with a lemon attached , it looked nothing like a wheat ale of any kind i have seen more like a cheap lager beer.not much aroma wise a hint of toasted grain but thats it , taste was blazee some wheat malt and a touch of lemon but not much here.a very forgettable beer my wife had half and i had to choke down the rest .  d - good carbonation .
complex aroma ; lemon , spices , belgian yeast , no hop aroma .  color is very light straw . head came and went very quick .  medium-light body with moderate carbonation .

sweet , candylike aroma . yellow and hazy with small ring of off-white head .  pours a clear light yellow with a tiny head that goes away in a heartbeat . no lacing .  `` rum is the power , rum is the key . rum is the thing that will set us all free . '' rum , by alestorm color fade of tawny , to sepia to deep hazelnut . black cherry . rum opens up a bit more as it sits . tastes like dark fruit , especially black cherry . again , woody . not much rum , maybe a little rum spice . i was expecting more rum . captain morgan , himself a scot , would be ashamed .

a : the color is a little goofy -- to yellow perhaps , good head , not much lacing present : ( s : smells mostly like saaz hops .  heavy carbonation with absolutly terrible brew head .  some chocolate malt throught he middle , but mostly this is just a big hop bomb of an imperial ... or what i like to call an ipa/stout . i can appreciate that some people like hoppy beers , but when i pay $ 18 for an imperial stout and all i get is a dark ipa it irks ne ... whatever . perhaps with age this could become a solid brew , but right now this is just a hopped up mess and has next to none of the flavors youd expect in an imperial stout .

brewed with sterling and styrian goldings hops . aroma was floral - lavender ? nutmeg and oranges , some vanilla . taste was much too dependent on spice , in my opinion .  the appearance was off-putting . there was no head , no fizz , no bubbles , no lacing . the appearance was flat , but with a nice clear copper red colour .  taste - some nice stoutish flavor , but the insecticide was too much mouthfeel was nice for an impy stout but my focus was drown away overall - somehow i finished this .

s -- faint traces of coffee and roasted malts . a lot of stewed figs and plumb . granted this has a bit of age on it but like the belgian type smell to this . t -- roasted malts , roasted coffee and more figs . like the nose and the finish but the taste and middle get watery and thin quick .  this is nothing more than a ordinary adjunct filled lager dressed up to play `` craft brew '' .  it does posses a nice mouthfeel , as stated , crisp , but not overwhelming .
the nose had plenty of nutmeg along with cinnamon and something graham cracker-like .  i can imagine the color is pale yellow .  medium-light bodied , creamy , and well carbonated .

s - it smells citrusy ( orange and maybe some lemon ) with spices . the smell is very strong though . i say that because it has a sweet musk about it .  a - pours a light golden colour with a paper thin layer of head with no real retention of lacing .  mouthfeel is medium with good carbonation .

not as creamy as i was expecting , but , still very interesting . taste is balanced , needs to be served at about 45 degrees to bring out the true complexity of its flavor , when real cold ( 35 ) has almost watery texture with no character . overall ; i 'd drink it again .  a : yellow , like urine . no need to slam it . i prefer this macro over almost any other .  nice mouthfeel ... medium-full and very satisfying .

smell - hops , caramel and slight earthy tones , very good smelling beer . taste - found this to be very disappointing , actually think i 'm drinking it from a plastic bottle .  a - dark yellow/amber in color .  good mouthfeel though ; again , fine bubbles and good carbonation .

aroma is granny smith apple , taste is of apple juice , kind of weak , i wish it tasted more like it smells , not much else other than apple . overall , pretty much tastes like fizzy apple juice , not very complex or particularly enjoyable , not may favorite unibroue offering .  it 's a macro light lager..out of the can ... we all know what it looks like and pretty much what it tastes like .  mouthfeel - i do like the texture . this beer has a nice body , and the carbonation leaves a little zing on the tongue at the finish .

great crisp hoppy smell . very floral .  the pour sports an incredibly bubbly appearance - as if it were soda . but if you 're at an australian bottle shop , it 's cheap enough to grab six pack and taste without even nearly breaking the bank .  the sweetness punches you in the mouth , maybe a bit too brute . the hops come out much stronger in the taste . i would say the body is light to moderate , with a smooth feel and strong finish . it is not the best tripel i have had , but it certainly is not the worst . the crafting of the beer is a bit sloppy in that i think the sweetness is too strong and the 10 % is not hidden as well as it could be .

this beer has a lot of complex flavours , but unfortunately , it did n't really do it for me . the peated malt is apparant , and there is some residual sweetness , but overall , it was too bitter for this style .  pours a pale gold with tons of head and carbonation .  mouthfeel : this was great .

there is a strong honey aroma , the lavender can be picked up , and there is almost a wheat aroma as well .  appears like a coca cola with no head and dark brown body . im a bit scared.. t. puts my worries at ease after the poor presentation .  m - medium body and moderate carbonation .

nose is quite aromatic , perfume-y , floral , and full of fresh sweet grains . actually , watery all around with a weak malt character thats quickly subdued by a dominant grainy flavor and feel , and a lackluster thinned hop character lurking beneath . a pretty boring offering , and not much of an ipa .  pours brown with a quickly dissipating head . seems a bit light in color compared to most porters .  medium body feel with a clean feel and finish .

s - fantastic smell which got me very excited for a sip .  i 'm going to have to stop doing that after this one ... totally clear , yellow beer with a bright white head , receding down to a the thinnest ring around the glass . no lacing .  mouthfeel is full . finish is dry .

smell- hoppy ipa , with a ? nutty ?  i just picked up this beer today , just finished it , not too bad , it was not too impressive pouring it , but overall this is a pretty tastey beer . overall , i could easily see myself drinking this again , perhaps with a good hearty meal .  the palate is medium and wet , probably the best part of the beer .

mellow , citrussy aroma with some mango , grapefruit and catty notes . the aroma seems characteristic of simcoe . disappointing with a clear chrolophenol issue .  appearance : pours a very light yellow color with a short 1/4 '' white head that breaks apart immediately .  the feel is light to moderate with plenty of fizzy carbonation . nice crisp lager .
s - smell was of light malts , creame , and coffee .  pour of pale evenly hued amber gold .  surprisingly a soft and creamy mouthfeel .

s : yeasty and citrusy , gets me excited for a good witbier . t : does not hold up to what the smell promises .  a : the cork came out with barley a pop and the beer pours a flat deep brown with maybe 3 or 4 bubbles of head that left a few dots of lacing down the glass . highly unimpressive .  m= sooo fizzy and light .

s : caramel and fruit . nice but could be more .  appearance : pale golden yellow colour , two fingered head forms from a spritzy big bubbled carbonation . very thin sprinkled white lace is left , something is better than nothing right ? a biting grain and warming alcohol warp things up in the end .  it 's a struggle for me to judge this beer as obviously a lot of craft went into it 's production , and yet i have to acknowledge that it makes me want to vomit . i will qualify all of this by saying that i hate eggs because i can not bare the sulphurous stink that i experience when they are cooked in any form . it get 's easier with each swallow but to me this tastes like someone is pouring a skunky heineken down my throat just after i 've had a swig of a very nice brew .

the aroma was very sugary , almost maple .  presentation - this beer is cloudy an not very clean or filtered . it looks like a very dirty beer for a professional brewery to be putting out .  good mouthfeel .

$ 6.90 by the pot at syd airport . leaner and drier than i recall ; the trademark redoak fruit is present but very much under a cover of dry minerals and slate . almost finishes peppery .  a - very pale yellow .  m - good carbonation , fairly large amount of bubbles .

s : funky sweaty lambic sour . very vinegar-like nose . slight cherry , but with a goaty acid smell .  pours a see thru orangish gold with a bit of quickly disappointing foam . swirling ca n't revive anything , and there is no lacing left .  m/f - nicely carbonated and creamy . medium body . pretty nice m/f .

the aroma is of toffee , caramel , and a hint of flowers . it is a rather strong aroma .  has a very pale yellow color with a 1/2 inch head .  m : highly astringent - to the point of physical puckering and spine tingling . medium body , which is nice , and the carbonation is decent for the style .
uninspiring . aromas are agreeable : grapefruit hops , caramel , wood and vanilla .  a - light gold . no head , light lacing .  mouthfeel is exactly what i would want from a porter .
it also smelled good .  it pours a clear straw yellow with a rather typical fluffy white head .  mouthfeel - nice and crisp on the mouth . good carbonation .

s : fruity esters and peachie/apricot hop aroma . lots of fruit , rich says he dry hopped it with locally grown chinook and he notices lots of apricot from them . bitterness is subdued . full mlat flavor with esters and med-high hop flavor . m : medium body with low co2 d : a biggish fruity ale thats got some fun hop flavors . not typical of a west coast ipa as the bitterness is pretty mellow but a fun beer .  clear straw color with a low white film and virtually no carbonation .  best flavor description i can garner is tonic water with added salty . crisp but full in body .

smells yeasty , sweet , and fruity - my uneducated nose says prunes .  ( @ the union sq location ) there was very little flavor and the after-taste left a flat feeling in the mouth . i 'll try it again at one of the other restaurants and if my assumption is correct that this was a bad batch will edit the review with new notes .  medium bodied and relatively smooth .

light sweet carmel malt aromas , reminded me of cotton candy .  a- burnt orange/ copper with little to no head . essentially no lace and no carbonation .  the mouthfeel was good . it was perfectly carbonated , mouthcoathig , and you can feel the head with the swallow ( innuendo ? ) .

blonde . nose of sauvignon blanc , apples , orange , floral and grassy hops and slight biscuit like malts . faint in all ways . light citrus fruits throughout along with a mildly bitter , plenty dry finish of hops .  i have mixed feelings on this one.. poured into standard pint glass , literally no head however this one was fiarly flat too.. no date on the bottle .  creamy mouthfeel , soft and lazy on the tongue . the best part of the beer .

the aroma is sweet , slightly roasted , chocolate ( hot chocolate ) and some coffee and honey . overall , an interesting beer , albeit one dimensional .  appearance : overall very flat . pale neon yellow , highly carbonated .  mouthfeel is full and round .

aroma was mostly chocolate and coffee , with a little fruit mixed in .  looks just like pbr when in a clear mug - light golden , off-hue lacing , and large bubbles rising quickly to the surface before disappearing within a few minutes .  carbonation and feel were quite nice , but the taste just seemed to be lacking .

aroma - 4.0 - aroma is very intriguing . soft flower notes dominate over a malt background .  i must admit though , i was figuring a=on this being a 2 across the board beer when i ordered it ( as the bar had nothing else to offer ) ... pours viscous dark with no head , lacing or retention .  strange brew this one . very fine carbonation makes it way up from the bottom of the glass . taste is hard to describe , initial thoughts were that it was like a combination of beer and white grape juice . in fact , that thought still persists so that 's how i 'll describe it .

cordial . a nice blend of sweet [ raspberry and chocolate ] and a touch of sour . very sweet , though it dries out on the finish . the nose is really solid and i think with some tinkering this could be a real winner .  a : pours a straw yellow color with a thin white head .  m - smooth , thin , extremely refreshing .

s - it has a nice smell but not a potent aroma that i 've had in other beers in this class . smells acidic and malty .  a - this beer is a drab brown tint , like tannic streamwater .  mf : nicely coarse until the finish - exactly the opposite balance in texture of what it ought to be .

smells wonderfully of sugary fruit but with a fresh milled grain cereal quality .  a - pours clear gold with smallish , thin , 1/4 inch pure white head that lasts a short period of time . dissipates to a very thin almost non-existent ring with no laces on the glass .  the mouthfeel is smooth .

very smooth initial mouthfeel with a strong flavor , maybe it 's me but i 'm finding it hard to distinguish what type of flavor exactly above the bitterness that has taken over my whole pallet , it kinda reminds me of lefe , only more bitter ! quite strong though making this review even more difficult , ouch ! quite frankly i wouldnt drink this again , a chore to drink .  its a very pale yellow .  nice mouthfeel is slightly thick and fitting . moderate carbonation also fits with the taste of the beer and style ideal .

nose is huge chocolate malt . some caramel malt and a big dry roasty character .  light yellow . very much a lame duck when it comes to german pilseners . it 's cheap yes , but so are better beers .  they get knocked on appearance 'cause it 's too carbonated but that very same extra carbonation helps greatly with the mouthfeel .

neat floral thing is also looming about .  it looked like flat cola and had an overly sweet taste that i found , at times , cloying .  m : well carbonated with small bubbles that mostly blend together as soon as they hit your mouth .

massive smoke and green chile . i 'm not a fan of this as a beer aroma but it sure makes itself known . scoring fairly high because it delivers as promised . t - pretty spicy with smoked green chile on the tongue and back of the throat . not much else making itself known .  a : the slightest bit cloudy amber with a small , fast-fading head which was completely gone after a few sips ; then it looked like i was drinking an iced tea .  it formed thick coagulated mats of dense foam and left incredible lacing on the inside of the glass . medium-light body ( but creamy smooth ) and moderately carbonated .

nose is a nice pine with a touch of citrus . pallet starts with a pleasant bitter then fails to deliver any meaningful carbonation , what i am trying to say here is that this beer is flat or just about ... no bubbles in my glass as i look at it just after pouring , no ring of foam , no lace , no nothing .  appearance : honey color with no head or lace .  mouthfeel is very good , full and interesting as it explores . its growl is far worse than its bite .

strong- definitely belgian style- you do n't say ? palm nuts and a picture of africa on the back does n't imply that but i see i 'm wrong ... it could have been my supplier and how long he 'd had it in the store , but when i poured it into a glass there were all kinds of floating particulate .  appearance : pours a clear orange brown with a sickly thin head .  mouthfeel : lighter body with medium carbonation and a crisp , refreshing finish .

the aroma is nice and citrusy , with hints of mandarin orange and lemon zest .  pours a fizzy yellow , with a small white head .  mouthfeel : very clean and crips , slightly bitter that lies with the high carbonation , light body .
s : smells , nice and smooth .  beer pours slightly cloudy yellow .  mouthfeel is slightly thick and slick with a little hint of carbonation tingle .

s : this one has a pretty decent nose . d : the nose was quite nice , but the flavor and mouthfeel are just a failure .  has a very pale yellow color with a 1/2 inch head .  aroma was pale malt and a weird kind of `` synthetic funk '' . it literally tasted like sugar water . there is a great carbonation in this beer which made it drinkable , but none of the great flavors of a true saison are present .

the aroma is slightly sweet with some malts & hops and , suprising enough , roasted nuts , coffee and herbs and spices . not recommended unless you 're very adventurous .  pours a wimpy , bone-white head that flees quicker than george bush from a disaster area . the body is straw-golden and clear , with a lackluster amount of carbonation .  nice medium full body ( the only thing i really liked about this one ) .
s : sweet malt and spice . cinnamon and nutmeg . t : light sweetness and light bitterness .  really nothing impressive at all .  m : the body is medium with a medium to high carbonation .
enticing perfume .  in contrast to some othe reviewers i thought the appearance of this beer was marginal . it was cloudy with a bit of head and a very dull apearance .  m. medium creamy .

jolly pumpkin boasts that their interpretation of a saison made the top 25 cut for men 's journal 's best beers of the us . like jolly pumpkin 's calabaza blanca , they 've got the framework for a great beer here , but the recipe , particularly the balance of flavors , needs some fine tuning .  a : pretty basic golden yellow . no head .  the first sip reveals a light crisp body with mild rolling carbonation .

s : smells strongly of cherries and bourbon with a hint of dark chocolate . if smell is an indicator this beer is going to taste great .  cucapa is one of the few new macro breweries that are changing the way beer is conceived in mexico , where macros like modelo ( corona , bohemia ) and cuahutemoc moctezuma ( sol , tecate ) are king . a : light yellow s : herbs t : acidity stands ( as in cucapa 's stronger versions ) , but without the maltiness to suport it .  aroma is dominated by belgian yeast , citrus peels and coriander . the hops give salvation an earthy , herbal profile and it meshes well with the big yeast backing . tastes notes are honey , apricot , overripe banana , coriander , belgian yeast and light candi sugar . probably too much candi sugar . overall a good beer but still far from the best examples .

aroma of tart cherries . i would definitely drink this fresh as the 2-3 years of aging did n't help this beer [ actually , i 'm pretty sure it hurt it a lot ] .  poured into a darkness tulip on 6/1/11 thanks to mbpbugeye for sharing with the group dense , dirty rust brown . they were gone in mere moments . weak ? dry finish ; a bit wine-like due to the lack of carbonation .  on tap at rackhouse , i had high hopes considering this was made with wet hops and colorado peaches but i was let down because they were so subtle . smells like a touch of yeast and nit a single hop to be found . flavor had a very , very light peach note but i prefer more . i honestly could not taste the hops at all . this was not a good saison unfortunately nor was it a good introduction to denver beer co .

nose : nice . spice , pumpkin pie , a bit of malt which lends well to this warm october bouquet .  this poured from the green bottle to a standard lager yellow with very little head , rather uninspired .  mouthfeel : medium-bodied . moderate carbonation .

light wheat aroma but it smells a little dusty and stale .  that lone star and pbr are made by pabst comes as no surprise , these beers to me are almost identical . and given lonestar 's cheesy `` the national beer of texas '' slogan , there 's certainly a little novelty that i do find at least moderately appealing .  mouthfeel is certainly damaged by the high level of carbonation .

this is a fairly drinkable beer . bad beer .  a copper-golden color , the copper is darker than i had expected , and it 's not exactly pale . the strange part here though , is the lack of yeastie sediment , this liquid is totally clear with big spazzed-out bubbles and an equally crazy head that hisses and fizzles out really quick ; this is not good , especially since this should be a very jazzy , healthy look . the lack of yeatie 's and haze is most troubling .  mouthfeel : thin ... has a flat soda feel to it at times .

nose is slightly malty/grainy and that 's it but better than some light beers i have had . sessionable with a good price , one of the better light beers i have had .  poured the color of apple juice . in fact , it looked just like apple juice , not only because of the color , but there were a few bubbles that hardly constituted a lace .  carbonation is very weak and it makes the body feel thin and watery .

weak scents coming off this beer , but they are there ; weak sour citrus , weak grains , light yeast .  a - poured with sediment left it just a slightly hazy yellow wheat color with a tiny bit of head that went away within seconds and did n't leave anything .  mouthfeel is very thin almost watery .

smell : i want to say it smells like old beer . it is not a pleasant odor . thankfully , it really does n't translate to the taste too much .  a - wheres the carbonation ? my bottle poured with a head that , at full strength , was barely over a millimeter . dissipated to a ring that barely held together in sheeting . the few bubbles of carbonation look lost , lonely . this is a beer i almost have to slug back a gulp of to get the full palette .  the mouthfeel is too thin , though heavy and oily , and somewhat under-carbonated .

the nose offers some confusing aromas . there is a sort of armpit scent that is anything but pleasant . the citrus scents are muttled together to host a clashing scent of hop offerings and an `` off '' smelling odor .  i liked the drinkability , obviously , and it goes down just as smooth/nasty as any other american macro swill .  taste-very thin and watery . overall-10.1 % abv and very watery , very light flavor profile .

not much of a nose , typical lightly sweet and rice aromas . hops are actually detectable but very light .  poured out a pale yellow colour with a big head that shrank away before my very eyes .  on tap at rb ... this pours a super dark gold straw but its still very clear ... the head is totally dead , nothing at all there ... the taste is also super light , ca n't taste anything but light skunk . its not bad per se just boring , why drink this ? overall , an easy session beer but nothing special .

the smell is at the beginning very light , just some hints of malt , and caramel . after a while , you can feel some fruity and alcool , but very light .  a : pours a half finger head of fair cream , decent thickness , and bad retention .  m & t - flat , no life to this at all and thin were my first impressions . really no carbonation and slick and oily in feel .

i was initially treating this one as a schwarzbier but the nose is pretty weak .  labat 's kokanee is one of the worst beers they make ... and that 's saying a lot ! kokanee has really damaged their good name by liscencing labatt to brew their beer for ontario and east .  m & d : light , almost watery mouthfeel .

there was no smell other than hints of grain . the beer was a very solid pilsner with great taste , it was not over powered by grain .  a : pours a half finger head of fair cream , good thickness , and pretty bad retention - though the abv is a decent excuse .  mouthfeel : here 's were things go wrong ; this beer is very , very watery . it so hoppy and yet it sort of feels like you are drinking water .

sm : hopped barley . a light generic scent .  well , i did pour this into a pilsner glass so here goes ... a : clear golden or yellow color with a large head , no lacing , and the head was gone in a few minutes ... s : water , adjuncts ( most a corn smell ) t : carbonated water with a small bit of light lager added .  especially the mouthfeel which hurts the overall picture . the mouth is weird it gives the impression that the carbonation is n't really there which in turn makes the flavors get lost and just ooze to quickly over the palate .

smell : fruity malt , reminiscent of bananas , with strong notes of yeast . not altogether pleasant . it smells very similar to some of my first attempts at fruit wine prior to and racking and settling .  mid to light amber/reddish straw colored . not much of a head . the bottle tells me orange zest and cinnamon and i can see the cinnamon and a touch of orange but without being told i 'd be a bit confused about it . it seems a touch wheat based though i 'm not sure if that 's the spices .  mouthfeel is the biggest fault here . it is light , fizzy , and lacks enough body to support the bitterness which means this brown ale is not the one thing every brown sould be , smooooth .

this looks like a typical macro lager , and the smell is inoffensive .  this beer feels extremely hopped up ... no pun . it tastes very dry and makes an ipa seem more like soda pop . the interesting characteristic of the beer is it 's abv which does pack a punch but it is the essence of cramming several hoppy beers into one ... when drinking this you really do not think pilsner .  however , this is very thin , making this taste rather stale . this beer is light in body , moderately carbonated and a little watery to boot .

aroma - a mild sweet graininess , a touch of yeast . little if any classic aroma of banana , clove , etc .  this beer tastes like a mixtrue of water and hamm . very easy to slam . for 7.99 a case you ca n't really miss with pig 's eye light but only someone who is daring enough to buy a case for 7.99 could truly enjoy it .  not much to it really , kinda thin .

it 's got the extra kick of abv that most ice beers offer . the taste is smooth not really noticeable alcohol flavor exists wich is good cause this beer gets watery tasting easily . overall a waste of time just buy molson lager or the golden ale a much better choice .  pours out to a somewhat hazy very dark brown , not forming a head , but just a slight ring of bubbles . absent carbonation .  it was very light on the mouth and too watery .

11.2 ounce bottle - $ 1.79 at total wine & more in kennesaw , georgia . smell : while it does look nice , it do n't smell so nice , with a big whiff of skunkiness .  but on my thrid ( and final ) pour i have zero head . my beer honestly looks like a glass of ink . also , zero lacing .  feel : it honestly feels like a light fizzy water with a bit of prickly sensation , not all that enjoyable really . it has a nice flavor , but it does n't work well with the thickness or the level of carbonation and it really makes it almost undrinkable .

it had an artificial lemony smell to it which i did n't care for .  lb is a pilsner , so it shares some flavor characteristics with the more widely enjoyed miller lite . head is somewhere between yellow and white , and does n't last long on top of the drink . - backdated tasting : i first reviewed this beer on 21sep03 , this post is based on notes from that review .  the palate is thin for the style .

mostly scentless . taste - musky .  i rather liked this ipa and i 'm not an ipa fan . great head , good flavor , it seemed a bit cloudy , and there was sediment at the bottom of the glass when i was done , but that really just added a little charm to it , but for regular coors light drinkers it might be a little off putting , so if i 'm making my domestic beer drinking friends drink it i 'll do so in a dark pub .  m : thin , watery mouthfeel .

smell-fairly budweiser like , hints of rice and grain , no real hop or malt aroma to speak of . taste-crisp taste , grainy on the tale end , a decent hoppy juiceness does come through and show itself here .  had this on cask @ prime 16 , new haven ct sort of unimpressed right off the bat - poured almost no head , pitch black center , semi translucent cola edges . did nothing more than gather bubbles around the edges of the glass .  taste is rich and full , very malty , but the body is too thin for the style . not too bad , could use a little more body , though .

i did n't notice any smell at first but as it warmed i very deffinately smelled honey .  the beer is an off yellow , very cloudy . there were a lot of floaters near the end .  mouthfeel : the mouthfeel is weak . there 's simply no body here to speak of .

whatever the gimmick , it tastes almost exactly like the regular sapporo . sapporo and sushi go hand in hand . it tastes very similar to a pilsner . no hop taste or aroma , but doesnt really need it either .  pours pale gold , with a slight haze . thin one finger head with poor retention and non-existent lacing .  body is very thin , very watery .

the rather weak smell is malty with a slight touch of chemicals ( chloride ? ) ; there is also a thin yet fresh flavour of some hops .  as empty as my pockets are , good beer just isnt accessible . at first it tastes just like any other american macro brew , only with a little touch of sour/bitterness during the aftertaste . drinkability is decent if you 're broke and in need of a cheap buzz .  t : very bitter and hoppy , some citrus in the background m/d : too thin for my taste , lacks a bit of carbonation , and a bit of a soapy feel .
s - smells like wet hay soaked in alcohol . t - very disappointed .  there was also absolutely no head or lacing , which is a must for this style .  the mouthfeel is thin , and a bit watery .

this is a dark yellow almost amber beer with no head at all ( at least that is how it was served ) . almost no aroma to speak of just a slight sweet grainyness .  thin pale yellow pour , with soapy thin head .  mouthfeel is thin and watery , although flavors are assertive but simple .

had this out of a .5l can poured into a pint glass ... a : pale golden color , very very large head , actually much too large at first and pretty clump head ... s : grains and water.. t : very poor tasting euro beer , take heinekin and make it 2 times worse .  appearance i am not that impress , golden color , carbonated at the beginning , but after few minutes , it left only few bubbles . same is with foam , which is not that surprising with epl .  this beer has a higher level of carbonation with a thin and watery mouthfeel .
metallic aroma . underwhelming at best .  wailua is a clear , very pale yellow with a thin , rapidly disappearing white foam .  the mouthfeel is thin , and somewhat watery .

s : not much nose , a bit of caramel malts ... t : tastes of roasted caramel malts . average , average , average ... so far , flying dog 's offering was much better ...  a - it sounds like a soda with its head creating quite a fury as it fades very fast from its cloak of white merely a trace at the surface . the body is thin , watery and a pale yellow .  watery texture .

been a while since i had one of these ; i remembered `` xx '' being pretty good for mexican beer ( which has never impressed me ) but i think i `` remembered '' incorrectly . the aroma is rather funky : an almost doughy yeast that 's hard to get past .  a : no head whatsoever , and my glass is clean .  body is thin and watery .

besides a slight wheat smell , there much going on here at all .  a : brightest , yellowest body possible with a big loose head that quickly dissipates leaving no lacing , and a thin bubbly cover .  there was way too much carbonation , making it burn my tongue . the beer is also thin .

smell : did n't get much of one . little bit of hops and spices ( cloves maybe ) . but way underdone . taste : nice backbone of hop bitterness with roasted nut ( pecans or walnuts ) overtone .  christmas eve , oddly craving a cheap beer , picked this up at a 7-11 2 16oz cans for $ 3 a : pours dark straw yellow , no lasting head .  m- very light , almost no body . kinda watery , nothing lingers .

the aroma is weak and thin , so vague that it 's difficult to nail any one element down . the best i can do is call it vegetal , and pretty much standard macro fare smell-wise .  a - horizon wheat was poured pretty harshly into the center of of the glass from a good height after the glass was about half full . very quiet pour despite its vigor . it yielded a minor white head less than a full finger with low retention . body of pale yellow straw is completely hazy and inactive . no lacing .  surprisingly watery mouthfeel , this is definitely a letdown for a beer that came out of the bottle looking like it was going to kick my ass . i really would like a mouthfeel that 's a little chewier in this beer .

s : not much that can be discerned here . hints of toffee and malt . t : very grain malt presence presides over the entire engagement with this beverage . better than the smell , but still not a whole lot going on .  a- clear gold coloring , much like a macro , with not a whole lot of head .  m : again , to watery , their was no meat to this beer . d : you could probably drink bunch of these , it 's watery enough .

other than that , the nose has nothing other than unexciting yeast . it kept thinking of a hot dog stand ( probably the buns ?  there was , however , zero head and zero carbonation bubbles in this . it looked flat and uninteresting . i expect something with a high abv to look like this , not a 4.7 !  the feel was slippery and as short-lived as the head . with the strong artificial vanilla presence , the lack of bourbon and wood flavors , and the watery feel , michelob winter 's ale is more diet vanilla soda than bourbon barrel aged anything .

first of all i paid twice the price of american bud for a 6 pack of this beer and i should 've stuck with the red white and blue version . i 'm not trying to discourage anyone from trying this beer , but if you 're expecting a terrific beer i do n't think this stuff will live up to your expectations as it did n't live up to mine .  this is the world 's easiest drinking beer . you can pound 10+ of these and not feel bloated or filled up .  smells like faint ale , like watered down anchor steam , and i think it tastes like that too . not good , not bad , but definitely a weaning product for your freinds or a session beer . not alot going on , but you could drink a lot of them and not feel overpowered .

appearance : light amber color smell : not much here . this just tastes like a nondescript ale with an ipa kick in which someone just added a tiny bit of fall spices .  the color and smell wo n't impress you- you 'll think of pine-sol with its lemon acidic smell . it maintains a repectable head , but the cynic in me says that even the most sadistic of soldiers can afford a snazzy uniform . forget the lemon smell and the coors dressage , this beer was made for chuggage when its cooler older brothers yuengling and sam adams are mia , hot-rodding with hot chicks in fancy convertibles . this beer may earn its stripes with the college crowd , but i think it 's handy to have around for cooking seafood and bragging to your younger brother that you still `` got it .  m- really thin for a stout with crazy high carbonation .

s : light nose , some munich malt , but i 'm really searching .  473ml can appearance clear light yellow colour with an average size fizzy white coloured head . there is an average amount of carbonation showing and there is some fair lacing .  now , with that said , you do n't need to slam three of these at a time , like water . generally , i drink beer like water , so the more it taste like water or has just a spritz of taste , that better it is . so , sit back and enjoy this one ; it has the alcohol content to make you feel smooth in just three bottles - that leaves room for the food !

i detected a skunky nose , and believe that i got ahold of an older bottle , but ca n't tell because of the absense of a beer date .  heineken pours well enough with a minimal head that disappears as quickly as the groundhog seeing his shadow . it smells like banality and looks like every other macro brew . i sadly could n't think of a way to tie this into the review so here 's an out of place quote from the movie blue velvet , `` heineken ?  the body is thin .

spicy smell like a belgian white , but also a little chemically too .  the pour produced a slightly hazed pale yellow color with a two finger head that disappeared almost as fast as it rose .  m : water and light chemical dryness . it has no body and very little bite , from either hops or carbonation .

i had decent expectations for this beer because several reading material sources spoke highly of it and i kind of thought it would be one of the better mexican beers i 'd have . same clear yellow as the vast majority of american mass produced beers . forgettable contents .  maybe it 's the insanely cheap price tag . the color is a poor urinary yellow and the head does n't linger more than anyone would expect .  mouthfeel is watery , and despite its meager alcohol content , this one really is n't that drinkable .

the smell was of grain/barley with modest hop . this beer falls in line with most macro american beers .  a- light yellow/gold in color , with an aggressive head of crackling foam which does n't lace and diminishes fairly quickly . s- oraganic skunks ... just kidding . similar to most mass produced mexican brews ( ie . corona , sol , you get the picture ) does have a decent clean and crisp finish i will admit . i wish i could say that this is a step up from your typical macro but thats not the case .  m : rather light and fizzy , thin . bit too much carbonation .

s : slightly sweet malts with a hint of copper . o : mediocre  pours a cloudy pale yellow color with about 7 bubbles of carbonation , so basically flat .  beer is thin , almost watery , with almost no carbonation . depending on your comfort with a `` flat '' beer , this is either a flavor treat or a tactile disappointment .

s : heavily metallic , to the exclusion of almost everything else , except perhaps some malt . t : very average .  looks orangey with a very minimal head -- no retention or lacing .  a medium is rocked by angry carbonation . said carbonation is quite vicious , ushering away in a hurry each sip . overall impression - some ok things going on but the carbonation and bitterness drag it down in general ( not to mention to style ) .
s-smells like raisins and smokey malt , not really impressed .  appearance is watery and a mild , with a weak head .  thin bodied ! majorly dissapointing . body of the beer carries no flavor !

a bit unpleasant .  this style is usually brewed without regard for balance , so my expectations were low . a : no head at all ( likely as a result of the high abv ) . colour is a cloudy orange .  taste : thin honey taste with few other real flavor components . mouthfeel : am i drinking water ?

s = smells of wet rag . damp damp wet rag . t = very watery in my opinion .  pale light golden in color with a small head that quickly dissipates . this is good , solid cheap beer . in addition , i did really like the mouth-feel of this beer ( at least for a cheap american adjunct lager ) .  citrusy and maybe some pineapple as well m : full bodied , harsh bitter mouthfeel that is not very enjoyable really d : not a horrible beer but nothing i would willingly buy again .

it also did n't have much of an aroma to it . the aroma i did get was like sticking my nose in a fresh bag of toasted malt .  after the cork debacle , the beer appeared a rusty orange hue , bordering on copper . no head , no lacing .  same story with the taste , even more so , actually . tasted decidedly boring and flat . not much to cheer about , although i may have to try another if i see it as this is my favorite style of brew .

keep this short and some what sweet-for a light beer its pretty good amongst other light beers such as bud light , coors light . this in my opinion is head over heals better then bud light and coors light . i 'm not going to get into the details such as the way it tastes and so on , becuase their are many reviews on the bitter detail .  pale straw topped by a finger of poorly-retained , fizzy , white head . the head leaves no lacing behind .  mouthfeel is thin , watery , and not very pleasant .
overall , the aroma is not that appealing .  pours up a uriney yellow . not much head .  m thin and watery with minimal carbonation .

s- smells of hot chili peppers which is overpowering and underwhelming .  poured a golden amber with no head - went straight to lace . mouthfeel is pretty interesting - very effervescent despite the lack of head , tingles on the tip of the tongue .  tastes sweet and watered down , but agreeable . very slight hop on the finish . give me this over any anheuser-busch ( at least that ive tried ) any day of the week , if i have to drink a macro .

the smell is pretty ordinary for a euro lager , having a real tinny wate quality .this makes the taste a little surprisingas there is an enjoyable blend of malts and bitter hop , neither of which reach any great heights in character , butdo balance well .  picked up a 12 pack to thank my neighbor , but she has been slow to drink them so for science 's sake : pours an effervescent gold with a pinky of cream colored head that drops away quickly . no head retention or lacing s : light cereal notes , a touch of floral & citric hops , fades away soonish t : sweet cereal notes , some apple & white grape noticable up front .  mouthfeel is very thin and watery on the palate .

this is a light bodied lager . it doesnt smell or look like anything special but this is n't that poor of a beer . this beer is pretty tasty for its price and class .  really pale yellow , with a blotchy head , lightly floral hops aroma .  mouthfeel is tingly from the bubbles , but thin and somewhat watery .

this bottled batch is about a month old and it seems well made but short on flavor and a little light on body for me.the fizz is good and the lacing is respectable , and it 's pretty to look at , but i keep waiting for more flavor . ab must be doing its research on what it 's customers like , but this one falls short .  appearance : it has a dull golden color with a light head which dissipates almost immediately .  mouthfeel was very thin , unfortunate .

however , this particular bottle is just a little off , with a light aroma of cooked veggies .  a- pours a pale yellow with no head whatsoever .  the mouth is much too thin and watery for this beer , and this ruins what otherwise may have been interesting .

only slightly darker than yellow , no head , and a nose that reminded me of crappy beer .  no head . orange pour with a light yellow fringe .  the carbonation was awful though ; it was pretty weak and dull in general and just did not keep it alive .

b- not much smell . slight grassy and cereal smell . t - very light taste .  its not a horrible beer , as it is not an ipa the beer had a rather water look to it in the glass .  very watery and pop-like in the mouth .

s : the smell reminds me of regular bud or miller .  poured a semi hazy straw-yellow color . not much foam and what little was there was quickly gone . maybe one of the fastest disappearing acts ive seen .  mouthfeel seems incredibly thin for a stout .

very tiny head , and resembles your typical pale lager in almost every way .  this was cheap . it was 90 degrees out and we had some grilled pork . this beer was well iced in a cooler and it was very good for that .  mouthfeel : carbonation is too low , and the body is flabby and slick . it is n't too far off-style , overall , but it is burdened with off-flavors , too much diacetyl for my palate , and an unpleasant mouthfeel .

smell : very corny . a slight bitter element , almost as if some of the metal from the can leeched into the beer . aroma detected at least two feet away from glass . not pleasant . there was a very strong corn taste , with the harsh bitterness , but lurking behind everything was a smooth cherry taste , more like robitussin than maraschino , but cherry nonetheless .  poured a pale canary color with not much hue or liveliness .  mouthfeel was overly light and effervescent for a serious stout , but results in a good summer quencher stout .

honestly this smells pretty bad to me . interesting floral aroma , and by interesting i mean bad . o - it 's okay , but the smell really turned me off .  beer poured a very cloudy ( with rather large flakes of sediment ) even though i was careful with the bottle .  mouthfeel , what mouthfeel ? watery .

aroma is weak , but faintly of grains and wheat . very plain . reasonably drinkable and not half bad , but still very plain and unremarkable .  hey , i guess this is a light beer.pours light , faint smell , tastes like carlsberg , which i 'm not sure is a good thing . definately a light beer , with that kinda sour taste you get from carlsberg at the end . it does have more taste to it than other light beers which is good if you want to taste beer not water in your lights .  way too thick and syrupy , lowish carbonation , like drinking a sugar solution .

the aroma is quite muted , i 'm not picking up any strong hop scent although there is a very slight presence so i do n't want to say there is no aroma .  pours a very thin light gold with a decent finger-width head on top . this `` head '' disappears quicker than i can even get my nose close to smell it .  the mouthfeel is hurt by excessive carbonation and fizziness .

the smell is nothing special , fair amount of malt no hops .  the head fell to absolutely nothing . the looks are this beer are very disappointing . pretty average summer ale , which i must admit is one of my least favorite types of seasonals .  i really dont like the mouthfeel . too similar to soda - fizzy , and almost gives you the `` burning '' sensation in your mouth , like a cheap light beer .

smells grainy and watery with a little butteriness in the backgroud .  just had this at a neighbors house , my choices of beers were either keystone light , or this . naturally i picked the micro , the smell was not a whole lot to write home about , just an average light malt beer with very little hoppiness . can not comment on color being that i had this out of the bottle , taste , not a whole lot going on , it tasted almost like toast bread ... and that was it .  it steals the flavor as the mouth is filled with bubbles rather than beer . the aroma was fantastic for this beer , the foamy mouthfeel highly reduces the overallness of this beer .

smell is a straight up gummi bears with virtually no real fruit smell to detect . there is a faint rind of something apricot like but it smells syrupy and chemically . i could have another i suppose but not to crazy about the smell and look on this one .  pours very light amber below a wimpy white head .  downhill now . i may taste a little of the hazelnut here , but no chocolate or anything like that . watery and unpleasant . this wound up drain pour very quickly.. i usually love the sam smith stuff but i just did n't like this one at all .

a : pours a slightly cloudy orange color , small white head , good lacing down the glass s : really not much here , very faint scent of hops t : slight malt followed by harsh bitterness of chinook hops .  this one pours a very transparent slightly golden yellow . blah . this would be a good lawnmower beer on a very hot day , very cold .  very little carbonation , making it pretty watery .

the aroma i get is a very light malt , grainy smell with hints of fruit which are detectable as cranberry only because it says it in the name of the beer . there is some very faint tartness to the smell , but otherwise it reminded me almost of their sam adams light at first whiff .  light straw yellow in color with a small white head that goes away quickly .  mouthfeel is extremely watery with almost no carbonation .

sweet grainy nose .  this is a very watered down tasting beer with high carbonation . there really is n't much difference than this and coors . i had a few `` skunked '' keystone lights and they actually had some characteristics mixed with added aluminum flavor . if you drink this beer enough you begin to pick up hints of banana hiding behind all the carbonation . a very easy beer to drink largs amounts of when you are in college .  not a bad tasting beer , though the carbonation is a bit low . body is n't inappropriate for the style , but something this thin added to the low carbonation ... it was a letdown .

smells of pine - like straight up pine needles from a tree - and an odd , musk-like smell . not much else here , and it 's bad . between the pine tree smell and the `` offness '' of the taste ... i just did n't enjoy it .  has a thin head which goes away quickly and leaves non discernable lacing . not anything special .  like allagash 's hugh malone , in the epic hopulent , you have a beer that 's so hollow and so devoid of body and character that the hoppiness of it starts working against you .

very subdued and disappointing . t - dark roasted malt , coffee , and a bit of chocolate provide the `` black '' , and orange peel and pine resin hops provide the `` ipa '' .  appearance : opaque brown . very ugly .  mouthfeel : light , thin , with an oddly drying and unpleasantly long-lasting finish .
aroma was barely there which was disappointing as the aroma is one of my favorite parts of trying a new ipa .  almost zero head , despite a vigouros pour .  very thin .

smells like a cheap malt liquor .  1 inch head reduces to a thin bubbly layer with a golden straw color . i do believe this is the frist time i 've drunk this in a glass and it is much better than i thought it would be .  m - thin and watery , and a bit of a disappointment in this category .

aroma is malty , not what i would expect from an ipa . very little hope presence in the aroma . flavor consisted of a strong malt presence , good bitterness , but disappointing lack of fresh hop taste .  660ml bottle a- very pale unattractive gold . one finger head , shows some decent retention until the first sip ; then it disappears completely , leaving no lacing s- crisp grassy hops , maybe a hint of lemon .  m - creamy , harsh from carbonation and the finish .

the aroma is a little bit of malt and a lot of grain ( like an industrial lager ) .  this beer pours with a very , very pale lemon yellow body topped by a thin to medium thick white head with some lacing .  feel is remarkably thin , but lots of flavour - raisins , molasses , peaches , prunes , cake mix , rotten apples , burnt sugar .

a - small white head , copper/orange/red color , clear , not a bad looking beer s - mostly malt and hops , i ca n't detect any other notes , plain .  this was a pretty mixed review ... .the appearance was terrible ... no head and certainly no lacing and i could n't pick up much from the nose .  light bodied with a thin texture .

nothing much happening on my nose , very faint leafy hops scent . a golden amber cloud in my glass .  if only it could produce a head and not mere whisps of lace , this could be a pretty beer . in this one , you will need to take the bad ( lack of foam and lace , undercarbonation ) to be rewarded with the good ( aroma and taste ) .  flavor is like a fizzy lager , but i 'll be objective for the style . this beer is close to water , and i might only have it on the hottest day to refresh myself . there needs to be a bit more balance as the grains are a little bit offputting in this beer . this beer is just too boring and plain and the little flavor it hasn is n't too great .

smell is funky , kind of an old sock smell mixing in with some ipa piney bitterness .  had last nite in bottle . crappy metallic american macro-crap aftertaste . i couldnt really figure this beer out ... its lighter than traditional yuengling , and doesnt taste as good , but for some reason i pounded a 6-pack before i knew they were gone !  m - w a t e r y .

the smell was somewhat weak , sweet brown sugar and some hints of roasted and caramelized malts . i thought i smelled some dough in there .  old milwaukee na pours a very light straw color with a thick fluffy white head .  mouthfeel is very thin and the taste is a little bitter and super dry .

a- light yellow appearance . s- not a fan ... but i 'm not a huge fan of standard pbr smell . even with low alcohol it seems to have a strong alcohol scent . t- not too far off from standard pbr ... quite good for a light beer .  pours a pale golden colour , a little deeper orange in the thicker bits , with a very poor filmy ring of foam around the edges . not great . froths up a bit when it 's swirled , but it 's not a particularly good look all up .  looks deep brown , reddish around the fringes , small head that does n't last , vague smell of semi-toasted caramel malt , taste is pretty much exactly the same , slightly too thin a body for my liking , but other than that , it 's pretty good .

s : i 'm not really picking up a lot here . light malts , a bit of caramel . i 'm was hoping for more everything ; carbonation , taste , smell .  appearance : the alaskan ipa pours an extremely clear , almost disturbingly clear , pale yellow color . it looks more like an adjunct lager than an ipa . it dissipates very quickly though and without much lacing .  mouthfeel is bud . ok so this is n't oe 800 but it is bad !
smell is virtually non-existent with only a lingering sweetness .  pours out horrible ... very cloudy and a strange color resembling some nasty energy drink .  mouthfeel gets too flat sometimes .

aroma : hardly any at all . total lack of aroma really hurts this one , especially against the substantial ( for the style ) body .  it 's like they realized they were going downhill and foisted them off at ( relatively ) cheap prices . there was no carbonation or head whatsoever . in terms of the taste and mouthfeel , it 's very much like drinking a coke that you left sitting out on the counter a week ago .  mouthfeel : very thin , maybe one of the thinnest beers i have ever tasted .

roasted malts . not much . certainly nothing in the way of bourbon . it 's odd : though this stout is ostensibly -bal aged i 've only thought to address that element twice , once in the aroma and once now - needless to say the bourbon factor is minor to the point of being undetectable .  tsingtao pours a light yellow with a white head from a green twelve ounce bottle .  stiff carbonation , tacky , very acidic .

s : malt roastedness is sweet and musty . rather unpleasant wet cardboard smell .  a - ruby pour with little to no head . not the best looking beer i 've come across .  finish is a great big wallop of diacetyl ... m- thin , undercarbonated d- i likely wo n't finish the bottle .

i have always found most canadian macro beers to have that skunky smell and taste and every now and then they come off very satisfying .  12 fl oz bottle served in a snifter , reviewed live : a - pours a transparent straw golden color with a thin 1 finger head ( even after an aggressive pour ) . retention is awful .  it 's thin in the mouth ; a little watery and a little metallic . it 's lightly flavored . it 's a little resiny and it tastes like wheat .

smell is minimal and nothing special . taste was pretty good for a macro swill . an almost average macro lager and better than most that i 've tried .  a : pale yellow , almost no head of foam ; s : predominantly corn with a lot of carbonation ; t : sweet malt and lot of corn ; m : refreshing and bittersweet , slightly sour end , medium body and excesive carbonation ; d : i liked the first , second and third but the fourth no , i would't buy it again .  a-thick tan head , dark brown/garnet body s-smoky and malty , biscuit t-smoky front , some toffee , light hop finish m-very thin d-the mouthfeel really throws me off .
it smelled lemon citrusy . it tastes better than it looks and smells .  pours a somewhat brownish gold . very little carbonation .  carbonation is absent .

smells sweet , but very sulfur like .  to be honest i only had one bottle ... the color was murky for sure ... a murky yellow/orange ... not what i expected from an ipa . half way though the glass i noticed what i thought i left in the bottle ... floating sediment .  very little carbonation like a guiness .

the smell is of corn and the appearance of highly sedimented urine .  it 's your typical macro color , typical macro smell .  my main complaint though , it 's filtered to death and not bottle conditioned ... .just tastes dead , which leads to a poor mouth feel as well .

smells are a low point too . you have some wheat and yeasts smells ... not the citrus of the belgian ... on the other hand , taste is quite enjoyable ... it gets closer to it than expected .  a medium sized white head with fine sized bubbles.the body was carbonated and slightly hazy.the hue of this beer was a pale yellow and it left only a fair amount of lacing on the sides of my glass.the nose was malty and somewhat fruity.the flavor was bitter , sweet and it left an aftertaste that lingered.the mouthfeel was smooth and thin.this beer lacks character as nothing really stood out with this beer .  mouthfeel : light-bodied with a pretty boring finish . kinda watery .

nose : as soon as i took a whiff , i was disappointed . very citrusy , almost spice-like .  on tap at on photon ... clear darkish gold , an off white head with good retention ... the aroma is horrendous , eucalyptus , medicine , lotion , just garbage , makes me want to gag and not even want to taste .  mouthfeel is very weak and watery , however , leaving me quite disappointed .

straw coloring but almost no aroma . the flavor is n't too impressive for the style , but i was surprised that i did n't detect the level of alcohol present .  a : 1 '' foamy white head that fell to a collar with thin lacing everywhere .  m-low carbonation with a dry finish . very watery .
aroma is a very , very faint corn .  poured into a 12oz glass forming a nice yet shortlived head over a light honey colored body with lots of carbonation evident .  mouthfeel : quite watery .

aroma : metallic notes , something like the odor of rust dominate the aroma . there is also a musty , stale note to the aroma .  clear red-brown with a good frothy lasting head and lacing which coats the glass .  m : really thin , and the major letdown for this beer .

smell : aroma of a bit of hay , and ( i 'm sorry to say ) skunk . does n't look or smell very appetizing , and it is too sweet and viscous with hardly anything else going for it .  looks good , nice soft golden color , tall cap with lacing , looks desireable .  club soda feel at first that peters out to a watery fruit juice feel . one dimensional raspberry flavor , modeled after lindemans and st. louis sweetened lambic sodas .
smell - aroma of macro lager , smelled like it was right out of the can .  pours an ink black with a tiny dark tan head .  simply too light in body for the style .

clever jug and label which holds a rather boring brew . the flavor is enjoyable but not at all robust . i 'm sure most people ca n't resist picking up a jug but the novelty soon wears off .  pours almost black with a thick tan head that is well maintained .  m : way too watery , thin bodied .

smells of sour beer , really skunky , not good at all .  a : nice clear golden color . great looking head at first that dissipated faster than expected .  mouthfeel : thin and watery . carbonation is also pretty low . drinkability : low alcohol and thin body make this beer easy to drink , but there are certainly better porters out there .

smell : not really much going on here . something kinda grainy at most .  appearance- beer is a lightly clouded golden with a finger and a half of head that quickly subsides in large bubbles to a film across the top with clinging lace on the sides .  mouthfeel - thin and under-carbonated .

s - bland . was expecting to be smacked in the nose with berries , but nothing . really had to dig in to get a scent of tart strawberry .  12 oz bottle with a freshness date a - slightly hazy golden yellow pour with a thick white head . good retention , with a slippery lace s - nose is heavy with green apples , and almost sickly , sugary sweetness ... it 's downright funky ( like rotten fruit ) in the background and rather off-putting if you breath in deeply ... is it from the yeast ?  the palate is thin .

beer smells like nothing -- well it 's a little malty .  i got a little better than a finger of fizzy bone-white head that seemed to be falling as fast as i could pour , ending with a bunch of wisps . color was a deep golden-yellow with ne-quality clarity . in fact , this kind of thing is the gold standard for clarity . i imagine that if you took a bag of sugar and stirred it into a liquid medium until it became saturated , this would be what it would taste like .  mouth is lighter bodied with absolute zero carbonation .

i drink busch with my biker-family buddies , and with my best friend , especially when money is tight . busch is n't a beer i crave , but anyone with hair on their chest can get it down , it just tastes like milwaukee 's best or bud light .  a-dark garnet body , clear ; oatmeal/porridge head s-light smoked smell , some cocoa t-chocolate , some smoke , somewhat ashy m-medium to thin d-too thin tasting for the style .  disappointing body -- too light and thin .
very weak smell , some bitter roasted notes come through on the nose .  burning witches ... ha ha ! looks like your basic pale ale on this one .  this is a very thin beer , very watery .

very light hops and a little grain aroma .  pours a nice clean , pristine white head . again very clean and clear in the glass with gold to amber hues .  mouthfeel is super thin , like off-puttingly thin .

s - honestly , it smells like some of the better macros .  12oz bottle poured into my narke tulip ... a dark but clear copper , lots of light tope head , good retention and lacing ... at first the aroma is really nice and sweet but then the alcohol comes through , too strong so it starts to turn me off ... the taste takes the aroma to a new level , all piney alcohol and incredibly strong , i almost gagged my first sip .  the palate is thin and the aftertaste bitter and tinny but not very citrusy or piney .

there is no aroma . i think i 'd only use less than 2.0 rating for something that actively smelled wrong . i understand the intent of a wheat beer , but i do n't find it in any remarkable way here .  the appearance is fine ; the rich black/brown you can not see through .  the body to is next to non existance ... so what this is the best water i have ever tried , and a easy guzzler , deserves a higher ranking then it has .

little aroma , not much head .  in terms of appearance , it 's dark brown with lighter highlights and no head .  hops , malt , yeast , nothing , but there 's lots of water in it . kind of a weird aftertaste and mouthfeel to it , i have no idea what it is , other than not pleasant for the most part . very cheap , hence , drinkable .

s- sour fruit aroma .  appearance : pours a clear dark chestnut color with a very stiff looking 1/8 head of tannish foam .  m : light , in all aspects , but somehow sticky - from the carbonation , or the tart of sour lemon candy flavours . the traditional flavours are there , but it seems watered down , and the mouthfeel is kind of nasty .

s : a very odd sulfur aroma hits me first that really detracts for me .  best before 06/07 outside of the standard looking fizzy yellow beer , its got great head retention .  the mouthfeel is rather thin and watery , seeming unsuited to the style . overall , the dark chocolate flavours are pleasant , and a welcome change from the cadbury 's dairy milk flavours of young 's which i am more familiar with , but it is not a particulalry good stout , lacking body .

s-grain like , yeasty , even a bit earthy t-like triple filtered labatt . corn in there .  appearance- decent sized 1.5 finger head with a rich amber/gold orange colour . no lacing whatsoever .  almost flat .

the beer has a somewhat unpleasant funky barnyard smell with some fruit in the background .  served in a pint glass , the beer pours a clear gold color with a huge 2 inch frothy white head . head retention is average , lacing is good .  m : medium in body , but very flat .

basically smell like a wheat beer . nothing really special there .  quite dark with gorgeous dark ruby highlights . thin , very light tan head that thins quickly to a collar , but produces some lacing .  the body is way too light and this beer could use a little higher mash temperature .

aroma was corn , malt , sweet .  when it came to me , it had a 1-inch creamy head with a hazy dark gold color .  m heavy on the tongue . sweet mellows to a balance of sour and bitter aftertaste ; almost no carbonation .

there was a complete absence of aroma . the taste was that of `` purple .  a : the pour is just about black with a tan head on it . s : chocolate and bourbon all the way on this one , and way too much bourbon .  mouthfeel was pretty poor to the point where it felt like i was drinking water .

no surprise it lacked flare or excitement but a tolerable boring beer . appearance : pours a clear bronze brown color with a small quick fading head and little notable lacing . smell : bad . i was prepared for the worst when it got to the taste but it does taste better than it smells . it is a grainy corn husk aroma followed by the artificial sweetener and dextrinous malt attribute and some metallic character . taste : the taste was a relief after smelling this thing . hope this is helpful .  pours a midnight black with limited red hues around the edges . not really much light coming through when held to the light . a nice off tan colored head with good retention , though slips to the side of the glass , and limited lacing .  m : watery , low carbonation , slick .

smell is faint but of grain , corn and some hops .  appearance - large , attractive head with less than average retention time . this beer is unfiltered , which gives it a wonderful hazy goldenrod coloring .  m - watery and dry .

it begins with a strange vanilla-cream aroma that thankfully fades early .  a almost opaque in color , with a tan , fairly thick head , and sticky lace .  taste and mouthfeel - at first i thought the sparkling name was a misnomer however after a few swallows you definitely notice the carbonation . drinkability - definitely a drinkable beer but rather unremarkable other than the carbonation .
scanty aroma is crisp and malty , not impressive .  the beer looks nice , with a somewhat normal head .  m/d : a much lighter body than i was expecting . thin , watery , and almost under carbonated .

some bready grains are on the nose with a skunky aroma mixing things a bit . other than that there 's a faint hint of some hops .  a golden bronze color with a good head .  the mouthfeel suffers as that annoying metallic twinge magnifies the less than ample body .
not much smell i can pick up . has a decent moutfeel , pretty smooth actually .  it was a deep brown-red-black color with a thin creamy head .  the mouthfeel is very unstout like .

this beer was virtually odorless - perhaps the result of the bar setting .  there is some strange haze just below the head of this beer that looks like a yeast cloud of some sort . head is a solid three to four fingers which has much staying power , and has a somewhat soap quality .  the carbonation levels and mouthfeel are pretty poor , as it 's a bit watery and leaves nothing to remember it by as far as aftertaste goes .

i have to say - i 'm pretty disappointed .  a - nice dark brown color . not a great head , but a good one finger that hangs around some . nice lacing .  both of these co-mingle into the aftertaste m : light bodied with too much carbonation o : this is a great dessert beer that manages to mimmic apple pie with the spices and apples and is easy to drink , but as a stand-alone `` pale wheat ale , '' this one is way off the mark .

pours a pleasant-looking bright light amber with a pretty good sized foam head . not a ipa . some dark notes .  it poured a very nice red hued brown with a quickly dissipating tan head .  just too thin for style all around .

the lack of any discernible aroma is disappointing . nothing here to hold your interest during a focused session with more complex beers , but with the low abv and great thirst-quenching quality i 'll be happy to load plenty of these in my cooler for the next hot august barn raising .  pours a dark brown color with some ruby clarity through the body . a thin khaki head appears care of a violent pour that produces a scant amount of large bubbles .  the beer is straw yellow no retention tastes skunked thin mouthfeel but very drinkable did 22 cans in one night .

smell : had a sour smell with a hint of cocoa malt . not impressed .  presentation : 660ml brown glass bottle , 7,8 abv appearance : golden and a good neck of foam . maybe too dark for a pale ale .  mouthfeel carbonation is very low for the style almost feels flat on the tongue .

lots of lacing , to be found here ... s - coffee , chocolate , and a sour milk scent , followed by the fairly pungent smell of feet .  looks great with a big pure white fizzy head but the flavours seem to be a fairly dull lager interpretation .  almost no mouthfeel whatsoever . this beer needs more body to be truly drinkable . too damn thin .

it 's like a weird , extremely astringent gasoline or magic marker smell with a chemically smoke overtone . but , the smell is just too much for me to consider drinking more than the two i bought already .  negra modelo looks pretty good in the glass , being a reddish-amber with tan foam .  m : harsh , with very little carbonation to tone it down .

aroma is not present , but i 've never been able to pick anything up from a kolsch , or 'golden ale ' , or whatever this is . this is about as 'session ' as a beer can get , and if i were a native to colorado , this would be my grain belt primo , the light beer i drink when i want something light and easy to drink .  a . large tan head that dissipates into a thin foam .  i was very disappointed when drinking this beer , much much too thin , almost watery thin mouthfeel , really bad when it 's supposed to be a stout .

i got carbolic soap mixed in with the yeast when i put my nose to it , not a good aroma to me . full on alcohol taste and more lagerish than a normal belgian ale .  mine tasted like a porter , that was filtered through burnt wood and smoked salmon , no joke .  the mouthfeel is just strange . fizzy simple beer , over carbonated , but not terribly unpleasant .

s - not much of anything really . definitely no hops . mostly a musty , almost indistinguishable malt and grain mix .  a- almost black , just a shade under . tons of small bubbles , 3 '' head into a tulip with a very easy pour .  m - i found it very thin and watery , very surprising for a porter .

the aroma is nothing special , faint chocolate and hops .  appearance : pours matte dark brown with slight honey red folds and a 1 finger mocha crown that shows lots of retention and lace .  mouthfeel was a huge letdown . no carbonation ( not that it was expected ) , and quite thin . despite the thick appearance , mouthfeel is surprisingly thin which feels strange considering the bold flavors .

the smell is boring . slightly bready and slightly skunky , but generally faint .  beautiful brassy amber . 1/2 inch head quickly dissipates to thin and incomplete cap .  the carbonation is a tad low . i think the lack of carbonation in this beer causes a thin mouthfeel .
