smell : there 's a sweet smell and that 's about it . taste : slight sweetness upfront with a decent hoppy finish .  pours a dark ruby-red color with a one-finger head into my glass . nice hue here .  mouthfeel : disappointing here . feels thin and kind of watery with agressive carbonation that does not serve the beer well .

smells like harsh alcohol , faint grapes , and almost malt liquorish .  the color is a good ale color , the head is just right , but it 's just so bitter .  poured into an imperial nonic a dull brass color with a thin quick to fade soapy-like head atop , aromas are very tame , i picked up some light toast , sweet biscuit , and very faint herbal hops.the feel of this beer was just a mess , sharp and thin the beer was made extremely hard to finish , the beer never mellowed.toasted grain flavors with a ever so light smack of leafy hop in the finish.just a bad beer i wasnt expecting a world beater but a decent quaffing epa , it wasnt that by any stretch , dont spend the money on this it is not worth it .

s : sweet pale malts . some corn and grain sweetness . kind of skunky .  very excited to get home and open it , i was kind of disgusted to notice a thick , black sludge at the bottom of the bottle . i proceeded to examine the color ( black which leaves a residue of dark gold on the glass ) .  after a few sips , the burps from the fizzy carbonation began to set in .

a lightly clear gold , not much to look at ... the aroma is terrible , skunky , fake , as generic as it sounds .  poured with a giant , light brown , foamy , frothy , head and a little lace . color is a very dark , almost opaque black brown .  mouthfeel was super light and watery .

you have to rate steel for what it is , an 8.1 % lager that is widely available and can be purchased for a couple of bucks - 40oz - or $ 7 for a 12 pack . you ca n't compare it directly against expensive craft beers , they serve different purposes . you ca n't tell me that the a , s , t , m , d of a beer is the same regardless of what you paid for it . if a single 22oz bomber costs me $ 7 or more i know i 'm going to be rating it with different expectations in mind that include a justification of the cost .  here is the verdict : a : a nice deep ruby red / dark mahogany . a tan head that disappears quickly .  the body is thin , verging on watery , and the flavor has very little stick-to-it-iveness as a result .

smells bready , metallic , grassy , and grainy .  poured with little head and very dark color for the style ( other reviews said huge head ) .  mouthfeel - too much carbonation , it has a light feel but instantly foams up in the mouth .

s-i really ca n't smell anything , weird .  i was crystal clear and ruby orange . there was a creamy white head that gradually dissipated .  m : very thin mouthfeel , there is equal presence in hard-water tap-water .

smell is not impressive . bits of roasted malt and maybe some caramel hints , but the nose is rather faint as a whole .  ( bottle into mug ) it looks nice ! poured a deep black with a half finger light brown head that hung on for quite a while .  m : mouth feel is mostly burning and harsh . oily consistency with almost zero carbonation .

`` night in the woods '' tasting 3.29.08 thanks to dmeadows for sharing his 2006 bottle a- pours a perfect deep brown with some carbonation and a minimal white head a- there 's a very organic `` stable '' smell ( probably the peat ) along with whiskey . the combination of smells were very similar to my cat 's litter box & it was difficult to separate the smell from the tasting .  poured a dark amber with a fluffy head .  m : watery , very high carbonation levels , almost unpleasantly active .

this beer was fairly bland and slightly watery , no real aroma . i consider 7 % abv quite strong but the beer hides this very well , i was expecting a drain cleaner for taste but it 's a very drinkable lager just do n't expect too much taste ( hops/malt etc ) . blandish macro , was a good price , would buy again .  pours a hazy orange , topped with a three finger small bubbled white head , well carbonated . leaves thin webs of lacing .  mouthfeel : with the chili it felt fuller than it was . the beer definitely is a very light and almost watery . it has a light taste much like a corona or dos equis .

very faint odor , there 's very little here at all .  i love dogfish head beers and am making a trip to the brewery in the coming weeks , me and my friend buy up any varieties we come across in distributors because we love dfh so much . that being said , this beer to me was undrinkable , expecting a fruit bomb , it was more like a straight alcohol taste , with a slight hint of raspberries , it was the definiton of `` too much '' , although i know alot of time and effort was put into this beer , i will never buy it again , put it this way , it was so bad i dumped it down the drain after about 5 minutes .  m : too light-bodied for me even in a wheat , the flavours dissipate too fast , thin finish .

a : straw yellow with about half an inch of head . s : the faintest smell of wheat beer but not much else . disappointing . t : a smooth , but somewhat tasteless wheat beer .  a : light golden with good head retention and medium lacing .  watery . mild . not much other than the head and lace . almost no character . what finish ? go elsewhere if possible .

smells like cheap adjuct hops , and even some adjuct grains . nice hops , and some good malt to balance , but nothing very impressive .  poured a medium amber color with an explosive white head that settles into a good thick finger that lingers on well after the pour .  thin and weak to the palate gives this beer a poor mouthfeel .

aroma - nothing really . after it settles there is a faint trace of grain and/or citrus .  appearance : clear , dark maroon , steady flow of carbonation from the depths . big head at first , fades and leaves a little lace , a little off-white head .  mouthfeel is syrupy , disappointing i guess as it was the only below average characteristic .

smell : straight northwestern hops . the type from which you can smell the bitterness , and i dislike a bitter nose . as it warms a slight biscuity malt scent pokes through .  hard pour gave a 1 1/2 finger white head that died down almost as soon as it came .  m : thin and fizzy .

as it warms i catch a little bit of fruitiness but a grainy scent still owns the smell . taste : much more appealing than the smell . the grains from the smell do transfer over to the taste . much better than any macro , however it does remind me of an adjunct lager , which i guess is expected given the description of the style .  i 'm saying this after drinking duvel and la fin du monde and leffe and other top notch beers this whole week so my pallet may be a little off , but i 'm not enjoying this beer at all .  thin and lackadaisical inside of the mouth . totally weak and completely boring .

i do n't get much for smell . a little malt but i have to work at it .  poured glass , nice pale color yellow orange .  375ml bottle poured into tulip april1 2011 a hazy amber with loads of suspended particles and very few bubbles , short lived thin film leaves no lace as expected with this alc % s booze with a little fruity aspect and some earthy tones , fairly intense but lacking the bourbon barrel other then a little sweet oak t not far from the smell but the booze comes off a little harsh , maybe a little vanilla and toffee on top of what i smell m thick and flat with a booze burn that i could live without o not drinking that well fresh , it 's just a little harsh . i understand its 19.1 % but still it feels like i 'm drinking a straight liqueur both in feel and effect out of curiosity i plan on aging a few of these for a decade or so , i could see this doing fairly well if the booze was toned down .

aroma : what smell ? honestly i could not detect any discernable aroma whatsoever .  a : pours a deep , slightly translucent red , yielding about 2 fingers worth of off white head that recedes into a film of bubbles .  first sip reveals a thin watery body with mild carbonation .

s : there is some tartness to the nose and quite a lot of oak . but there 's just an awful aroma of sawdust and low quality soy/veggie hot dogs that is extremely off-putting .  this beer has an overpowering apple sourness to it , and it completely surprised me , i thought i had a bottle that had gone bad .  m - thin soda pop feel .

very pale beer that seems to be somewhere between pbr and heineken to me . it has a grainy smell with a bit of skunk , and the light adjunct/corn sweetness that i find not unpleasant .  bottle : poured a white/yellow color slightly hazy beer with a quite large foamy white head with good retention .  not bad flavors , and not a bad combination , but it tastes way watered down and light , especially for a 6.5 % abv . mouthfeel : light ... too light drinkability : high conclusion : good ?
s - initial hit of skunk . a little grassy hop and skunk it taking a while to clear .  poured amber with white head .  thin mouthfeel . does n't have the body to be even an average amber/ale .
typical pale malt aroma , slightly skunky and vegetable . pale flavor , fairly clean .  it looked really good , clear gold pour witha frothy white head and solid lacing .  the palate is thin .

the smell is very small , if anything it seems a bit alcohalic .  left a foamy one finger head that had some good retention , but not much lacing . body was a hazy orange-amber .  t-some thin bread-like malt flavor , followed by a pleasant sour-ish orange/pineapple/banana , which is on style . m-the mouthfeel is thin . thin malt , and not nearly carbonated enough for style .

goes great with pickled eggs , hot peppers , pretzel sticks , and peanuts . ) and is a deep rich molasses s : once again , may have been too cold for phenols to waft up t : slightly sweet really tasty m : nice and cold d : pour me another  a good color for a dopplebock . pours with a good amount of foam and leaves some lace .  thin , overcarbonated , and hot with fusel alcohols . scores : appearance 4/5 ; aroma 4.5/5 ; taste 3/5 ; mouthfeel 2 ; drinkability 2/5
i expected some watermelon in the nose , but did n't get any . weak .  a : pours a reddish brown . very nice carb levels .  mouthfeel is sharp and overcarbonated . much too thin , as well .

i figured i 'd try something new while watching the celtics/lakers game , so i bought a sixer of old milwaukee . t-sweet corn , a little malt , and a little bit of alcohol .  looks like kilkenny , creamy head , pretty much the same deep amber red colour .  the texture is a disappointment , with a thin , light fizzyness that does n't match the rich malty flavors . overall , this beer was complex and enjoyable , but the weak body really deflated the flavors , leaving me wanting for something more substantial .

i could n't really detect a smell at all . i passed it around the table and the conclusion is that it has no odor .  okay , its pretty enough to look at . the color is of dark autumn a sort of reddish brown with some haze .  m- the mouthfeel is very faintly carbonated and watery .

some soapy notes , sharp yeast , and bready malts . where are the hops ? t - taste is again pretty malt-forward , with the fruity yeast evoking apples and berries .  the beer poured nicely with a decent white head that left signs of lacing , the beer itself a straw-gold with a slight haze .  mouthfeel was that of a club soda or somehting .

it smells like the ambient air in the room i am in -- traces of my cat mixed with cooked onion wafting in from the kitchen to remind me i need to clean up after the chili i made earlier . if i sniff really hard i get laundry detergent from the shirt i am wearing ( it 's not even clean ) . the flavors of a really good beer are there , they just seem really watered down .  poured a tallcan into a mug appearance - well , this beer is nice looking ... red-amber colour , chunky head that leaves a nice lace ... looks can be deceiving .  cloying sweet & way too thick for my taste . it tasted more like a thick tart wine than a beer - carbonation , where are you ?

it smells pretty gross , though typical for this kind of beverage , i havnt even drank down to the top of the label and im already feeling woozy .  trying the anker stout , a can that i brought back from a trip to jakarta . the beer pours a dark opaque color with thin ecru head that is leaving spotty lacing .  aromas come through but are trumped by a tangy , thin , watery mouthfeel .

winey , solvent like almost with some grassy and grainy aromas in there . but i got some catty aromas and the dreaded dms . bottom line : it smells bad but does n't taste bad .  in the glass , this 'all natural dubbel dark beer ' looked like a champ . a rich-looking , cloudy brown , it produced an off-white head of foam that lasted until the last drop , leaving plenty of lacing to coat the inside of my tripel karmeliet glass .  otherwise it is little better than your standard euro pale lager - a little dry and watery . limp mouthfeel , drinkability would be quite good , but it just is n't that good a beer .

s : some bitter roasty malts and very faint sour cherries are the good smells . unfortunately , there is also a strong smell of rubbing alcohol . there were elements here that i really liked , but the smell was a turnoff for me .  semi-transparent amber with a thick frothy head that quickly falls to about a finger and holds there .  m : thin , watery , not very fulfilling .

smell : a very odd smelling ris . i hope this isnt infected .  poured into a mug with a moderate amber body and a fluffy off white head .  mouthfeel was thin and watery and the flavor never did quite live up to the promise of the nose .

a bit of corn and something a little off- like bo .  the crack & glug was a stunning success , netting better than two fingers ' worth of foamy bone-white head with good retention . it makes me think of the bad old days , sitting in smoky bars , drinking cheap draft beers , getting into bar fights , picking up loose women ... well , that last bit was n't too bad , but some of them were improved by copious amounts of cheap draft beers . color was a pale lemon-yellow with ne-quality clarity .  the body is thin and the carb a bit distractingly spritzy , even masking the flavor a bit .
aroma ? nope .  a : an inch or more of silky , tight head that is not going away . seems pretty dark but the light is low .  mouthfeel is watered down . a little too much carbonation bite too .

the aroma of this bottle is an abomination . smells like a vanilla butter chardonnay cake . artificial and gross . flavor attempts to recover from the aroma and is n't quite as vomitous .  poured into the branded glass it comes with . effervescent straw gold and capped by a fluffy white head . head is well retained and leaves behind a decent lace as it dissipates .  very thin body , low carbonation .

this is a happoshu with less than 25 % malt content . pure white head , transparent yellow body , corn aroma . sweet juicey grain flavor .  pours clear yellow with a big white head .  thin and wet bodied . while it looks like i enjoyed this somewhat more than the others that have reviewed it , its still kind of got that leinie 's thing going on .

there was very little aroma at all .  this beer poured a nice sparkling amber with abundant white head , which is packed loosely and is sticky , leaving some lacing .  m-light and actually thin , needs more malt heft to have it fit to style , imho .

there were light and soft malt smells , with very faint hints of hops at the end .  this one pours out a nice amber-brown body . tan head lasts a while . it looks the part . very little to speak of on the nose .  mouthfeel was thin and flat , although somewhat smooth .

the aroma is spicy/musty with some grain , odd . in fact , with its syrupy , spritzy and background splash of citrus character it reminds me of those shirley temple cocktail drinks i used to order as a kid .  look : pours an golden-yellow colour with a large head , leaving a nice lacing .  2.0 m : this is one of the oddest and unpleasant mouthfeels i 've had . far too much carbonation and a bone dry finish .

a very sugary cherry ( versus tart or subdued ) aroma . my wife said it smells and tastes like faygo , which is a local pop ( soda ) maker .  its a pale gold colour , and has a very dense head that really impresses . the complete lack of carbonation in the mouth is very unexpected considering what this looks like during the pour .  the body is thin .

do not buy this beer because its a quality german pilsener . i do buy this beer because i want to drink heavily or for its simple lawnmower qualities .  pretty decent head with a nice amount of foam .  m - felt watery and thin .

all i can smell is a touch of bready yeast . t : off-dry with notes of molasses , chocolate , and sourdough bread . not enough aroma , too thin , too much carbonation .  appearance is good .  mouthfeel is fizzy skunk .

the nose is all vinegar , having a hard time smelling anything else , its actully so intense its off putting . i love sours and i 'm actually thinking this is a bad keg ( based on the bottle version i had a year ago . ) taste is uber sweet , no sour notes detected and i 'm bummed .  appearance : gold with a red tint and a nice white foamy head .  pretty thin mouthfeel , super easy to drink , and cheap enough that it is n't associated with the hipster ironic drinking revival .

it smells like mickey 's malt liquor .  pours a cloudy orange with a large craggy slightly off-white head that surprisingly does n't stick much but does hang around a while .  m : too astringent d : nice mixed beer , and more beer like than most mixed beers .

sweet , mallty . little to no aroma .  yellow cloudy color .  m - this is where this ale suffers . there is not nearly enough carbonation which makes this way too thin for any ale , let alone a wee heavy .

scent is faint sweet ( six-row ? ) malt , with a husky grain back to it .  poured into tulip . a - pours a brownish/slightly red , off-white frothy head , some spotty lacing and a thin cap on top .  there was carbonation observed and the body was a pale yellow . the taste of this brew was fizzy and tingly which is not much to my liking when it comes to taste . even if i really , really liked this brew , i would still say that it is way overpriced .

a very weak odor and not that pleasant .  i 've seen a few other reviews of this beer talking about a butterscotch taste . i like the fact these guys do lagers and i 've had their dunkel on before , pretty good . tasted their stuff at gabf just last week but that was around 4pm ... everything was starting to merge at that point .  m : i 'm somewhat certain that the poor mouthfeel here really damages what could otherwise be an interesting beer.medium bodied with lightish carbonation , yet overall the mouthfeel falls falt and is a bit cumbersome .

aroma is copper coins with honey , and tiny tinges of lemon and skunk .  a- nice color obviously it 's going to be crystal clear . lots of fizz and foam . you get just as drunk off two big cans of high life and it 's not nearly as toxic .  m : very thin and watered down .

smell : citrus , but an unappealing wet cardboard smell also . looks fine , smells mediocre , tastes ok .  it pours a clear , light , brownish-orange , a little darker than most american ipas -- a decent looking beer . a heavy pour only got me about 1/4 to 1/2 '' on the head . it has a funk to it like it is starting to turn sour and unfortunately , this carries over to the taste . but i 'm guessing there will be 4 of these left for my nephews when they come to visit this summer , indiscriminately drinking any and all beer in the fridge .  body is only about medium or medium light with pretty much no carbonation ... making it feel watered down .

s - smells of sulfur , a bit skunky , bread malts , and grain . not very good at all here .  a dark , yet thin appearance , dark brown , cream off beige head , ample . great cascade effect going on , almost a 5 except for the watery appearance .  thin watery mouth feel .

s- the grainy bready smell smells almost skunky . the skunky smell did n't transfer to the taste .  in the glass this is a clear reddish brown beer with a decent tannish brown head .  too much carbonation , body is lacking .
bland aroma with sweet malt notes and faint floral hops .  a - rich copper color , small head that quickly faded .  the mouthfeel is thin and reedy , with some small moments of tacky pastiness .

the beer didnt really have that much of a smell to it .  pours an attractive reddish amber , opaque with a chilled haze , forming a fluffy , wispy head .  mouthfeel - surprisingly light given its relatively strong flavor . watery and tongue-stingingly carbonated .

the aroma was putrid , with a bitter , almost sour smell mixed in with sweetness for just an unpleasant odor .  pours a dark amber color with golden orange edges and a two finger frothy , off-white head that slowly settles into a lasting ring . sporadic spots of lacing left behind .  the body is quite thin ( below average ) .

uh-oh ... butterscoch in the aroma , along with cane sugar . full-on corn and grain flavor with metallic undertones . luckily , diacetyl hinted at in nose was not present in mouth .  dark , murky brown , with amber edges ; crowned with a creamy beige head with nice lacing and stick .  mouthfeel is flat and lifeless without carbonation .

the color is a pleasing red-orange but there is almost no aroma at all .  2011 poured into pint glass appearance-shades of brown and golden yellow . 2 finger white head with nice retention .  unfortunately , the texture is limp and lifeless , with little crispness or hop bite in the aftertaste . far too watery to be satisfying , and too impotent to be refreshing .

the nose is noticeably oaky but lacks any beer descriptors . a mostly woody aroma with some off whiskey notes . some noticeable esters , plums , cherrys and figs . no real malt notes though .  it looks good , a hazy red-orange with an off white head .  m- incredibly thin body with higher than expected carbonation .

the smell of malt is very evident , not much of hop aroma .  pours to a golden orange , with thin off-white head , and good lacing .  light carbonation and light bodied . flavor is sweet that wants to be a milk stout , some caramel and almost a watery finish .

no detectable smell .  sadly i had the same impression again but managed to drink 2/3rds of the bottle this time . i 'm a big fan of kriek 's , especially lindemans but for some reason this one and i just do n't get along . serving type : 75cl champagne style bottle with crown cap and cork .  m- very watery !

it was my final selection in filling out a mix-your-six , and the `` blonde '' was much more prominent on the label than `` pale ale '' , thus the reason for my low expectations . it had the tint you 'd expect from a good pale ale , though not quite as opaque as i 'd have liked . s - there was not much in the way of smell from the beer , but it beat the macro brews .  poured from a bottle to a pint glass a nice dark orange color with a cream head that remained throughout .  m- watery . really thin .

s : slight spice notes up front followed by lots of chalky yeast aromas . there are some slight citrus aromas from the hops . there is also a strong oxidized aroma to it . i 've had a couple of bottles now and i 've found it in each of them . the strongly oxidized aroma is a bit of a turn-off , but it still tastes pretty decent .  a - pours golden with a 2 fingered white head . dissipates moderately and leaves nice lacing .  oily i guess , and kinda thin .

a : straw in color , and bordering on golden , this brew boasts decent lacing , but a weak head . s : bouquet is surprisingly faint , especially given the style . no hops , no malts , just a touch of smoke . t : smooth malty body is bready and light .  the appearance looks great ; a nice copper/dark brown with a thick one finger head that lasted the entire serving smell was okay , a little off what i expected , smelled a bit sweet and some caramel as well .  a : golden with a very thin head s : grainy , buttery almost , a sweet breakfast cereal t : watery , sweet with grainy flavors m : nonexistent , might as well be drinking water d : if you live in the twin cities and want a excellently drinkable barbecue or party beer that you can down gallons of this is the one .

s - there 's nothing here ! there 's the usual pilsner malts and hops , but it 's all so faint i can barely notice it . t - slightly better than the aromas , but still boring . sweet , grainy malts struggle to get through , with the floral hops barely noticeable .  ordered this on tap while having lunch at the red lobster . poured a clear dark amber with an off-white head .  carbonation is too high by far .
the aroma is light and gives off a faint smell of grain and cereal .  looks good . clear dark gold with a frothy white head .  a little too much roughness . feel is tacky , raw and sweet .

it 's potent and makes me think of something like cheap scotch mixed with an innocent pale ale .  pours hazy golden straw yellow with a big bubbling foamy white head , good retention .  very watery mouth-feel for the style .

the head did n't have the greatest smell , kind of reminded me of stale pbr as terrible as that sounds . moving on ... the first thing that i thought when i tasted this beer was whoa that 's sweet caramel .  large white fluffy head . plenty of carbonation . not the best retention but the lacing is very good .  not enough carbonation made me give a poor grade for the mouthfeel ... .needs more bubbles , man !

a - nice , clear , gold s - smelled a bit skunky to me .  this is cheap , and not much of a brew . it pours a nice light gold and actually has a nice head .  mouthfeel is a bit thin on this beer and i think it 's biggest downfall is it 's carbonation .

i think it was mackeson triple and smuttynose pale ale , and at the bars we drank pitchers , quickly . nothing really exciting in the smell . the flavor is malty with hints of cocoa . easy to drink , but could get boring .  a - poured a golden yellow / amber color with a decent two finger head .  feel : fizzy , fizzy , fizzy . way too overcarbonated .

then i smelled it . it smells bitterish kind of like a beligum beer , but not really . i 'm terrible at explaining scents , it just smelled off .  a good , persistent head .  body is about medium or so and it majorly lacks carbonation making it feel thinner than it short and maybe a sense of being watered down . the lack of carbonation really hurts it .

it 's like trying to get an odor from tap water .  appearance- beer pulls just dark enough brown to not be black with a two finger head of coffee with cream froth and lacing clings to the sides lightly .  mouthfeel is creamy and way too airy and carbonated which almost distracts the flavors out of your mouth before it hits your tongue .

s : grains and wet dog . t : very sweet probably a result of corn adjunct .  black in appearance , no surprises there ... with a solid tan head of foam ( about an inch ) that gradually reduces over time .  the body was medium/light and a little watery and oily .

bouquet is dead for an oatmeal stout , not much going here . nothing absolutely nothing .  poured a clear , light golden yellow with a fairly thick white head that retained well -- the visual aesthetics were definitely a strong suit .  mouthfeel was terrible . very thin and unusually high in carbonation .

nose was roasted dark malts , coffee , some chocolate but a strange smell that was almost like spoiled milk . i am not fond of the latter .  pours out a a golden orange color with a nice white head a finger high . dissipates slowly and ok lacing to the beer .  m : extremely syrupy and pretty flat .

there is almost no aroma though , some sweet malts but nothing else going on . a few sips of the sweet maltiness are quite enough for me .  this beer pours into the glass with a pale golden body topped by a thick white creamy head with a good amount of lacing left behind .  ) t - tart , light raspberry up front but kind of bland and tasteless on the finish ... reminds me of a raspberry spritzer with less flavor m - thin , light , almost flat and a little watery d - it certainly is easy to drink , but it 's something that i would only want on occasion notes : i can appreciate that balancing a fruit beer has to be difficult , but it seems like a lot of them fall short .

plunging my nose as far as possible into the glass , i can still say the beer does n't smell like much of anything .  this came from behind the bar as one of the cloudiest beers i 'd ever seen , with a nice straw sort of color and a think , foamy white head .  m : thin , thin , thin .

no aroma . almost banana flavored and not as sweet as feared .  pours a nice brown color with a short but kind of thick tan head that laces the glass a bit on the way down .  this beer pours a pale yellow hue with decent carbonation it doesnt have much of any smell at all apart from feint grainish notes , the taste is average and the mouthfeel is totally thin with no body at all , but in saying that this is definately my most favourite indian beer to have with a beautiful indian curry but apart from that leave it well alone unless its the only thing that can cool your thirst at the local curry takeaway .

really hard to get aroma of anything off this beer . very disappointing . maybe a tad of cocoa and molasses , but it 's faint . not a lot going on here some . nice chocolate malts .  i 'll have to try it again another time ... pours up a creamy fine bubbled head over deep copper brown beverage .  mf : too smooth and too wet .

scent does n't have too much going on ... somewhat reminds me of a dark mexican lager . i do detect some caramel malt , but that 's about it . i also get some bread characteristics with a bit of skunk ( which can be expected from such an old bottle ) .  a - strong dark amber appearance . i 'm not sure if it was the tap or the beer but there was a huge amount of head in glass i was served .  mouthfeel is light bodied with a watery texture .

i 've got to say though , that each and every one of them irritated me during the camping trip , but i had chalked that up to the yeti 's , arctic panzer wolves , surlys and bells that were intermixed . what 's the deal with these kirkland beers and lack of odor ? jhc the taste is malt forward , think biscuits , then a washing of bitter , floral hops , with a bit of funkiness i ca n't place .  appearance this is the best quality lite straw in color white head that leaves some lace smell light malt and some adjunents taste very bland worse than most american lagers mouthfeel thin drinkability i can finish what i have left but wont be buying it again  mouthfeel is poor for an unfiltered beer .

this brew has a clear , amber body that is typical of this style . smells watery , and oxidated ( though when i drank it i knew it was not oxidated ) . there is also a faint sweetness in there as well . slight caramel flavors are on the tongue , obviously malty and sweet .  appearance : pours a mostly clear dark red-amber color . off-white head dissipates to a film rather fast , but leaves nice lacing along the glass .  interestingly , this beer is way over carbonated to giving you quite a bite and drying the finish out too much . i do n't think it 's infected , but there 's something seriously wrong with the carbonation level .

s - kinda weak to be honest . yeasty and some sweet malt .  a : looks great . deep ruby and amber colors . decent white head and a little lacing .  m-feels thin in my mouth , almost watery , especially when compared to my expectations based on the appearance .

a very mild aroma that i could n't nail down .  pours a three-finger cream head that fades quickly to a ring leaving traces lace . nice crystal clear deep amber color .  it is slightly sour and has traces of coffee caramel and chocolate mouthfeel : is horribly carbonated . the mouthfeel is so badly carbonated that you have to struggle with the carbonation bubbles wrecking the top of your mouth .

... this brew pours up a light straw color with a little white head ... the nose is composed of slight honey and light malts ... the taste is of dry fruit ( the passion fruits ?  pouring a dark amber with a dense , light brown head with good retention and excellent lacing , this is a little light in color for a porter .  heavy carbonation from the bottle supports a thick , pillow head the color of sand . not light enough , not refreshing enough , not ... pilsner-y enough . mouthfeel : none of the characteristic scouring you 'd expect .

the aroma is pretty grainy , like bread dough , moderately strong and really not that appealing .  mcewan 's pale ale has gone through a fair few mutations over the years , as it 's now almost black . the aroma and taste , inasmuch as it has any , are mostly of roast barley .  m : light bodied and low carbonation . texture is water like and leaves a very off bitter after taste .

a very interesting farmhouse ale , with the most unique smell of any beer i have had yet . this beer smells like horse manure , plane and simple . overall : i am glad i tried this beer , and it was actually quite enjoyable ( despite the smell ) .  this brew ... my first one from legend ... pours out a golden color with good clarity . nice , thick white head leaves good , chunky lacing around the top of the glass .  a bit overcarbonated on the feel , has a very harsh tingle to it . pretty thin and wet otherwise , not impressed .

smell - i do n't smell too much from this brew , hoppy/grassy . taste - weak for a pale ale . i like more hops/bitterness in this style of brew .  appearance : copper orange , decent quarter inch head that leaves good lacing on the glass , held up to the light you can see quite a bit of yeast in suspension .  m - over-carbonated , felt like hard cider .

i 'm not normally a huge fan of pale ales , although i can stand them for a night or two , so this should be read with that in mind . the overall impression i get of this is cloying sweetness : the aroma is overpoweringly right there , like a fruit punch , almost , and this carries through to the taste , which reminds me of pear juice mixed with strawberries .  pours a slightly hazy pale yellow with an ample white , frothy head that reduces rather quickly , leaving behind a fair amount of sticky , spiderweb-like lacing .  very watery in the mouth , but there are nice roasted notes , and i was quite shocked that there were some malty traces in there .

the nose is strongly sweet and alcoholic definitely polluted with adjuncts . its very cheap .  as far as the pour was concerned , things were looking pretty good . i would try it again just to be sure my bottle was n't perhaps a `` bad '' one , but not on my dime as the pricetag is n't exactly cheap .  mouthfeel also thin .

s : sweet , nothing special . .  the choices from this brewery looked promising , so i decided to start with the `` original '' . i received an attractive pint -- golden in color , clear , nice head . often this is the result of a full pour in the pint glass , but this was under the rim .  m - overwhelmed by all this carbonation .

smells rather odd , i do n't get the pumpkin here , carmel , malt and some some spices , but no thanksgiving .  the creme brulee java stout looks and smells pretty typical for the style , thick and black , brown head , a day-old coffee grounds smell , but the taste is , literally , the worst i have ever encountered in a beer .  maybe corriander and orange peel m : flat flat flat d : not too bad , i kind of like the funkiness in this one .
no smell ? i could n't really get anything . zilch !  this beer poured a clean brown with a thin head .  carbonation is very light . it has almost a flat feel to it .

aroma is vinous ; if my eyes were closed i 'd think i was smelling a viognier or pinot gris . very weird . the nose is a strong yeasty , nutty , almost meaty flavor , but quickly backs off and leaves a weak , bubbly fruity apple flavor , with a somewhat normal finish .  a : gloden pour with a really large airy head . lot of lacings .  mouthfeel is thin and almost watery .

smell is very faint . gives off a sort of clean alcohol smell mixed with a sort of dry straw smell . thankfully , taste did not follow the nose at all , in my opinion .  reviewing by style here ... pours a nice dark amber color with about a finger of head .  watery body , i know swarz can be light but this is bmc-like . very light roasted flavor on the palate ... just weak in flavor and body .

first impression off the smell for this beer is rank off-putting . it hints at an orange or other citrus fruit , but it 's as if the citrus fruit went bad or is at least going rotten . this does not smell nice at all .  nice dark color , though not totally opaque . misses full points for not being layered like a tap black and tan .  mouthfeel is very thin and watery .
the alcohol aroma was overpowering a bit .  lots of visible carbonation with a large white head and decent retention .  the result is a thin , watery , and disappointing mouthfeel .

but the aroma , whoo , musty old socks , not expected or desired in a good belgium pa or any other brew ( except the wild ales and lambics ) .  it has an original , attractive , copper color and keeps a reasonable head .  m - watery mouthfeel is really disappointing . o - good flavor and balance , but the mouthfeel really hurts this one .

the lack of any noticeable smell was the first warning sign . almost taste/feels like a normal stout was watered down . no real flavor to speak of .  appearence : reddish brown . big rocky head .  mouthfeel was very thin .

not much nose at all .. this was a shock . slightly sweet taste but no balance at all on the hop side . it is not bad tasting but is not a ale with any real depth of taste .  batch 9871 it pours a transparent amber with a off white soapy 2 fingered head that lasted for a little bit before dying off .  m - thin-bodied with sharp , fizzy carbonation .

pale larger nose , fairly boring .  this beer pours a straw yellow color and is clear enough to read through ; decent white head with some lasting power ; little lace . an attractive pour .  feel is disappointing . very thin and watery , light body and carbonation .

not much aroma here , a bit of coffee with some sour notes . nothing at all like the aroma . some chocolate and licorice notes are in the background , as well as some root beer flavours , and a bit of hops comes through near the end .  bottle , a : pours a golden yellow with a nice white head , good retention , some lace .  soft mouthfeel , fizzy .
not much of a smell either .  a - dark dark purple colored body with a small white head .  m : prickly in the extreme . way too carbonated .

very unimpressive for an ipa t - i was expecting a big hop attack from this one , but it almost seems as if summit 's extra pale ale is more hoppy than this one .  pours a dark dark brown with a small tan head .  mouthfeel is thick and syrupy , which would be fine , except there is virtually no carbonation to give the back of your throat a break . in sum , if it were n't for the carbonation issue , this would be an extraordinary beer .

s-i 'm not getting much at all from smelling this ? ? ? just a hint of roasted malts .  pours a clear , straw , golden color with a nice fluffy head that remains a strong lace.the aroma is of yeast , grains , malts and citrus notes .  the palate is thin but ok .

aromatics are either well faded or sub-par to begin with . a light blend of malt and citrus .  pretty good retention , very nice lace . looks nice for the style .  m : that 's where the beer lacks . watery feel , really nothing extraordinary . carbonation level is a bit low for the style ( mid-low ) .

some mild fruit hidden behind a musty skunky wave . as my glass airs out , the skunk seems to go away and i can get at some of the nuances .  the orange/wood polish color is clean in the body , and it leaves some good lacing to the glass . the high carbonation with the cheap , bubbly feeling doesnt help matters either .  mouthfeel is ruined by the overcarbonation , which seems to be an issue with this brewer . other than the ultra-fizzed body , this is an okay brown ale that does even better if the chill is taken off a bit .

the aroma is ... uh ... no there .  on draft appearance- pours a clear golden color with a nice fluffy white head . good retention and a little lacing left behind . looks good , but looks can be very deceiving .  m - typical shipyard fizziness . why do all of their offerings feel like i have pop rocks in my mouth ? average .

the aromas is faint . a hint of wheat or grains .  i had great anticipation for this beer yet it turned out quite boring . very dark raw umber in color .  m-carbonation is present , but low , maybe lacking . body is flabby . signature creaminess is n't really here .

smell : lemon dish soap , green bananas , sourdough bread ; an odd melange of weak , strange flavors .  once poured , it glowed a hazy golden orange with hay-colored highlights . the foam quickly rose to just under two fingers thick and left minimal lacing along the glass .  this beer is over carbonated and will make you burp like your grandfather used to .

the nose was very non descript with hints of skunkiness to it .  it pours with promise , a good head on its shoulders - i felt hope for a moment . i was under the impression that i might be able to lay back into the foam , rest on the lacing , point my nose to the ceiling and call it a day . i had the wrong impression . the only saving grace here was the actual appearance of a good ipa , which only counts on camera , and since nobody was filming me drink it , that did n't really matter .  again , the carbonation is very sharp on the tip of my tongue , which kills a lot of the missing flavor maybe ? i am not impressed by the flavor , but i 'd still take it over a macro .

the smell is kind of strange on this one . it 's not the most pleasant smell on a beer . it seems a little out of place .  a - pours a nice transparent amber color with a nice head and a decent amount of lacing for a pils .  almost flat and not very impressive m - carbonation is low and mouthfeel is thin and watery .

smell : barely any aroma with this as the description touted it was brewed with black barley , roasted barley , and chocolate malt .  a-pours a dark brown color with three fingers of light brown sugar head .  m 2 light and fizzy , too fizzy .

smell- very pedestrian ... almost no scent at all .  poured into a pint glass and was initially impressed by the color , head was an off white color and the aroma had a bit of a sweet smell .  a - poured into a glass , gold in color , nice thick white head , good lacing s - grains , a little hops , not much really t - okay here it goes , metallic , sweet , light hops , grassy , not a lot of flavor , crisp m - thin , goes down like water , some carbonation , a little hoppy bite in the finish d - no doubt i could slam back a few of these fairly quickly , especially when it 's hot .

overall : the scent is misleading , but when the emphasis is bitters in the taste , scent is irrelevant ; well balanced with character and bitters .  poured a very nice dark brown almost black .  soapy and bitter . no complexity , nothing to savor , nothing that entices the palate , nothing that slakes the thirst . huge let down .

smell reminded of heineken for some reason .  reviewed 7/27/2009 ( bottle ) : pours an extremely dark reddish brown colored body , with an average tan-white colored head , diminishing .  mouthfeel - very thin .

smells a little piney , kind of sweet , but the scent is not strong . it is refreshing , crisp , and has more taste than most other mexican beers .  a : i like the ruby red look of it . definitely inviting .  serving type : bottle at the beach appearance : transparent yellow/goldish ... taken straight from the bottle most of the time smell : smells like my frat house taste : i do n't know ... mouthfeel : like seltzer water , but not as bad as some of the macro's drinkability : sure , i could drink this all day long , especially on a hot summer day at the beach - but would i enjoy it ?

all in all this is a decent imperial ipa . the beer would have been tremendously improved had the citrus tones and malt been able to overpower the somewhat hot smell and taste from a 9.5 abv beer .  pours a nice caramel/amber color with adequate head and lacing .  mouthfeel is light bodied with a mild effervescence and a thin and watery finish .

s - the smell is weak and a little bitter . t - mild flavor , nothing special .  a bungundy colored beer with a full head of good density . looks great , but does not appear to be bottle conditioned .  carbonation on this is tough to handle for me . very fizzy .

the smell is very weak . smells like pennies with a malty undertone .  1 1/2 finger head of light brown head . nice retention , not so much lacing . 5.99 for a 4 pack seemed like a bargain , but i understand why it 's that cheap .  the mouthfeel is rather disappointing for the style and really is what separates this from a quality belgian . quite watery and light to medium bodied .

aroma : surprising there is not much of anything .  purs an ipa-ish orange amber with a big white sudsy head .  thin and uninspiring . contained none of the characteristics typically found in a stout . this is more like a light bodied porter .

s - ricey and adjuncty . smells a lot like pbr ( that 's not necessarily and insult ... .i like pbr ) .  i opened the bottle and the first thing that hit me was the bitter aroma . after i took the light sip and let the golden liquid roll across my mouth i swallowed . i noticed two very distinct problems , first off the beer seemed to coat my mouth with something , secondly it had a very bitter and dry aftertaste .  mouth : thin and veering toward over-carbonation . almost like cola .

i like chocolate , but to me this was a cheap kahlua imitation . forturnately the taste was much better , a nice balance of sweet and bitterness.if only the odor was different . the bottle date was 3/19/11 .  this beer seems well suited to hot weather swilling , but i 'd chose another summer beer myself . though one may not notice a hop *flavor* , it must be those cascade hops noted on the bottle giving it that crispness . overall , kind of weak , and the citrusy flavor from the lime leaves just made it seem a little strange . after moving to oregon three months ago ( and wanting to try all the here-beer i could ) , this was the first non-nw six pack i bought , mostly because it was on a good clearance sale and because it 's new belgium .  there 's no carbonation , which was really a letdown for me . the overall mouthfeel was thin and unimpressive .
the smell was a bit skunkey .  looks good in the glass . plenty of foamy/ rocky head .  mouthfeel is pretty thin and watery .

i had this can of beer in a `` yuengling porter '' goblet a : this beer pours a pale yellow collor with a fading head s : this beer has a small hint of barley to it t : this beer has a tast of corn and malts to it .  we were very excited -- we love witbiers and we love michigan beers . not a metaphor , as in it smelled bad , but rather a whiff was identical to that of a portapotty . it 's witbier with a little extra something , which i found does n't add much to the whole experience . particularly at over 3x the cost of 'regular ' and very good witbier , we wish it were better ...  m - overly carbonated , not very stout-like at all .

on the nose , this was about 50 % skunked -- i 've had worse , but i 've only had it once from the bottle without at least some funk .  a = poured a golden yellow with a thin foam head . looked great .  m : too much carbonation and very thin and watery .

what lacks in smell and apperance is brought up in taste and mouth feel .  poured into allagash tulip . a- bright hazy yellow with a nice snowdrift head .  i was really not impressed with this one . i probably will not be buying this one again although i have had worse beers . and i can not seem to put any food that might taste good with it maybe bbq ?

very musty smell to it , like the corner of a gym shower .  pours a deep amber hue , highly carbonated with a good thick head which surprisingly stays compact and together for a long period , leaving some good lace . it seduces you in with it promising looks , frothy head and unassuming aroma then stabs you with the taste from hell .  it had a thin and watery mouthfeel and reminded me of a shandy ... or maybe just a lemon soda .

no smell at all ... ok , its mild but i know its beer .  appearance : black with brown highlights . one fingerbreadth light brown head of mostly tight bubbles .  the body was very weak and insubstantial .

very pungent . tastes better than it smells .  pours a veer mahogany reddish brown clear color with an off white tan blond head that leaves some lacing .  mouthfeel is almost non-existent ; standard macro thin feel .

maybe i just ca n't smell . t - nice smooth beer . can feel a distinct rice hops .  appearance : light black colour with some deep ruby highlights when put against the light . it fades rather quickly but successfully maintains a little bit of the foam as the beer is consumed . good amount of lacing .  when i walk in and see that all they have is watery lite/light beers i look for the darkest one . it has good flavor , but it 's so thin that you forget you 're drinking a beer . after a while the aftertaste begins to build up in your mouth and you wish you had some clorox to gargle . so this beer is n't great , but it 's better than drinking miller lite , bud light , or coors light all night .

s : aroma is faint , with little that is distinguishable . though decent , it pales in comparison to some of their other flavors .  appearance : dark copper color with a large off-white head that leaves behind pretty thick lace .  just typical of the style , upon further review ( 2nd bottle ) way too cloying mf : thinnish with lively carbonation drinks a bit slow , too much cornyness .

gold colored ... .fizzy , bubbly off-white head of about a 1/2 inch ... nose is not very good ... not a skunky smells but along those lines..maybe fishy would be a better way to characterize it ... does n't smell like an apa should smell ... first impression on the buds ? ... blood ... metallic ... .you get accustomed to it as you drink it but it is not pleasant ... .there is a soft english style hop flavor under the blood tones..also some bscuit tones ... body is rather light ... not a recommended beer here ... has an off smell and flavor ... .not a lot of hop flavor ... thinnish ... .i will not drink this one again ... .i 've heard their big beers are pretty good and hopefully i can try them but this is not a good pale ale  the beer looks nice and the bottle tries hard to stand out , but that 's about all i like about this beer .  reviewed 10/26/2007 ( tap @ dragonmead brewery , warren , mi ) : pours a clear pale amber colored body , with a pure white head , small bubbles . spices , deep woods . floral , light flavor . some spices , watery . somewhat alcoholy .

s : chocolate aroma has an extract- or liqueur-like quality -- dark but not at all unctuous . there is also an inauthentic dark fruit quality that reminds of medicinal artificial cherry . it is limited by the unpleasant smell , doomed to the status of wild experiment .  750ml batch 3 bottle into a birra del borgo tulip . it pours a black body with a finger of coarse tan foam . decent retention and light lacing .  super thin and carbonated for the style .

smells like ... nothing . maybe a lil ' lactic sour , a lil ' bit roasty but i think i 'm just projecting the way i remember guinness rather than what i really smell . tastes like a watered down irish stout .  thus , i didnt want to give it such a low rating , but the beer forced my hand . i am a big fan of amber beers , but this one just lacks taste .  the mouthfeel is too much to handle - one small sip allows for an explosion of fiz that takes up my entire mouth making it hard for me to really enjoy this .

there is , perhaps a slight accumulation of bubbles around the edges that get released when it 's swirled . minimal character on the nose . a bit of grainy sweetness , but very little else . not a lot to it , but it 's inoffensive at least . it 's mild and inoffensive , perhaps a little too sweet after a while , but otherwise pretty forgettable .  thanks to chris for the arkansas tick . a - orangish copper beer with a finger of head that had good retention and left a bit of lacing .  ingredients : water , light barley malt , brewer barley , rye malt , sugar . lifeless feel with weak carbonation and cloying sweetness . sweet like soda , somewhat astringent .
does n't smell like much of anything .  pours a very dark brown almost black color with a thick head that dissolves into a thin lace .  m - very light , too light actually .

as far as mexican lagers go , this is probably my favorite . there is a distinct flavor of corn present .  even an easy pour produced a thick 3-finger white head over a cloudy golden/orange liquid . the head retention was good but the lacing was minimal .  watery texture and not very well balanced .

aroma is not so great . slightly vegetal , cooked malts , some hop aroma , but nothing overboard . aroma is about half of regular dead guy , not double . most certainly not a doppelbock which makes me wonder why it was listed so in the first place .  a - a nice black-red body with a red-brown head . the head , however , does n't last long at all .  first sip reveals an average to lite body with very fine fizzy carbonation that bubbles and then disappears quickly . the beer goes completely thin and watery on the swallow .

s - smells of light pumpkins , spices , wheat , grain , and bready malts . thought the smell was lacking spices and pumpkin , and the taste had very little . would not want to have again .  appearance : pours to a dark , translucent orange with a small off-white head .  this beer very thin in feel , the head contributes some thickness , but not enough .

had that musty smell that hits the nose as soon as the bottlecap pops off .  pours pale copper , with a good large head that shows great lacing but little persistence .  mouthfeel is a disappointment , with a nearly flat , slick character . [ note : upon opening the can i noticed nothing that would indicate problems with carbonation . aside from the weak mouthfeel , this is a solid take on the style that first got me into craft beer several years ago ( altbier , that is , not `` american amber ale '' as denoted on this website ) .

s - smells like a dirty locker room . skunky and skanky . nothing really bubbly or i might just be smell-blind t - hoppy goodness .  pours a nice really dark brown with a small dark brown head that fades fast .  mouthfeel is quite thin , which is evident from the first sip .

smell : not much smell but some malt and hops .  three floyds needs to expand out of it 's hop profile , and try something new . this beer tasted similar to the dreadnaught with a touch of coffee on the finish .  the palate is thin .

faint caramel in the nose , some bready malt , and little else . i 'd rather see five failures somehow redeemed but a couple of great brews , but flying dog is consistently mediocre in every regard .  a : pours a bright , crystal-clear pale gold color . the tall , foamy white head has decent retention . some soapy lacing forms an irregular but persistent pattern on the glass .  refreshing , might be better enjoyed on a sunny day m : do n't like the feel , light and watery , the carbonation bites at the inside of my mouth d : easy to drink , although most light bodied beers are .

s : virtually none - if i close my eyes and wish real hard , i can detect a little yeast , but that 's about the end of it . a bit dull , perhaps , but there 's really nothing distinctly objectionable about it .  deep honey gold color with the requisite ring of head ; no lacing . this has a lot better/deeper color than most in the style .  m : light , lacking body .
s : grainy , husky nose . t : taste like banana , comes from the yeast strain .  tawny , copperish orange body with a finger of filmy , off-cream head .  mouthfeel is thin week and lackluster .
very faint smell of carmel/malt .  pretty boring , yellow with a white head , pretty good retention and lacing .  the mouthfeel is medium bodied and watery .

smells of rice and also sides toward sweet and not as dry as the name .  a pink-tinged peach with a slighly rose colored head . fair retention . slightly cloudy with mild carbonation . if you 'd like to pay $ 4 to drink 11.2 ounces of orval with a mouthful of cocktail olives , you 've arrived .  mouthfeel : extremely thin - what were you expecting from ab ?

a - poured a clear straw , forming a 1 inch white head . s - very strong aroma of grain . nothing else is really detectible .  a : pours near black with a thick , bubbly , dark tan head that slowly faded into a thick fuzzy film .  mouthfeel is thin and very watery cool can .

maybe it is because i lived most of my life in the burgh , but i really like ic light . sure it is n't anything to write home about but it is refreshing and a good mediator beer . keeps you from getting totally wasted in the burgh which is easy to do because beer is so cheap .  i was not expecting the massive carbonated head that laces incredibly thick all the way down .  obviously it is watery mouthfeel - very carbonated drinkability - this is the best thing about this beer .

in the nose is apple cider vinegar with a hint of cinnamon .  very nice auburn/caramel sort of a color .  ) the mouth feel is very thin , but it is a highly drinkable beer as is demonstrated by the unimaginable numebr of cases they sell each week .

they had the lager , ale , stout , and pale ale on tap . the aroma is mostly non-existent.meaning i do not smell much . the german pilsner malt used to make the beer is prevalient.it starts the tastein the middle there is a swath of malt , then it becomes bitter on the pallet after the swallow .  a - opaque brown body , with a finger of creamy off-white head . the dunkel weizen character is entirely missing here .  not much in the way of a mouth feel , but almost watery though .

a : light yellow , pretty bubly head s : a bit skunky , probably because of the green bottle t : a wery smooth and sweet maltiness , that i like , and it seems to be `` done '' unlike other non alcoholics witch tastes a bit unfermented .  pours out as all foam and ends up light brown with a light creamy head as it quickly settles .  m - a bit of a harsh mouthfeel .

appearance - translucent copper color that yielded a tan head that only lasted for about 3 seconds smell - not pleasant at all , typical euro skunk odor , grass , hay taste - some more of that euro skunk taste , i can detect a bit of malt and molasses as well mouthfeel - light to medium bodied , medium carbonation , slightly bitter upfront as well as in the finish overall - sort of disappointed in this one , also made me think about something , why do breweries even bother putting their beer in green bottles anyways ?  if you are a drinker of stouts , and like founder 's mainstay stouts , then this will be a disappointment . definetly a stout for beginners who like hazelnut coffee . she hates stouts but said this was a `` good '' one . ordered a oatmeal stout next to get the taste out of my mouth .  thin , fizzy , clingy , and burning .

smells like peat , malt , trainstation bathroom . after i got over the aroma the mildness and longevity of the flavor is amazing .  hmm ... the pour is bright light orange with a white head that shrinks , but never leaves the beer exposed .  mouthfeel is nothing special , sparkling water almost .

looked great in terms of color , but no nose to speak of . weyerbacher 's quad is superior across the board to my mind , including price in my neck of the woods .  650ml bomber poured into tulip 8/1/12 a hazy golden orange with little for carbonation , head , or lace looks like a still glass of beer . perhaps a dirty glass because the second pour gives me a long lasting thumbs width of off white foam that leaves a few partial rings of lace s cotton candy and orange-sicle with a little booze and sour tea bag dipped in solvent t quite sweet and a sour citrus thing does n't help its cause , some grassy caramel , not a very good dipa , tastes a little off and has a thrills gum thing going on too m a little flat and syrupy , sticks too the lips but only a little heat from the booze , sugary aftertaste o too sweet with off flavors , not a dipa i 'd drink again not sure what i was expecting for my 3 $ bomber but i still feel ripped off .  almost watery . the carbonation is almost nonexistent .

nothing to smell really , very light .  the appearance of the beer is quite pleasing with a black color and nice ( nitro-induced ) head .  m : very frothy , silky and then ... soapy . very metallic with a strange mouthfeel .

the glass has a nice transparent brown hue and it does n't smell like much of anything .  a green swing-top on this one ... clear yellow-gold with a nice upcharging head of 1/4 inch that laces nicely .  mouthfeel was surprisingly thin .

the aroma was very grainy/grassy with some malty hints .  poured a totally opaque black into my glass . nice off-white colored head didnt last and had no lacing .  damn near flat . with ample carbonation , this would be a nice experiment .

it 's smell was non-existent and the taste was weak with some hint of malt but not as robust as i prefer .  really nice label and bottle with corkage . pourd into a pint glass about 1/2 full becasue the rest was light fizzy head whcih settled quite quickly .  m- way , way too carbonated . it makes the thinner body feel worse

sadly , no aroma i could detect ; there 's plenty of flavor , however . if only it had smelled like something ... anything ...  poured into my perfect pint ... light golden with a pretty nice thick head ... fairly light for an oktoberfest ... hmm.. lots of creamed corn aromas here ... not dark roasted maltiness ... no honey like aromas ... just corn ... fairly average straightforward brew here ... .  wimpy mouthfeel .
lots of malt here , really not that much else at all .  a great brown with no head , i think that is more to do with how the jp cafe pours than the beer .  it felt very thin and watery as expected .

s- very faint , almost none kinda grassy . t- average . overall its worth a try but its nothing too interesting or special .  aggressive pour from a can into an imperial pint glass . the frothy white head reached the brim of the glass and then disappeared nearly as fast as it formed without leaving a trace of it 's once vibrant existance . lots of carbonation up front , but if you 're not pounding this one you 'll wonder where it went . overall not bad for the price ... definitely would pick this over most macros , but far from the top of my list .  ppurs pitch black and syrupy with zero carbonation , ergo , not foamy goodness rests atop . the mouthfeel killed this one for me .

smell : a rather rough smell . astringent alcohol with biting hops . a slight roasted scent , but it 's unappetizing .  poured a deep amber color , with a smalish head that did n't last and no visible lacing .  t. i love the taste , for a cheap beer it is quite good m. very watery d. i can and do drink this beer all night long .

a-3.5 golden clear thin head nice lace s-2 weak grain t-3.5 good beer taste for a adjuct lager , leans toward grain m-3 real good feel  poured into a tulip . this one pours a hazy golden straw color with about a finger of white foam .  mouthfeel is thin and a bit watery .

ingredients : malts , hopps , sugars , flavorings . a beer lacking flavor or character . sept. 2003 review edit : aug. 29 2003 although i do not know what the hell anyone is doing putting sugar and flavorings in a pale ale for , this beer has a mild attractive malt flavor . with ab crap taking such a large share of worldwide production volume , bud would have to be average ( and thus get straight threes ) , in this context bass pale ale would be a 4 .  it had a deep red color and average cabonation with good head retention .  almost has the mouthfeel of crme soda and is drinkable as a thirst quencher .

it had a faint smell not different from many other light beers .  poured into tulip glass ... a- very deep blood brown color with a finger head .  m- medium weight , slightly thin body that is completely flat .

the aroma is severely lacking . i do n't smell anything here that i might not smell in a macro , unfortunately . i detect faint grassy tones and perhaps a bit of corn , despite the fact that this is an all-malt lager .  it is gold , with a huge white , lasting head and pretty nice lacing .  a very watery taste and mouthfeel . noticeable malt , but it tastes like they watered down my beer . too watery to be very drinkable . but light , so it helps its drinkability a little .

has a nice flavor but lacks aroma .  thanks for the extra ! pours black with a slight , i do n't know ... kind of purplish hint to the dark brown edging and foam .  the flavor is bland , it is very fizzy and quenches summer thirst when served ice cold from a can . a-b products are usually not my thing but the michelob line is alright .
first smell was disappoining , reminding me of burnt corn .  bought a bottle of this expecting great things and leaving very disappointed .  watery . needs more body .

s- wheaty grain aroma . there is n't much here . t- starts out with pronounced hops .  a : rich amber body with a nice white tea that offers up some lacing .  mouthfeel was really thin and watery with a better , cleaner taste than leaded .

a : hazy golden color with a thick long lasting and sticky white head s : smells like it 's high in alcohol with a burnt rubber smell .  a - nice reddish brown color , a little bit hazy ( translucent but not transparent ) . good two finger head is just slightly off white/ tan , and it sticks around pretty well .  thin body brew with very little to offer in terms feel . watery .

aroma is grainy and a bit of a corn aroma too , both being a bit stronger than your typical adjunct beer . cheap beer will always have a place in my fridge because i hate to waste good beer on a wrecked palate and at 99cents for a 24oz can i will gladly add this to my list of worthy cheap beers .  on draft at asia cafe in d.c. a : the beer is very effervescent and light yellow in color .  m-feels medium bodied but watery at the same time . seems flat .

the nose is unimpressive , sweet maltiness , strong influences of grassiness , sulfur , oddly euro-lager in nature . frankly , the bouquet repulses me . the nose ruins any favorable impression of this beer ; i do like the hoppiness of the palate but little else .  pours a clean copper/ orange-ish color , with a light tan head .  thin harsh mouthfeel .

there was a distinct unpleasant aroma present upon opening , but after pouring and letting stand for about 2 minutes this became much less pronounced .  it is very earthy , flowery , and generally not `` beerish '' . i guess if i had something with which to compare , i could say whether it is a good gruit or not . very interesting take on `` ale '' . if you like herbal tea you will probably enjoy this `` beer '' .  pretty thin for the style and very little coating .

straight out of the bottle , it smells a little skunky maybe , and some herbal hop-type aromas come through . i 'm smelling a bit of malt now , but very subdued .  the color was a very nive golden clear with good white head that laced ncely .  mouthfeel , as i mentioned , is way too light , turning this beer into a fizzy bitter water .

it 's fine to sip a little bit , but not something i 'd be very interested in and the aroma is really quite odd .  pours a nice dark tan color but that 's about the only good of this .  everything suggested about complexity and structure within the nose and the appearance is met with a waters , formless and thin feeling beer . some wheat prevails , and some smoothness of texture , but there is not half as much of the pillowy champagne carbonation that i would have wanted .

single tallboy can ; pours that familiar pale straw colour topped with a lofty two-finger bone white head . the smell is almost undetectable but i 'm not entirely sure that 's a bad thing . tap water also usually smells pretty clean though . rice adjunct and grainy , diluted barley malts are basically the only flavours .  this beer pours like a perfect pumpkin ale -- nice deep orange color with a white head .  this makes way too thin bodied .

smell - pretty weak . a noticeable but small berry scent greets you on the first sip .  a-ink black body ; mocha colored head . s-dry grain smell , cardboard t-old hops , stale , some sweet grain flavor m-medium and very watery d-not a very good representation of the style .  the mouthfeel is flat , slick and oily . it tastes like the beer has been watered down .

very subtle light fruit aroma with hints of earthy hops , spice and faint hops . very bland and uninteresting .  the beer poured a rich amber with good carbonation that provided a decent head that laced somewhat .  the body was thin for the style , almost watery , and did n't linger on the tongue .

from 12/15/10 notes : a- white ( ! ) one-fingered head with a light to mid pale golden color . s- burnt . grassiness turns to bitterness .  the beer poured a beautiful translucent dark red colour with a very thin white head that dissipates quite quickly .  body is watery , especially considering the rich flavours .

smells like weak malt with a weird off scent that i ca n't quite put my finger on .  solid finger of dirty khaki brown head .  the mouthfeel is far too thin for the style though , leaving its drinkability only mediocre .

s : not much to the smell , a little grainy .  pours a dark blush , it 's red , very red . decent two finger head recedes to a cap and laces adequatlely .  i think that the lack of carbonation ultimately hurts this beer ; the extra carbonation would add sum much needed body to this beer , which would help balance the sweetness .

slight citrus , little hops , honestly a bit of a foul smell close to fart really is all im picking up .  honestly i think there most have been something wrong with the tap line ... a : looked good .  the mouthfeel is on the lighter side of medium bodied with a watery texture , and aggressive carbonation . however , the thin body really detracts from my enjoyment of the rest of the beer .

i smell nothing . no cherry .  the color was light gold . at first the color was clear and then it clouded up . the head was good .  this is a pretty dark lager.it 's honey colored , but the head is small and disappears fast.this smells a little hoppy , with some fruitiness and yeast.this is n't a bad tasting lager.it 's hoppier than most with a hint of cooked veggies or fruit.the big problem with this beer is the weak head and the poor m/f.this is very weak and watery , which leads me to say i do n't think i 'd buy this again .

s : the nose is incredibly buttery . there 's a slight nuttiness as well as a sweet , almost maple syrup like , aroma .  i used to drink it on tap in ireland , where it was good ; then had to settle for guinness foreign extra stout ( which is the malt liquor of stout ) in a bottle in southeast asia , then suffered through guinness extra cold on tap in australia , only to come home to the us after twenty years and experience guinness draught ( in a can ) .  mouthfeel is poor , with not enough carbonation to carry the drink and a thin body . the main flaw ( mouthfeel ) ca n't really be corrected with age .

it kinda smelled like a botttle of heineken . this was a very good beer with the exception of the smell . i ca n't wait to get a hold of another one .  another crappy beer in a sea of crappy beers ... pours nice and dark with red glow visible when held up to a light.. creamy slight head left after a pour , bubbly lacing clings to the glass and the beer retains nothing . each sip is like an assault on the senses leaving the drinker with zero pleasure and fists-full of broken beer dreams .  the body was far too thin for a stout , i 've had pale ales that were more mouthfilling .

the smell is odd at first . i get a faint unpleasent odor that fades as the beer warms .  clear gold with a sticky head of white foam . good looking beer , but not much else good to say about this one .  mouthfeel of quickly fading , no presense beer .

the aroma seemed a little off-putting at first ; i was hit with a strange yeasty sour milk smell . once i could get past that , bready/caramel malt and earthy hops were also detected .  pours a thick , cloudy orange color . a heaping pile of white foam tops this one off .  very dry throughout the palate , and really quite watery , if not thin . just feels very wet and then leaves very dry .

straw yellow pour with a little head that is gone in a minute . no aroma to speak of except a faint sweetcorn aroma .  maybe my visit to the independence brew pub helped me rate this one so low , see my beerfly review , but i really did not enjoy this beer . it started well , with a nice dark brown pour with a foamy tan head , but i was really looking for a creamy stout that had a great deal of body -- this was not the beer i should have had it that case .  mouthfeel is nearly the same as the anniversary beers . for a stout , this is considered watery .

s- quite weak ... .light hints of bready maltiness .  bottle : poured a deep bright yellow color beer with a medium pure white foamy head with surprisingly good retention .  m-this is were this beer suffers most ... .thin..almost cola thin . too thin to be taken seriously and what is that odd sourness ?

the aroma is filled with toasted grains , bread , caramel and an earthy notion ; all of which is pleasant . the taste is more enjoyable than the aroma . it started off with refined , earthy hop bent which is quickly enveloped in toasted grains left and right . aside from some of the strange aromatics ( which do seem slightly tamed as it warms up more ) , it 's pleasant enough to drink .  it 's a really deep , dark color .  i was n't impressed however with the nitro-can ( i never know how to pour properly with those things ) and the mouthfeel and level of carbonation suffered because of it .

used a duvel tulip glass and it poured hazy gold with a 2 inch sudsy/foamy head that stuck around for a few minutes ; smells of yeast , light malt , wheat and some light spices - very mild overall odor with only the malt jumping out , yet the smell somehow filled the room . it was strange for a blond to be so potent , which is something i did n't expect .  appearance light yellow in color , like a yellow highlighter , with a very nice-looking head that showed some good retention and left some awesome belgian lacing on the inside of my glass .  m : no carb what so ever , dead flat which made this harder to drink .

at first waft all i smell is a metallic note . i smell again and get a mild hit of green apple .  poured out of the corked and caged 750ml bottle into a flute type glass . a - pours a hazy light raspberry red color . pours a light pink head that is very small and is gone within seconds . kinda looks like mold now that i think of it . looks great and i 'm ready to indulge .  mouthfeel : medium body with a dry finish . the carbonation is way too much , kind of like a cheap champagne . overall : this beer would be above average if it was n't so over carbonated .

the smell is similar to beef stew ; not attractive .  tastes like corona that 's been sitting in the sun for days . very nice foamy head and nice bubbles . i really ca n't taste anything except for sourness .  m/d : very light and high carbonation . thin and watery .

absolutely no detectable nose ... i could smell a thing . mouthfeel is light . i ca n't make my mind up about this brew ... i usually enjoy most magic hat offerings , but this one may need another taste later ...  pours a slightly coppery light gold color with head that stood up about 5mm above the rim of the glass .  the feel was pretty poor . it was like flat soda .
